title: A new, high level of customer service!
text: You don't often see excellent customer service these days, but Joe Panarella, hospitality manager at Le Meridien Central Park, exemplifies these values. When I checked in to the hotel, the only room available was next to the elevator---not ideal, but good for the hotel that they were fully booked. The next day, Joe unsolicited, reached out and upgraded me to a much better room. Given that I was set to spend much of the day in the room on zoom calls, this was an incredibly kind and welcome gesture. I will be coming back to Le Meridien Central Park in the future, and recommending it to friends and colleagues.

title: 10/10 Recommend!
text: I stayed at Le Meridien over 3 weeks for a business trip and had a wonderful experience from start to finish - the rooms are well-kept and I appreciated their dark-toned wood style/decor. Guest services was always prompt when it came to any requests/questions and the lobby & front desk staff were extremely kind and helpful throughout the stay. Amazing location and only a couple blocks away from 5th ave and central park! Would 100% recommend!

title: Dana Steer and Chris Carrow from the concierge team are exceptional!
text:
I want to write this review to thank Dana Steer and Chris Carrow for being so competent, responsive and genuinely kind.  I called the concierge team in hopes they would be able to help my boss retrieve her luggage from the airport since we didn't think it made it on to the flight she barely got on in time.  

Dana helped me stay calm as he knew exactly what to do and described what the situation would entail, so we could help my boss know what to do when she landed.  She had to be in a deposition and there is no way she would have time to wait or rely on the airline to get her the luggage.  

Chris took over when Dana's shift was done and let us know each step along the way of who they were securing to get the luggage and all the information needed to satisfy the airport/airline rules for this.  His responsiveness was so helpful during this uncertain experience.

In the end, we were all so relieved to find out that United Airlines somehow got her luggage on her flight even though the app didn't have that info updated, and they told us it wasn't on the flight over the phone.  Thankfully, it was!

Chris checked in with my boss once she checked in to the hotel and she wrote us back at the office with how impressed she was with him and that he was very kind. 

Having Dana and Chris's support made a chaotic situation manageable for us.  It is so appreciated especially going into a high pressure experience where you need to be calm and focused like a deposition.

title: Erald and Brian are Awesome
text:

WE enjoyed the city and were able to get around so easily as the location is great. WE shared a Jr. suite with our 2 kids and it was cool .

text:

His personality is perfect for this hotel. He should be running the entire hotel as he is the kind of person Marriott should want to represent them. It’s also in a great area and close to trains! Thanks Joe and we will see you all of a sudden! Thanks again from the 3 girls you made very happy!

title: Remarkable service and hospitality!
text: A coworker and I recently were in New York City for a business trip and we stayed at Le Meridien New York, Central Park and it was an excellent stay. There were a couple of things at the start of our stay that we were not pleased about; when I brought it to one of the staff members attention he fixed the problems immediately. He went out of his way to make sure our time there was stress free. The gentleman's name was Joe Panarella. Joe was extremely hospitable and very understanding. He is an incredible person and I will definitely go back to see him. I will suggest this location to my associates for future trips.

title: Some of the best service in NYC!
text: Joe from housekeeping is above and beyond incredible! I came here for business and he was so accommodating, making sure I had extra of anything I needed. He kindly greeted himself when he got on the elevator and made it known if we needed him he is available. You don't get service like he provides now a days. 10/10 service and I would highly recommend this establishment for any future stays

title: Nice hotel, Joe to the rescue
text: Stayed here for an overnight visit to NYC and had a nice time. First off, don't book through Expedia or one of their partners. I keep my loyalties with Marriott properties 90% of the time & almost always book directly, but had a ton of credit card points & used Chase's portal which is run by Expedia. It's not the hotel's fault, but booking through there sold a room with a view of Central Park that I guess they do not have any longer, so we entered to a regular room instead of one with a view of Central Park. I went to the front desk to bring it up & though they didn't have to, the manager Joe intervened and helped us out and got us a room higher up that had a better view of Central Park, even though there's a new building under construction across the street that will eventually block almost the whole view. :( From here on out, smooth sailing. Our room was nice, and while small, I wonder if reviewers here know that in NYC you aren't going to get large sprawling rooms like you would in middle-of-nowheresville. For two adults, it was perfectly fine - you're there to sleep and shower, not stay in it. King bed had room to walk around and a good amount of storage. Bathroom was nicely cleaned, shower was great, water was hot when I needed it. Maybe my eyes are better than others, but the room lighting was perfectly acceptable from the desk to the lamp to the bedside - all good. We did have a drink and side dish at the attached lobby bar while waiting for our room switch and the experience there was also great, attentive server, good food, and good service. They also held our bags after we checked out and did some exploration of the city before our train back home, which was nice. Easy access to multiple subway lines to get around NYC or to get to from Penn Station. Would definitely consider for any future visits, but this time I'll book direct.

title: AVOID This Hotel - Pick a Better Option Nearby!
text:
This property was so disappointing and is the first property I have ever left early because I just could not stay there for my entire trip.  I stayed in a suite at this property a year ago and I did like that room (but note the suites used to face Central Park, and they now face a massive construction project on 57th Street blocking the park view, so even those rooms may not be what you expect now), but we tried a regular room this time.  That was a terrible idea.  The room was tiny, extremely outdated, had dingy carpet, was dimly lit (the "desk" light did not even work - and "desk" is in quotes since nobody could actually work in that space), and had an awkward bed that is practically on the floor with a strange nautical-looking wood closet/giant headboard behind it.  To be fair, the room is still better than a Motel 6 -- probably -- but for over $350/night, this property is absolutely not worth it (if the price was $150 to $200, I might reconsider for a short trip of one or two nights, but not a longer one).   

I am only giving this property 2 stars because the location is great, and the staff was genuinely friendly and helpful.  When I told the front desk that I was leaving early, they were helpful at getting me checked out (and didn't seem entirely surprised that I wanted to leave).  The staff does clearly care about guests, which counts for something and I appreciated that.  

If you're looking for a property in this area of Manhattan, I moved to the Thompson next door (a Hyatt property) and it was great and only slightly more per night.  The Residence Inn/Courtyard south of Columbus Circle is also very nice and usually priced similar to this property (and actually worth that price).

Also - do not be fooled.  If you stayed at the Parker Meridian before, this is not that property.  From what I understand, this is the former Viceroy, which already had poor reviews when it existed and the rooms have not gotten any better since then.  This could be a nice property, but it it needs a massive renovation of all rooms to get it there.

title: Our best hotel find in NYC!
text: We just got back from a weekend in New York City.  We stayed at the Le Meridien New York, Central Park.  I cannot say enough nice things about this property.  We arrived a little early but there was no problem at all, our room was ready.  It was on the 9th floor with a little balcony with a table and chairs.  We have never had a balcony room in the city before, such a nice surprise!  The room was immaculate, nicely decorated and had a beautiful bathroom with a nice sized shower.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  Downstairs in the hotel there is a little restaurant which was excellent.  We ate there at least three times between breakfast, lunch and dinner.  All of the staff, from the front desk to the doormen, were very professional and eager to help.  We were also lucky enough to meet Joe Panarella, the operations manager of the hotel.  He made sure we had everything we needed and was so friendly and personable.  The hotel was walking distance to Central Park, museums and Broadway which was great because we had reservations for a couple of shows.  There were restaurants, pharmacies and shopping right outside the hotel and the neighborhood felt very safe.  We would definitely stay in this hotel any time that we visit New York City.  Its in such a great location, the price was right, it was lovely and we would highly recommend it to anyone.

text:

title: Great location , average hotel.
text:
The hotel is in a great location . Next to 5th Ave and Central Park .
Very nice Restuarant on the ground floor for breakfast . 
However the hotel itself and the rooms are  basic . Small , dark and poor bathroom amenities. 
I stayed here many years ago and remembered it as been much better .
A place to stay for its location more than for the quality of the hotel. The hotel is functional and not in the luxury category.

title: Central Park Flop House
text: I travel frequently for business and have stayed in a broad range of hotels around the world.  I can generally count on certain brands such as Hyatt and Marriott to provide consistently high quality.  However, my recent stay (February 2024) at Le Meridien in NYC (a Marriott Hotel), was the exception. This hotel is a disaster from the burnt out/ flickering lights in the lobby to the dirty, dark and dank hotel rooms.  My hotel room was not only small, but was next to the elevator (VERY noisy) and was old and dirty (the carpet was stained and appears not to have been replaced in years and the bathroom was equally disgusting).  To make matters worse, no one informed me that there was major construction right across the street which started early in the morning and did not end until early evening and that the street in front of the hotel was dug up and there were metal plates in the road that made a very loud noise every time a bus or car ran over them throughout the night.  In short this hotel SHOULD BE AVOIDED AT ALL COST until Marriott invests in refurbishing the hotel to at least get it to a 3 star standard (it is no where close to that today).

title: Beware credit card info stolen even though had privacy placard on door
text: We are so disappointed. staff walked into our room without our permission. We have privacy sign up. We knew because they turned AC on 60. I had my credit cards in my purse. The next day I received fraud alerts from all my credit cards that were in my purse on authorized  purchases. Advice, lock your things up because as we found out, privacy signs don’t matter.

title: Great service

title: Great option for midtown prices closer to Central Park
text: My husband & I had to reschedule our anniversary trip last minute because I contracted the flu on our first trip and we cut it short. This hotel seemed like a great balance between cost and uptown location. I tried to use some upgrades in my Marriott account, but it was too close to our check-in date, so I called the concierge. Dana was SO helpful. Just delightful to have a conversation with, and was able to secure an upgrade to a suite and sent a lovely bottle of wine and chocolates to celebrate. There is a small restaurant attached to the hotel although and a limited room service menu. The room was nice and the bathroom was huge for NYC. We enjoyed our stay!

title: New years event of the rooftop
text:
This review is exclusively for the New Year’s Eve event on the rooftop. We got a general admission for roughly $170.
Firstly when we arrived before the start time of 9pm we could see the management was all over the place with no structure at all… they had opportunity to start checking ID’s and tickets before the 9 start time for smooth entry however, they didn’t start this process until 9.15 so by the time they started slowly going through the line, most of us didn’t get into the venue until 9.45, noting we were about 5th in line on the general admission side of the line. The drinks package was 9pm to 1am so we missed out on almost an hour of what we had paid for. 

The event was completely overcrowded and we were packed in sardines. There was not enough bar staff but the ones they did have worked hard and were pretty quick at getting the drinks out. They did their best. There was also supposed to be a champagne toast at midnight however the champagne never reached us or anyone in our vicinity (I think I saw two people with champagne glasses at midnight). 

The main huge disappointment was the issues with the 3 restrooms not meeting the needs of the amount of people on the venue. 3 individual restrooms for I would estimate at least 250 people and no separate male and female restroom. At 10.00pm there was already a 30 minute wait which got to be about a 45 min wait by 11.00pm which only got longer. This is a health and safety issue.  When we asked if there were any other options we were met with staff pretending it was their first day to avoid dealing with our concerns. The other issue was the line for the restroom went straight though the dance floor and onto the bar line (what a joke). The man managing the restroom had no sense of urgency to get people moving and people took ages in the toilet making the wait even longer. With no options of other restrooms or any urgency to hurry people up, people were forced to hold on and wait. Other disapointments/misleading information was that the event said there would be a view of Central Park and the fireworks… the view was a construction site of new high rise building being built directly in front and a slither of the east side of the park with zero view of the fireworks (what a joke). The event also stated there would be ‘house classics’ with what the Dj would play… I heard none, with most of it being very average which was reflected by the lack of people on the dance floor (which was also due to the restroom line being so long)! The dance floor was literally empty. Overall the event was not worth the price, had misleading information on what it would deliver and left my bladder in a state of anxiety.  We were extremely disappointed.

title: First visit
text:
We did a lot of research before visiting NYC and this hotel for us, was in the best spot. We were so close to Central Park, we both enjoyed an early morning run/walk. Just down the road there is a small supermarket/chemist that came in handy. 
Room was clean, tidy and felt homey. They are small but we didn’t expect a huge room given we were in New York.

title: Great location and EXCELLENT service!
text: Excellent location (walking distance to Central Park, Theatre District, Times Square..). I had thought I was going to be staying at the Parker Meridien, which I had stayed at many years ago and enjoyed it.  Alas, that hotel is next door and is now called the Thompson.  So the hotel wasn't exactly how I had remembered it (not quite as high-end) but it was still excellent.  The room was a little dated but very clean with a view of the NYE Ball.  Our concierge Asimina Mitilineos went above and beyond when we realized a wallet was left behind.  She found the wallet and had it shipped to our home with a couple of days.  That's the stuff you remember.  We got a $40 credit (which may be a NYC standard) to use in their cafe/lounge which we enjoyed with yummy drinks before our show.  All in all a very solid hotel in an excellent location!

title: Special Amenity
text: I was not able to make the trip in celebration for a friends birthday. I called the hotel to ask if an amenity could be sent to the room for my friend and was connected with Mina. I explained the situation to Mina and she walked me through what options were available, confirmed the date and time for delivery, and even included a note to be delivered with the amenity on my behalf. While I wish I could be there to celebrate, Mina assured me my friend would know I was thinking of her on her special day. Thank you, Mina!

title: Clean Little Hotel Near Central Park
text:
Great service at this conveniently located hotel near Central Park that is part of the Marriott family.

Hotel General Manager Sonam Chosigal and front desk supervisor Nathema David made us feel right at home. 

Very welcoming, clean rooms,  Illy espresso machines and very little closet space.

text: Two stars are for the position and helpful staff. The rooms are tired, Furniture falling apart. The cooling/heating system is noisy. title: Not the Parker Meridian
text: This is not the Parker Meridian you once knew. Lobby and rooms are half the size, staffing is minimal, and the whole experience feels sad. Location is convenient but the place is run down, disorganized and overpriced. You can do better -keep looking.

title: Great hotel great staff!
text: After reading some of the reviews, we were abit unsure what to expect but as soon as we walked in we were given a lovely welcome by Brian on reception and Danny on the door. They couldn't have made us more welcome as a platinum for life member, we were offered an upgrade to a lovely terrace room. Yes the room is abit tired and dated but it was spotless and everything worked. There is quite alot of building work going on across the road which didn't bother us and Brian said he would move us if he did. Great location for Central Park and Times Square. Would definitely visit again!

title: Disappointing Service Amidst a Great Location
text:
Regrettably, I experienced exceptionally poor service during my stay at this hotel, and it greatly impacted my overall experience. My room went uncleaned for more than a day due to a housekeeping failure. It's disheartening that a 5-star hotel couldn't provide a basic clean room and fresh towels. Additionally, despite my gold status, I wasn't offered an upgrade, even though there were available rooms for booking online. The staff's lack of acknowledgement when passing by was a stark indicator of the poor service quality.

On a more positive note, the hotel's location is undeniably excellent, but the rooms are rather small by New York standards.

title: Really awful hotel and rude service
text:
Had a pretty terrible stay here on business travel for not cheap. Hotel staff was just extremely unfriendly and unhelpful across the board, including the manager of the hotel. My room was dated, the AC did not work, the shower is wildly small that I cut my arm on the shampoo bottle, and it was outside an elevator and the main AC/Heating system for the hotel. The ironing board is a desktop board but there’s nowhere to put it. The bathrooms have literally no counters. A d there are no plug ins anywhere near the bed. 

The cleaning service did not come after I called twice to confirm they would be cleaning my room. Normally I wouldn’t care but because of the weird bed headboard functioning also as a closet the sheets wouldn’t stay on the bed and I could get my hand between the headboard to fix it. This is just gross. The manager of the hotel took forever to call me back after calling three times and then never followed up with me on a resolution. 

Highly recommend avoiding this place. They are run down and rude and there’s way better places to stay in Manhattan and in this very neighborhood. Won’t happen again

title: Like living in your closet for a night
text:
The only thing saving this hotel is the service. The people who work here do try their best, but what can I say, they’ve been dealt a bad hand.

First, the rooms are really small. I get it - hotel rooms in NYC can be on the small side, but think: closet. There’s no room to maneuver at all. It is indeed like living in a closet. If you have any kind of claustrophobia, this is the kind of place that sends you into a panic attack.

Second, there are just no amenities. The little things that typically make a Le Meridien hotel great are missing here. There is no coffee, tea, or even water in the lobbies. There is no refrigerator in the rooms. If you are there on business, you have room for maybe one suit and then your closet is maxed out. 

I told the staff that I had medicine that needed to be cooled and they said they would hold it in the hotel refrigerator in the basement and bring it to me when I needed it. 

Finally, the hotel feels very dated. Whoever is operating this hotel is doing it for maximum profit. The elevator is old and slow. The carpets look like they’re from the 80’s.

title: Update older hotel - don’t get catfished by pics
text:
This is an old hotel that they did a cosmetic upgrade on.  A bit of lipstick on the pig. 

Rooms are tiny - a king size bed takes almost 2/3 the space. Carpet is old and generally a bit unkept. 

However bathrooms are nice enough and it’s a good location

title: Exceptional Service - Above and Beyond (Thanks Lionel and Chris Carrow!)
text: The service I received at Le MERIDIEN was above and beyond my expectations! I left my laptop in a bathroom down stairs and did not realize until the can ride to JFK. I called Security and Lionel went out of his way to find it for me! Chris, the concierge, then coordinated with me to overnight the computer to me (even offerning to handle the initial shipping costs because my credit card was cancelled.). Both Lionel and Chris saved the day!

title: This Hotel is definitely not a 5 Star Stay!
text: I was so excited to get to stay at this 5 Star Le Méridien HOTEL so near Central Park!  Disappointed doesn’t begin to describe my feelings.  Was it livable? Yes!  Was it exceptional?  Not by a long-shot.  It is obvious the negativity stems from the MANAGEMENT at the top.  The entire staff seems so terribly disenchanted with having to be there, and that is usually a sign that MANAGEMENT has made them feel that way.  To begin with the front of the hotel looks nothing like the picture on their website or the picture on the Marriott website.  Marriott has this hotel listed with a restaurant and that is not the case, it’s more like a Café lunch counter.  So very misleading.  We stopped in to the cocktail lounge to have a nightcap, and when I ask for directions to the restroom I was directed down the stairs to a dungeon type room that had unisex bathrooms, and only one had a door that would lock, and only one had a light that would come on.  Marriott has also listed this hotel with a gift shop, which is not the case.  I asked to have my down feather pillows switched out for hypoallergenic pillows, and we were the recipients of the tiniest pillows I’ve ever seen.  This is a very old and tired property.  It makes me wonder that with the construction site across the street erecting a 30 story building that will block the view of Central Park… if perhaps Management has put the skids on putting any more money into the hotel.  To strengthen that suspicion upon exiting the hotel on an extremely rainy day, I asked the hotel for a complementary umbrella, and I was told that MANAGEMENT has basically eliminated that part of their customer service.  I do want to applaud the young woman who checked us in for letting us check in early and the help received from the Concierge was equally appreciated.  It’s very sad to see a hotel that is comfortable charging such outrageous prices for such minimal delivery.  I know I am not the first to suggest that you stay elsewhere.

title: Our Wonderful time at Le Meridien, Central Park!
text:
This is the 4 or 5th time I've stayed at Le Meridien, Central Park!  I LOVE this place for several reasons.  
The location is wonderful- it's very close to Central Park and Bergdorf's, what could be better!
The service and staff are delightful in all areas- if I called for help with the television, there there within minutes.  They go above and beyond.
I'm saving the best for last which is the concierge- this team is absolutely INCREDIBLE!!!
They will jump through hoops to get very very difficult to get dinner reservations and I can't tell you how valuable that is.
This team includes:
Dana Steer, Christopher Carrow and Asimina Mitilineos.  They are my HERO'S
in the hospitality world.

title: Thumbs up Le Meridien
text: Great location, exceptional customer service in every way throughout my week there.  Very polite, friendly and responsive staff, from the front desk to the cleaning crew.  The rooftop patio for coffee, breakfast and happy hour are awesome

title: Perfect location
text: Perfect location for our trip to NY. Only 3 blocks from Penn Station, so easy to reach also with a suitcase. We stayed at the 10th floor with a view to the backyard, but very quiet for NY. Stayed in a room with 2 queen size beds, a small cabinet and not a lot of space, but fits for us, we were only there to sleep. Bathroom comes without a door, only the toilet comes with a door. Roomservice was perfect, change of towels every day. Friendly staff at the bar and not to forget the friendly staff at the hotel entrance

title: The best concierge !
text: Chris Carrow was the most helpful hotel employee I've ever had! Personally handled a misplaced item shipping issue I had and kept up with it for many weeks after I left the hotel. Couldn't have asked for better treatment!

title: What a scam!
text:
This hotel is a total scam. Not at all family friendly. 
We arrived exhausted with 2 young children and we booked a junior suite room which wasn't ready at 4pm! 
We paid a hefty price to have more space and views to Central Park. Instead, we got a room that faced the huge construction site with unbearable noise and a tiny bit of greenery of the park afar. 
1. Service: non existent. Staff is rude and prefers to ignore your requests rather than being helpful. One staff member even marched into the room without even knocking. What the heck!
2. Breakfast. It's absolutely disgusting. On the level P which is a nightclub at night. Smells horrible, not child safe. The breakfast menu is a joke. Need to pay extra for the eggs! At the price point we were staying. Unbelievable! Plus, they ran out of lemon when I asked for one. 
3. The room itself is a bit spacious compared to regular rooms but it's old, the carpets have stains, the room cleaning is lousy so you get some crumbs here and there. 
4. Room service. There is one, but very limited and they bring it to you from the nearby restaurant? What a joke! They rely on Uber eats so get one if you are planning to stay there. 
All in all, it was not a good experience and I wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel. Plenty other options in the city and you don't have to pay $$$$ to be scammed in this way.

title: Great concierge service!!!
text: I stayed at Le Meridien for a work trip last week. The entire experience was lovely, but the concierge service was spectacular! I accidentally left a bunch of my important work materials in my room, and Chris from concierge was quick to assist sending them to me across the country. 5-star service!

title: Pleasant surprise
text:
We travel a lot and usually stay @ a 5 star level so, when we found ourselves wanting to go to an art show in NYC occurring during  the US Open and fashion week, a very busy hotel week w/somewhat inflated prices and availability.
We made a last minute reservation @ Le Meridian, and, it was was a very lovely discovery.
First and foremost 4 me, it is very well located, in midtown on 57th between 6th and 7th ave, lots of metro, very near and walkable to Broadway, and 5th Ave and Central Park very close.
Our room was very basic, not for the  tourist who likes to spread out and luxuriate in the room, (and like us, who  were traveling  w/2 large suitcases, ) tiny bathroom and the tiniest closet, I have ever seen, but we figured we are are in New York and could make it work and we did.
Our little cave became very special as we realized it was very cool at a very hot time of year and quiet @ nite. Since we were out most of the day and evening, the sleeping aspect of the room was important. It had a very comfortable bed, good TV and wi fi reception, and great bathroom amenities. (I loved the products and ordered them when we got home.)
The other outstanding feature of this little gem is the staff……they couldn’t have been nicer and more helpful.
Everyone @!the front desk, and Chris and his associates @ the concierge stand went out of their way to help us w/anything we needed. Excellent restaurant reservations and checking on theatre tickets
There is a nice little bar off the lobby and a restaurant/bar on the roof, but it was too hot to enjoy the rooftop bar.
I have no problem recommending this if u don’t care about not having bathrobes, and can live with the tiniest closet, or even if u do, checking on suites which seemed roomy and have nice views might be your best option.

title: I thought this was supposed to be a brand name hotel
text: God awful. Tiny rooms. Awful service. I thought this was supposed to be a brand name. No where to store anything in the room. Not even a closet. Weird hanging space next to bed. Suitcases end up on the floor in front of bed and you have to walk over them because the room is so small. Cheap fixtures. Awful lighting. Terrible carpeting. Half a** renovation.

title: they just don’t care
text:
first time staying here.  busy week in new york so many places were  sold out.  it’s the old viceroy hotel in case you are wondering, which ten years ago was a luxury boutique hotel with an “elegant uptown luxury feel” .. the rooms still have twinges of that vice roy luxury feel… smartly laid out, navy floors with whiskey brown wood bathrooms have lovely mosaic tiles. 
even though tired, the room itself still quite nice.  

now the bad news, when you check in you are not so much greeted as grimly observed by two very tired looking employees behind the desk.  it’s so different from the wonderful reception you would get at the old le parker meridian. 

later try calling down for a pillow or a dental kit…it just rings and rings and rings and rings.  then after about 50 rings someone picks up … and hangs up. 

so bottom line.  woefully understaffed.  manager not around or quit or disengaged or maybe just doesn’t know better. 

i am going to go with it’s not the staffs fault there is just no leadership, no expectations set about how to treat guests, no resources applied to the problem, no effort made to share with the employees the pride and satisfaction that comes from delighting guests and operating a well run hospitality business.

hopefully someone at le meridian who is senior enough reads this review, figures out who is accountable for this depressing mess and makes a change.

title: Great help from service agent Sonam Chosgial
text:
My wife and I were under tight time pressure to make a dinner reservation followed by a show.  Unfortunately a reservation error on my part was about to blow the evening when thankfully Sonam stepped in to help after we arrived from LGA before heading out for the evening.  He squared us away and got us on our way so we could keep our plans for the first of two nights in NYC.  Thanks Sonam!

Rich

title: This is NOT the old Parker Meridien hotel.
text: We booked one night at Le Meridien on points, and it was absolutely fine. Nothing more or less. I thought this would be the old Parker Meridien which we previously visited many years ago, back when Norma's restaurant was on the ground floor and the elevators had classic cartoons on screens. This is next door to that old property which is now owed by Hyatt. The room was small, clean and totally adequate. The location is great, one block from Central Park and next to Carnegie Hall. The bed was comfortable but very low to the ground. The staff was nice. This is a 3 - 4 star property that feels a bit dated. It was fine for our one night, but I don't think I'd want to have an extended stay here.

title: Excellent Service by the Concierge Staff at Le Meridien New York, Central Park
text:
I would like to commend the Le Meridien New York, Central Park,  particularly the Concierge staff, Chris,  Asimina, and Dana for making my day/week when it looked hopeless.  Though I did not stay in Le Meridien, the cab driver who took me to the airport, dropped a piece of luggage that I had left in his cab to Le Meridien under the belief that it belonged to another customer who was dropped off at Le Meridien.  On contacting Le Meridien, these three folks acknowledged that the luggage was in their hotel and then went out of their way to ensure that my luggage was safely returned to me in California. When I retell this story to many different people, they are all amazed at the outcome. Reinforces one's faith in humanity.
-Kannan

title: Another great stay in midtown
text:
I stayed at le Meridien last Sunday night and I’m never disappointed.  This time it was to take care of a friend who had some surgery, we had a long day, and i got to the hotel plate at night.  The doormen could not have been better.  They took my car, bags, and got me to the room. 

The room was super quiet and I got a great nights sleep.  

I try to stay here whenever I’m midtown as it keeps me away from all the noise and nonsense of Times Square.

title: Champagne birthday wishes!
text: The concierge Chris was awesome in helping us get a bottle of champagne delivered to our dear friends who were celebrating a 60th birthday at the hotel. He was very courteous, knowledgeable and friendly in helping us.

title: Business group trip
text:
Near to Central Park. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Brian Smith and Vijay Persaud makes our experience very positive. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. 
Only an observation to improve the experience at the rooftop restaurant. The staff is very friendly and attentive, but the waiting time will improve. The coffee options too. The view from rooftop is beautiful.

title: Kind Concierge
text: My dear friend is a guest at your hotel. She is in town helping her sister recover from throat surgery.  In fact, she was discharged from hospital and is spending the night with her sister before going home. I wanted to send a little something so I called and spoke with your Concierge, Dana Steer.  He helped me come up with a perfect idea and even ran to the corner market for ice cream! I have been a GM at hotels in San Francisco and San Diego.  Dana went above and beyond and exhibited true service. I am impressed and grateful.  Thank you Dana!

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: This hotel is well-located and reasonably priced. The concierges, Christopher Carrow and Dana Steer, were the friendliest and most helpful I have ever dealt with. The other staff members were prompt and responsive. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: everything you need for a city hols hotel
text: very nice! good rooms, good location but most importantly especially for a city break hotel - people! Chris went an extra mile to address the issues with the delivery we had! welcoming, professional and friendly. you dont see this very often any more, so very impressed. thank you!

title: Awesome location; incredible staff!
text: I had a travel delay which caused me to stay in the city at the last minute.  The staff from check in, at the restaurant, and concierge were extremely accommodating.  A huge shout out to Chris (Concierge) and Damian (Hotel Security) on assistance for an item left in my room.  They located and sent out same day to me!

title: Horrible experience
text:
I had a horrible experience with my son at this hotel.  Stayed 4 nights but certainly never ever again for the  price I paid and the service I received.

1- On arrival and as a Bonvoy Titanium member I asked for late check out which was confirmed by the front desk.  However, on the day of the checkout  the housekeeping literally opened the door and walked into the room three times starting 9:00 am, 11 am, and 12:00 pm despite the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign is visible on the door!!  Seriously 9:00 am that's not even the check-out time yet!  My son woke up horrified three times on that day.  On top when I was checking out the the receptionist said “Finally your leaving”!  
2- We called house keeping literally 5 times to get a laundry bag and eventually my son went down to reception to get it!  
3- You would have the most basic breakfast probably in New York at this hotel.

I did make a complain to Marriott Bonvoy and received a reply from Ayesha Saddiqa the hotel GM which gave me a super generous goodwill of 2500 Bonvoy points :) and on top she asked me “If for any reason you feel you are unable to highly and positively recommend us, I would appreciate receiving your feedback so that I can personally address any lingering concerns.” 

When I escalated she ignored to reply until I reached to Marriott again then her assistant Brenda replied offering 25,000 Bonovy points. I did ask for a night refund but both GM and assistant refused.

Dear Ayesha, I couldn’t positively recommend you as you wanted and thank you so much for the generous offer of 2500 points.

title: Disappointing Quality - Learn from my experience and stay anywhere else
text:
The hotel is very old and becoming run down.  My room was dingy, dark, and just not nice.  After 2 days of trying to deal with it, I asked if I could move to a nicer room and the woman at the front desk was rude and pretty much laughed at me. She said it was full and the hotel is 10 years old and has never been updated.  It looks way older than 10 years old. What she basically told me is all the rooms are bad.  I was going to check out and move next door to The Thompson which is way nicer and has entrances of 56th and 57th (I used them) but I dedided to just stay because I didn’t want to waste any time. 

Where do I begin.  The room is so tiny.  It felt like a cheap cruise stateroom or rundown hotel outside a train station in Europe. I thought the bed was comfy enough but my daughter disagrees.  Carpet is old, the furniture is not nice.  A closet or luggage rack would have been nice. The small cabinet part of the bed was useless.  We had 2 carry-on suitcases and I tripped over them a bunch because there is just no room. The bathroom is even worse.  There were 6 types of old marble.  They must have gotten a deal on it because it was every color, shape, and size.  Hideous. The design is not women friendly at all. I don’t wash my hair everyday and you have to get wet to turn the shower on.  The mirror would be cool if shorter people were considered. The makeup mirror was so high, the bottom of it was at the top of my head.  Multiple times we thought a spider was in the shower. Nope, just the disintegrating grout.  The black toliet seat cover is not good.  It is old so I kept thinking something was on it. The bathroom was old and ugly but it was clean. 

The lobby is small. Sometimes people were in it. Probably because the rooms are so small there is no where to sit.  The rooftop bar is an enigma.  They had “supply issues” so it was closed for breakfast. I tried to go at 10:45pm and it was closed even though I was told it closed at 11.  I got the free breakfast for Titanium rewards members which they hosted downstairs. Just skip it.  Continental was so limited. I ended up ordering eggs that I had to pay for.  I had to ask for salt and pepper 3 times.  They also don’t offer green tea.  Waste of time and money. 

Since the hotel is so lacking, you would expect the team to make up in service.  Nope. Besides the one rude front desk woman, everyone was fine. An occasional hello. An occasional door opening when we got back to the hotel. The cleaning staff was always friendly and the room and hotel is clean.  As a Titanium rewards member, you would think they would do something nice to make up for the fact hotel is a disappointment.  No upgrades here.  I was on a lower level with a terrible view.   Fine service is not good enough. 

There are so many nice hotels. Please do not make the mistake I made. Pick any other option.

title: Emplacement Parfait!
text: While West 57th is not exactly the quietest street in midtown, somehow this hotel feels tucked away from the groan of 5th Ave and the 24-hour din of Times Square.  Modestly-sized, but well-designed, rooms with modern and comfortable bedding, towels, and decor.  Service is friendly and attentive but no lounge for Marriott Bonvoyers.  Views of Central Park facing north and the PERFECT location to everything in midtown.

title: Concierges are great
text: Chris and Dana are great. They did a contribution for are stay in New York. Booked great restaurants and helped us in many other aspects. Dana also helped me in recovering a lost glasses in the Woodbury outlet.

title: Concierge Dana
text: Before I even checked into the hotel, I realized I had left my phone in a taxi (that had already driven off) and to my rescue, the concierge, Dana, assisted me in retrieving my phone and  showed true compassion to a stressed solo traveler (me). Dana showed true excitement as soon as the taxi driver returned my phone as we both celebrated together and had a good laugh about the drama. Dana showed his pleasant smile in passing for the rest of my stay and remembered me by name which was a respectful personal gesture that made me feel like a guest and not just a customer. Great experience!

title: Vacation.
text: Stayed here for our anniversary, birthday and chocolate conference. Great location and walkable to many things such as central park & park Ave. Thanks Sonam for all the help and info. Until next time! Cheers!

title: Great time
text: Had an amazing experience at the ale Meridien after our first hotel was didn’t meet our expectations. The staff was extremely helpful with the move, especially Sonam. The location near Central Park made for a beautiful view from the guest room as well as a short walk into nature.

title: Left suit at hotel
text: Great stay at Le Meridian! I would stay here again. I left a suit at the hotel and was accommodated to have it shipped to my home.  Chris helped with this situation and was able to get back to me at a timely manner! Thank you Chris for your help!

title: Great choice for Manhattan, modern with friendly staff
text: Great place to stay in Manhattan!  The hotel is very nice with a modern vibe. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly,  Nathema checked us in quickly up arrival into a nice room and Chris the concierge was very helpful in providing local recommendations and answering all our questions.  We found street parking for the weekend based on Chris's advice, there is also a paid garage nearby and I think valet too though we did not use either.  The location is great, very close to Central Park, midtown and Hell's Kitchen where found great restaurants.  Lots of cool things to do in walking distance.  Will definitely look to stay here again next time we're in NYC.

title: A FUIR. Pas à la hauteur. Donne le sentiment qu’ils sont en phase de dépôt de bilan tellement c’est mal  gèré.
text:
Just unacceptable. Chambre très moyenne, petit dej immonde et cher. A FUIR !
Croissants à peine décongelé, pas d jus d’orange, pas de toasts ,… etc et cela tous les matins.
Juste une belle vue sur Central Park depuis le petit roof top,, mais il y en a d’autres.
Passez votre chemin car c’est une honte!

title: Great Concierge!
text: Very nice room and fabulous service!   I left my dress there and Asimina, the concierge, found it and arranged for it to be shipped to my home the next day.  She was a life saver and so easy to work with. Thank you!!!

title: Amazing
text:
The beds were amazing and the decor was so beautiful. We loved the great location and updated rooms and bathrooms. The staff was so sweet and accommodating. 
The concierges both Dana and Chris made our visit unique and special. 
We were celebrating a 40th birthday and they made our stay very special. 
Dana helped build a beautiful itinerary of shows, sites, and restaurants. He took so much time helping us find the right fit for our stay in NYC. 
I almost felt as if we were staying in the South as opposed the hustle and bustle city of NYC. 
We would definitely stay again!

title: 8 nights at Le Meridien Central Park: Best Central Park view for money in Manhattan!
text:
Top location, you can walk to plenty of the main NY attractions and restaurants! Excellent option for a family with children (9y, 13y). The suite is big enough to fit a fanily and rhe Central Park view wowed my family right at the arrival. This is the best Central Park view for money that you will find in Manhattan. Sonam from the reception is particularly likable and took very well care of us. The Concierge is friendly, responsive, professional and well connected so she and he will help you with whatever tickets that you might need.

On the negative side:
The restaurant and bar on the ground floor are not exactly the best ones in town. But being in Manhattan, there will be a lot of other options you can chose of, such as the two diners further west on 57th for breakfast (wvich my kids loved).

title: Great Service
text:
The hotel was lovely,  and the location was fantastic.
Upon my return home I realized that I had left a purse at the hotel. I contacted Dana at the concierge desk. He was quite helpful as he and the security officer, Robert, were on the case. They quickly located my lost purse, and then promptly had it picked up and shipped to me via fedex.
I always appreciate great service!!

title: Always helpful
text: Regular visitor to Le Meridien and always find staff helpful and hotel clean but this trip they really helped out. After my stay they retrieved a valuable personal item left in my room, and overnighted it home - thanks Chris and Dana - I’ll be back!

title: Excelente!
text:
Excelente hotel. Una de las mejores opciones hoteleras si se visita New York. 
Excelente servicio. Habitación muy confortable. Todo muy limpio. Su personal sumamente atento. Cuenta con un bar en su terraza con vista al Central Park. Ubicación inmejorable.

title: Terrific
text: The hotel was great ;  love the rooftop bar, and the rooms and bathrooms were fabulous. More importantly, the staff was terrific, especially Dana! Who went above and beyond.  Wonderful. Thank you everyone!

title: Nice hotel, but THE BEST PEOPLE ever
text: The staff at the LeMeridien Central Park ARE THE BEST! Sonam, Mutari, Dana, & Ashe all made a stressful family trip the BEST! We were travelling with my father in a wheel chair & I am recovering from an injury using a knee scooter, our mobility was challenging to say the least.  Upon driving up to the hotel Ashe helped to get us & our things in & out of the car & to our rooms. He also took care of the car while we did a quick change before we were leaving again.  Sonam & Dana got us checked in & oriented to what we needed.  They made a very stressful situation, a breeze as we were an hr behind schedule.  No problem & how can we help were the first words out of their mouths whenever we needed something. When we had to leave Sunday morning, Mutari fearing they were going to close the street for a parade walked us through the hotel next door to the garage & our car; instead of sending us around the block. We are so grateful to him for getting us to the car effortlessly. We have found our new home away from home when we come back to NYC.  The hotel is nice, but it is the people there that make it our new home.

title: Great location, outstanding staff!
text:
My husband & I checked in to Le Meridian on Friday & were greeted by Ash at the front door.  He hooked us up with the valet, loaded our (many!) bags onto the luggage cart & up to the room.  Once there, he pointed out the rooms amenities, and we chatted for a moment.  He continued to greet us with a smile & a hello whenever we saw him during our stay. 
 Dana, the concierge, was magnificent! So friendly, so helpful, we were looking for a place to hear some jazz or live music Saturday night & he wrote down a couple of places & then followed up with additional suggestions in an email to my husband.  He truly went out of his way! 
 One last person I would like to mention is Carlos.  He was at the elevator when we came in one evening after I had slipped and fell a couple blocks away. I was in quite a bit of pain & actually thought I had perhaps broken my knee. He seemed to appear from nowhere with a ice pack & that was just what the "doctor" ordered. Lol He then asked about it the next day to see if I was feeling better. 
I realize I am going on and on about the staff, but they were truly that good.  It was our first time here (we wanted to be close to Central Park which we had never visited) but to our surprise, the hotel is actually central to everything, not just the park!  The room wqs nice, very clean, but we had a view of sort of some kind of alley.  We weren't in the room long enough to worry about that though! We come to the city once or twice every year and  think we have now found "our" place.

title: Worldclass customer service
text:
Great hotel made so much better by the friendly and helpful team working here. I'm an experienced traveller and this is simply the best 👌 
Apparently I have to make this review 200 characters to submit, so sorry about this extra waffle - nothing else to add

title: Gem on 57th
text: Lovely, European style/decor just 2 blocks from Central Park. Great for walking everywhere - 5th Ave, MoMA, Columbus Circle, Times Sq and a good selection of trains on the Subway 1 blk away. All Staff from Check in, Servers, Room Service, Lobby staff are friendly and helpful. I had an issue with a tour and Concierge Chris Carrow expertly assisted. So nice to see in a big city. We'll be back!

title: Lovely staff - thanks especially to Chris on concierge desk
text: Had a lovely time staying here for nearly a week. Location is great and staff looked after us well - in particular Chris Carrow at the concierge desk who was super responsive and helpful with everything.

title: WORST CONCIERGE
text: Decided to stay at this hotel for a medical school graduation and honestly wished I would have stayed somewhere else. If you want to feel unsafe and harassed by staff this is the place. If you actually want to enjoy your time in New York stay somewhere else. We had the worst service by the concierge. The concierge, Dana Steer, advised our friend that was in the lobby that he could not vape. We responded that we did not know and that he wouldn’t do it again. Mr. Steer went ahead and called security on us. When we asked for his name because we were absolutely shocked that a minor mistake that did not occur again was being escalated so much, he said he felt threatened and wanted to kick us out of the hotel. Security had to stop him because he would not stop harassing our group for our room numbers so that he could kick us out. Incredibly disheartening that a hotel allows staff that discriminate on their guests and treat them this poorly.

title: Amazing staff
text: Great hotel but really just the nicest nicest staff. Sonam, Fernando, Carlos, and Ash especially made a big difference during my week long stay. They’re so patient and friendly and I really appreciated getting to see them around the hotel - see you all again soon!

title: How do you get to Carnegie Hall.  Turn left.
text:
Conveniently situated two blocks from Central Park and a brief walk to the Theater District/Times Square, this hotel reminded me how easy it can be to get around NYC.  

Hotel rooms in NYC are smaller than most places I visit.  My room was on par with size, but the design and layout worked well.  Bed was a platform bed which was a lower height than I'm accustomed to.  I was on the back of the building (left off elevator), and had a view of a neighboring building, but was not disturbed by any traffic or street noise.

The hotel does have a rooftop bar, with great views.  I was attending for a private event - which ensured the right number of people and attentive service for the space.

title: Disappointing Stay.... Keep scrolling don't stay here not worth the money for the lack of service and need for renovatio
text:
I have stayed at Le Meridien hotels before and was greatly disappointed in the quality and service at this location, especially given the amount of money spent. Requests for  pillows, ice, shampoo, and other basic requests took hours or days to receive. I had to ask for extra pillows twice, which were not received until the 2nd day at the hotel. I also asked for a bucket for ice and did not receive it until 1 hour and 30 minutes after my request. There was no body wash upon our arrival, and we did not receive the refill on body wash until the next day. The TV was completely outdated and slow, and the air vent in the restroom was dirty. I could smell marijuana in the hallway coming from one of the rooms.
Most hotels that struggle with space (need for remodeling which this place does) and amenities do their best to elevate the level of customer service they provide their guests, not this property. The only positive story was the assistance of the bellman, who tried his best to catch us a cab during our check-out of the hotel.
I was embarrassed that my mother had to experience this disappointing experience at this hotel on her Mother’s Day weekend. Again, I am not sure what issues surround this hotel or its staff, but I was mortified and, quite frankly, shocked to the point of sharing my concerns with Marriott Bonvoy to perhaps have this hotel location excluded from the Marriott Bonvoy brands.

title: Helpful and welcoming!
text:
I had the best stay at Le méridien! The location is perfect (right next to Central Park), the food was amazing, and the staff so welcoming and helping. 
I had lost my camera at the hotel and everyone, especially Robert Ameyaw from security did his absolute best to help me retrieve it - which he has, and Chris Carrow at the Concierge for taking care of the shipping of my camera! I'm vey thankful to them and everyone at the hotel!!

title: Wonderful customer service and clean spaces
text: The service was fantastic, and I was always taken care of quickly and happily by the staff, especially Mr. Carrow, who even helped me a week after I left by coordinating delivery of an item I left behind. The hotel itself is clean and quiet, and the rooms are designed to maximize the space, so that you aren't claustrophobic the way that I often feel in the typical tiny NYC hotel room.

title: Customer service is a TEN!
text: The staff was very accommodating. Chris in concierge was amazing at making restaurant and attraction suggestions, he helped make the trip very memorable. The front desk staff was too notch and I highly recommend booking the junior suite, it was perfect with our two little kids.

title: Wonderful visit!
text: Awesome hotel. The room was super cozy and very well decorated. Bathroom was great size and everything was super clean. I even left a bag in the room and they were able to help assist locating it and sending it my way. I spoke with a woman initially (didn’t get her name) and then one of the concierge’s (Chris carrow) called me to arrange for him to send it to me. They were all so polite and helpful! Will def stay here again!! Thank you Le Meridien!!!

title: Best Value in NYC
text: The Hotel staff is excellent.  The location of the hotel is great and rooms are well kept and very clean.  The restaurant is very reasonably priced for the location and food is very good.  This is my hotel of choice in NYC and I spend 100+ nights a year in hotels in the US and abroad.

title: Amazing experience!!!!
text: This hotel is just amazing. From the moment you arrive, Barry greets you and welcomes you in like family. The front desk staff are all so amazing, they go out of their way to make sure you feel welcomed. Highly professional staff!!!! The room was perfect, bedding was great, location is just perfect. This hotel is definitely a winner in every way, will stay here from now on and highly recommend my friends to stay here as well. Cheers to ALL the staff for making this experience unforgettable. :)

title: Not Pet friendly
text: This was by far the worst hotel experience I’ve had in a long time. This hotel advertises as pet friendly, but is far from that. Our small terrier was left alone for maybe 4 hours max, yet as soon as we left premises the phone calls began about the dog. We hurried back each time except for once where it took us an hour in traffic to return. We received a scolding about our dog, keeping in mind we were paying extra for the pet,  when we pushed back, we were threatened with eviction and treated very rudely by staff. I do not recommend this hotel.  The rooms are small and pricey. There are pLenny of other options in NYC.

title: Wow -- Super Impressed!
text: I am massively impressed with the concierge service at the Meridien....they literally went above and beyond for us. They have a level of attention to detail and a sense of urgency that you don't see anymore unfortunately -- these guys were on point. Major shout out to Chris for handling our situation with the utmost of care!

title: NYC Birthday Central Park
text: Went as a family and stayed in the Park Suites - rooms are big, clean and comfortable.  Bathroom was very nice.  The staff was very accommodating and the location near Central Park is ideal.  The bar on the ground floor was nice.  Didn't eat at the restuartant but the food looked good.  Would highly recommend staying here, we'll be back.

title: Excellent Manager Fernando
text:
Excellent customer service by the manager here Fernando Figueroa . I would come back to this hotel for him anytime.  He knows how to take care of his customers. Super good. 
All staff here was very courteous.

title: Superb service!
text:
My husband and I took his parents on a trip to NYC and stayed at Le Meridien. Our primary reason for staying at Le Meridien was its proximity to Carnegie Hall (it's on the same block) where we would be attending a performance. The secondary reason was that the hotel was a block away from Central Park - thus giving us a chance to take a break from all the buildings, skyscrapers, and busy streets of Manhattan.

Our stay at the hotel was very pleasant. I had called prior to our visit and the concierge addressed my questions and even emailed me for further assistance. The minor issues we had with the room during our stay were addressed very quickly. Staff was friendly and professional. The hotel is in between two major subway stops so very convenient to travel around the city and the staff was very helpful in grabbing us a cab when needed.

What really made our stay at Le Meridien wonderful was how accommodating they were. We arrived at 8am in NYC. Instead of having to wait till the standard check in time, because rooms were available, they checked us in right away, allowing us to rest for a bit before starting our first day of sight seeing in Manhattan.

What made our stay at Le Meridien outstanding was after we checked out. We had inadvertently left behind some valuables in the safe in the hotel room. We were so thankful to the hotel staff that all of the valuables were accounted for. They arranged for overnight delivery by mail.

I would highly recommend staying at Le Meridien where you won't be sharing the hotel with hundreds of other tourists and where you will receive service with integrity. We will stay at Le Meridien again the next time we are in NYC.

title: Happiest of birthdays
text: Great value and great service. Terrific service and views from room. They overheard my daughters birthday while in the elevator and sent us cupcakes and a candle and matched unprompted to celebrate. The kind of service I expect from a Ritz and at a much better price. Rooms are well designed and decorated. Felt the Jr Suite was a great value.

title: Give this a miss
text: The hotel is under massive construction and is opposite a skyscraper being built. To say this is an inconvenience is an understatement. The rooms are small and the staff frankly worse than unhelpful. One not nice touch: early in the morning, the lobby is populated by a group of 4-8 employees talking very loudly precluding guest ability to have a phone call from the lobby. Hotel is a ghost of it's illustrious pass and best missing.

title: Great location and staff
text:
I stayed with my sister and kids ages 5 and 10.  The location so close to the park and 2 subway lines is amazing.  Great playground and rocks to climb for the kids at the South of the park - close by!  

We forgot a makeup bag and a treasure stuffed animal in the room, which l only discovered days later when l finished unpacking.  The hotel had both and sent them to me via fedex.  The makeup bag had some jewelry in it so l was very grateful and impressed.

title: Short Stay at Le Meridien CP
text:
So...I usually never leave reviews because we're all busy AF and it's tedious.   But I took my nine-year-old son to NYC for three night during his spring break and wanted to create the best experience for him.  The location of this hotel is top notch and the service - front desk/concierge/restaurant are also very impressive - and so appreciated. 

We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon (March 29) and had booked a "junior suite" through Travelocity that was on the 4th floor.  So, we had no view and it was noisy due to a massive construction project on 57th St.  I asked multiple times to upgrade to a suite on higher floor, but to no avail, there were no available rooms I was told.   We had multiple issues with our room that night as well,  but it's fairly irrelevant at this point. 

The next morning - Thursday March 30 - I took a new booking I had made on Travelocity to the front desk which put my son and I in a true suite.  Brenda (who was amazing) at the front desk took care of us and moved us up to the 23rd floor with no additional charge. 

The remainder of our stay was flawless with my Chris  C. at the concierge serving us mere tourists with grace and patience.  He was phenomenal.  Point is, I was considering moving to another hotel after our first night, but they (Chris, Brenda, et al), made the NYC universe work perfectly. 

It's all about who is working and who you connect with, but the location, property, amenities and staff are all worth the $.  

Thanks - hope this helps anyone looking to experience NYC for a short trip with a young child/family. 

JN

title: Perfect
text: My experience was great. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful and cordial. Carlos the Bellman was great helping me with my luggage and rental car and assuring all my luggage made its way to the car.  The front desk was pleasant to deal with and the concierge (both individuals) were great and offered good advice for eating and travels needs.

title: Captivated by the name, BIG BIG disappointment
text: This hotel needs a MAJOR renovation, all is old! The rooms have very old furniture, Tv sporadically work, and the beautiful bathrooms the hardware is oxidized and stuck. The tub does not drain and the extractor fan in the bathroom, not only is extremely loud, but there is no way to turn it off. The overall lighting of the room is so so dark that I had to use my phone flashlight to be able to make coffee. The curtains are electric, but the motors don’t work and they are nearly hanging. This hotel is terrible!!!

title: Great hotel in NYC
text: Well-located, clean, friendly service. Chris at conciere desk was especially knowledgeble & helpful in guiding us to authentic NYC pizza & bagels--and with a smile!  I would stay here again. Could've used shower caps in the bathroom.

title: If you need to stay in Midtown, Le Meridien is an excellent choice, in one of best locations in my opinion in midtown
text: Fabulous location!  I stayed in a cozy king and found it perfectly fine for one or two people.  The mattress was in serious need of replacement.  Contacting the general manager was a very pleasant experience and I was heartened to learn that the hotel is replacing all the mattresses in mid April 2023.   The hotel is dated however it is clean and it is clear to me that it is superbly managed.   In fact all contact with the staff was a very enjoyable experience.

title: Loved my stay
text:
Stayed here for five nights over the St. Patrick’s weekend, and I can’t fault it. Yes the room wasn’t massive but when I was awake, I was out in the city so it didn’t bother me (and while I didn’t have a view of Central Park, again I wasn’t bothered about that either) but it was in a great area with good connections by foot and subway to anything you would want to see (I got the subway to Brooklyn and the southern tip of Manhattan while staying there) 

I was slightly disappointed that the rooftop bar was closed for refurbishment but there are plenty of other places within walking distance and the staff were all first rate either assistance whenever I needed something. It was very reasonably priced compared to the other hotels in the neighbourhood I had looked at, I hope to go back soon.

title: Outstanding hotel
text:
Spent 7 nights here and I am about to check out 
I reluctantly write this AMAZING review as I want this Hotel to be the best kept secret in NYC
Comfortable rooms, outstanding services and staff! 
Definitely will come back!

title: Excellent and personalized care by all of the staff!
text: We have been traveling to NYC frequently lately and the Le Meridien Central Park staff always go out of their way to make us feel special.  But this review is a special shout out to Carlos the bellman.  He is incredibly helpful, warm and friendly.  I am always very impressed—and touched—that he remembers me by name.  This past visit, I became ill and had to leave a night early—Carlos was so helpful in getting our car for us, getting our luggage from our room and loading it into the car.  He was kind enough to ask if I needed anything before driving home and said he hoped I felt better quickly.  It is small, personal moments like that make a difference and make us feel well-cared for as guests.

title: Le Meridian is a very solid A-
text: This property has a  phenomenal front desk staff at all hours of the day. While the bar leaves a lot to be desired with high prices (expected) and incredibly limited options , the rooms and the overall service are topnotch for a business hotel in Midtown. Bravo Le Meridian!

title: Great hotel with awesome people
text:
I was here twice in February and have an upcoming stay in March.
Le meridien NYC Central park is a truly exceptional place to stay. 
But what makes this hotel different from other hotels is the staff.
I had a credit card problem and Mr. Bryan Fox, front desk manager, fixed it right away. He was very attentive and courteous. Also, When I checked in, Mr Bryan Smith, front desk staff, greeted us with big warm smile and responded to any needs. They both made my stay memorable.
Also, the breakfast is good in the first floor. I think it is called ‘King restaurant’
I would come here anytime over other hotels in NYC.
Exceptional Staffs !

title: Dana the concierge was outstanding!
text: Perfect location for a performance at Carnegie Hall. The concierge Dana was warm and secured a dinner reservation at an incredible restaurant at 10:30 pm on a Sunday. Made for a perfect night. Highly recommend.

title: The People Change Everything
text: The location of this hotel is ideal.  The condition is . . . Better days to come.  But what it lacks in modernization and style is made up for 100 times with the people.  I've stayed a few times and in January 2023 I faced being incapacitated and in great deal of pain whilst staying at this property.  This team could not have been better and more kind.  And 2 people in particular made what was an awful time so wonderful.  I have to call out the Manager, Chisom Okafor.  She is so kind and generous and could not have been kinder.  Then there is the Concierge, Dana Steer.  This man saved me.  He went so far and beyond I couldn't believe it.  I appreciate the staff so much and their kindness is unending.

title: Chris, the concierge
text: The Hotel, the Location, the ReceptionStaff are great but Chris,  The Concierge, was amazingly helpful with every issue that came up during our stay. He did the greatest job. Thanks a lot. We will definitively come back!

title: Wouldn't stay here again.
text: I gave this hotel two stars for location and management assistance. The room was described as "cosy King" and as upgraded with a park view. "Closety" would have been a better description. The view was of the tops of some trees through buildings. The stopper in the bathroom sink was missing-fortunately we didn't drop anything. No way to get change at the front desk. Worst Marriott property at which we've stayed. Waste of points.

title: Big thanks to Vijay!
text: Arranging travel for a colleague this week and was very pleased with the customer service, particularly from Vijay at the front desk — who was patient, accommodating, kind, and professional over the course of several changes in several days. My compliments to him and the staff for all of their help!

title: Rude manager, subpar service, overpriced, lamest breakfast around.
text:
We booked a Jr suite at this hotel because we had friends staying there.  We arrived from the airport past 5 PM, they told us that our room was not ready because the previous guests were frequent travelers and had the right to late check out. That was crazy enough, nevertheless we left to give them time. When we came back two hours later, our room was still not ready. We went for dinner and at 10:30 PM we were finally able to check in. The sofa bed was not made, nothing to make it in the closet, not enough towels. 
We book 4 nights. On the second day, we left in the morning and we came back at around 5PM, the room was not service. They told us that they were going to do it at that time so we left for a couple of hours despite being tired. 
When we came, we dis not have enough towels for the three of us. So I decided to go downstairs and talk to the manager. I do not know if the person I talked to was the manager or another employee, he did not introduce himself properly and lacked or kind of skills for the job since, instead of give me an apology after I told him all the inconveniences, he started to justify every single issue. Here is when it gets crazier, he said that they can not know when other guests are checking out when they have the privilege for a late check out , that normally they do not prepare the sofa beds for a 3rd guest or have the bedding and that you always have to call and ask. BUT then to justify that the room was not serviced, he said that they do it every other day. Is asked if this was stated on the website because I did not see it there, like I did not see anywhere where it says that after 4PM you might not have the right to check in if somebody else decides to do a late check out. He kept trying to convince me that not service the hotel every day is a common practice in all Marriotts. Again it is not what it says on the website. 
When I was leaving more upset than before, I looked back and he was laughing with one of the front desk employees. I asked him if he was mocking me and he threatened me with calling security. I asked him his name and he said:”you are not getting my name”.

title: Great concierge
text: We stayed over the Presidents’ Day weekend.  The concierge was so professional, made countless calls to assist on our behalf and always greeted us by name and with a smile. He made our whole stay happen.

title: Thanks Dana.
text:
Dana up and above service helped with a special request for my family.   There is still great some placed in the world stil
It was a last minute request. No questions asked and took care of it right away!
SH

title: Since when did Marrriott start lying to its guests, and what’s worse, it’s elite members???
text: Poor service and dishonesty unlike anything I’ve experienced. I’m a high status member with both Hilton and Marriott…I booked a full price junior suite with a request for a view and/or high floor. I received a 7th floor room with no view. I was told that all junior suites are on or below the 7th floor (sounds like BS, but have nothing to confirm otherwise…EXCEPT for the prior discussion had with hotel staff upon booking that a high floor request would be NO ISSUE AT ALL). I booked for 3 nights, and I was told no upgrades were available and all suites were sold out. However, upon searching online (multiple sites including Marriott.com) I noticed suites listed available to book. It was true that they did not show available for Fri (my check in might), but there were rooms listed/available to book thereafter. It’s a real shame that a simple request for a high floor that is consistently granted elsewhere, and especially with Hilton (always), had to be refused and go without an easy remedy of upgrading the room for the next days. To top it off, I was told the information I saw was inaccurate. Just to clarify and confirm, the hotel’s website is STILL showing availability of a suite for tonight, my last night here.

title: BAD EXPERIENCE - PESSIMA ESPERIENZA
text:
Hotel curato ma personale totalmente inesperto. 
Non sanno gestire le colazioni, la prima mattina sono sceso alle 7.05 ordinando la mia colazione arrivata alle 8.07. Il personale di sala confonde le comande, non si ricorda nulla di quello che il cliente chiede. Alle 8.07 sono arrivate 2 cose di 5 che avevo ordinato. 

Stessa cosa il secondo giorno. Colazione ordinata alle 7.15, alle 8.00 ancora non era pronta. Chiedo per 3 volte a distanza di un quarto d’ora che fine avesse fatto la mia colazione, le prima due volte mi hanno detto che stava arrivando, la terza volta dopo 45 minuti mi dicono che si son scordati di ordinarla. Chiedo se fosse possibile farla in fretta e prenderla a portar via ed il personale mi dice di si. 
Delle 4 cose che ho ordinato mi danno solo 1 cosa, quindi aspettando le altre cose ordinate mi siedo al tavolo delle colazioni, aspettando le altre cose che avevo ordinato. Il cameriere con i tatuaggi viene e mi manda via, cacciandomi, dicendo che non potevo consumare la colazione al tavolo perché l’avevo chiesta a portar via. Ho spiegato la situazione, gli ho detto stavo aspettando da 45 minuti, e che mancavano altri 3 piatti ordinati ma non ha voluto sentire ragioni. Mi ha detto che dovevo mangiare fuori dall’hotel. 

In conclusione ho mangiato sul tavolo, le altre cose non mi sono mai arrivate. Cameriere maleducato, impara le buone maniere.

title: Happy staff, happy guests
text:
We stayed 3 weekends in a row at Le Méridien. We had nothing but stellar service, from the time we called in to request adjoining rooms, to the time we arrived and were greeted by the front door valets.  We’ve stayed at several Marriott and other brand properties and this by far is the best for value in NYC.  The front desk folks (Sonam and  Nathima helped us with some requests without hesitation ) are the happiest people.  In fact, everyone here  is happy. How clean is this place? So clean that we even saw one of their custodians vacuuming the outdoor rug! The location is great, Central to everything and not crowded with people and tourists.  A block away from Central Park, 5 mins to 5th Ave shopping, 15 min walk to Columbus Circle and Lincoln Center or 5 min taxi ride, 
For those negative reviews about things not working and old rooms,  we never encountered any of these issues.  This is an older property but all the furnishings are well kept and maintained.  Great gym too.  They have a restaurant on site that serves breakfast and is a Japanese restaurant at night. Rooftop bar with views. 
Thank you Le Méridien

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Its location made it perfect for me. Sonam the concierge was wonderful and helpful. Matari at the front door was so welcoming and kind.  The hotel was lovely. It’s price point is great and central is across the street.  Definitely will return.  Thanks to all

title: Great location by the park
text: Regularly stay here when traveling to NY. Location is near the park, subway stop, theater district and lots of shopping and dining places. Dana, the concierge, is very knowledgeable on highlights of the city and he’s my go to for restaurant recommendations.

title: Good place to stay
text: I enjoyed staying at this hotel - it wasn't fancy, but it had all the amenities I needed; it was clean, the staff was helpful, and a big plus is that it was centrally located to all the places I wanted to go, and reasonably priced. I wasn't impressed with the breakfast at the hotel but there are cafes close enough that it wasn't an issue.

title: Very nice place
text:
The hotel is pretty nice, the view on the park is beautiful, the room is good looking. And Sonam has been very friendly and helpful. 
The breakfast could be improved…
Thanks for everything and we’ll come back for sure !

title: First amazing experience at Le Meridien
text: This is my first experience at Le Meridien New York and it has been an amazing first experience since I stepped into the hotel. In addition to spectacular design, the staffs were very welcoming and friendly. Thank you Sonam for an excellent service and made my first experience at Le Meridien extremely wonderful. I cannot wait to come back next time I visited New York and would highly recommend to all my friends and family!

title: Don’t stay here
text: This property does not live up to Marriott standards.  I stayed in room 1308. The phone and safe did not work. The bathroom sink clogged.  You could barely call the shower water hot. The furniture looked worn. The whole property needs to be updated. The lack of room service is an issue. Marriott has been know for giving you a good breakfast. However from running out of bacon to tiny plates, the whole experience was poor.  Next time I’ll pay the up-charge and stay at the Thompson (the old Parker Méridien).

title: 10/10 recommend!
text: My best friend and I just checked out of the Le Meridien and only have glowing reviews! The rooms and amenities were amazing and location is unmatched. It was central but not too loud or touristy. The staff was also friendly and high accommodating - shout out to Eddie, Sean and Raphael! If you’re looking for an amazing place to stay in Manhattan this is it!

title: Needs renovations desperately
text:
I travel frequently and stay almost exclusively at Marriott properties (Platinum member, 50+nights/year). This property did not live up to its Premium brand expectation. We were in a suite, room 2704.
-Furniture very worn down.
