-Only USB outlets on one side of the bed, not the other. Power outlet being the built in nightstand impossible to get to.
-Useless power outlets in random places of the room.
-TVs did not work.
-Bedroom window had huge cracks and a hole (fortunately on the outer pane).
-Bathroom sinks did not have stoppers - I was so afraid of dropping an earring or ring down the drain.
-Commode had a vent that made a loud wind-tunnel sound CONSTANTLY. We had to close both bathroom doors when sleeping but still barely muffled the sound.
-Hotel room door did not close all the way - had to make sure to push/pull it closed evert time. Big safety issue.
-This is a little thing -- but why is the closet in the "living room" area and not the bedroom? 
-As of January 2023 there is construction happening outside the hotel. During the day there was constant loud noise. Not ideal if you need to take calls business calls from your room or want to sleep in in the morning.

What was nice about the hotel:
-Staff were all kind and attentive to requests. Even apologetic when things weren't able to be resolved -- like stoppers for the sinks. 
-The rooftop bar was a great vibe, great drinks.
-Location is great and is certainly less expensive than some of the nicer hotels in the immediate area.
-Room was clean.
-Bed was comfortable.

Recommendations to property: schedule a modernization renovation soon!

title: Excellent stay
text: We had a really great stay at Le Meridien Central Park NYC. Our room was very comfortable and provided all amenities that we required throughout our stay. We never had any issue. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They always say hello when passing reception and ask you how your day is. The location is great for Central Park, Columbus Circle and all areas in Midtown. The subway is close by and you can travel to any area of Manhattan within minutes. We definitely recommend this property if you are staying in NYC.

title: Do not stay here!!!
text: The worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at!!  I have Marriott Elite status and have stayed at many Marriotts and other hotels. First, beware of the bait and switch. There was a hotel called The Parker Meridian which was next door. It is now The Thompson. Marriott decided to call this Le Meridian so people are confused and think it is that hotel. Not  sure what this hotel was before but the rooms are tiny and so dated! Needs a major refurb. Lobby is a joke. Elevators are small and crowded. Pot smoke in the hallways every night. Many better places for less money. Do not stay here!!!

title: One and Done
text:
One of the worst experiences I have ever had....with the bonus of high prices!
Strike one: we arrived at 9:45 PM and asked where the bars/restaurants were. They pointed to a door of a restaurant but said they were likely going to close soon. Indeed they were. But they suggested the roof top bar might be open and might have appetizers. We went to the front desk and asked them to call upstairs. They replied that the bar did not have a phone! Which of course is false....So we went upstairs to see for ourselves if the bar was open. It was just closing. So out of luck. We returned  to the front desk and asked if they had room service They said no.. We asked for restaurant recommendations and after struggling  to think of any restaurant, they sent us to a very bad Italian restaurant. 

Strike 2: the room smelled of chemicals and the bed was super soft. 

Strike 3: At 7:00 am the next morning I was woken up by incredibly loud pile drivers which shook the earth. When I complained downstairs to the manager,  she --and not in a friendly way -- said the hotel had put notes in each of our rooms that there was going to be a lot of noise each day starting a 7: am. Her tone was almost accusatory that I had not read the note. No apology at all. 

I checked out early and will never return. I left a small note on my bed telling the hotel that.......I hope they found it.........

title: Worst hotel ever!
text: I am a loyal Marriot customer and this hotel was abysmal. First, they cancelled our room even after we called to inform them that we were going to be checking in a day late because Southwest cancelled our flights. We arrived and they didn't have the room or another double bed to offer. After waiting 30 minutes at midnight with a small child, for their MANAGER Cody that was ON PROPERTY, he strolled in REEKING of marijuana and completely unsympathetic or willing to assist. After insisting we needed a place to stay,  he begrudgingly "upgraded" us to a pathetic "suite" that construction was happening outside the window. The jackhammer started at 7am and didn't finish until the evening. The pull out sofa was a like sleeping on cinder blocks. They refused to give us any of our money back or offer us points in compensation for us leaving the hotel. My daughter and I had to move to another Marriot location and they wouldn't even transfer money to the other location. Stay away from this hotel!!

title: Monangi USA Trip
text:
The hotel is located centrally in New York and many tourist attractions and eating places are in walkable distance. The staff across front office, concierge and housekeeping are amazing. Their advise and guidance is very helpful.  

Mr. Dana Steer, concierge staff, has been very helpful and his tremendous efforts made our trip more special and could cover more areas, good pricing for buying attractions and shows, a lot of patience..

title: Great location
text: I stayed for a couple nights. Great location near a zillion subway lines, walk to the theater district or the park. Room was clean. I stayed on the side opposite construction so that worked out better - although you can still hear it a little bit. The hotel is the same block as Carnegie Hall. It’s also next to a 24 hour grocery store (Morton Williams) and a Walgreens. Plenty of options right of the door to eat and drink. Friendly staff. I’d return if I need to be I that neighborhood.

title: Experience was bad
text: First, the beds are so low they're like army cots. You're almost on the ground. I asked about this at the front desk and they said there was nothing they could do, This is just what you'll have to sleep on if you go here.  Next, the air-conditioning unit broke down at 3 in the morning on a very hot August night.  A maintenance man tried to fix it, and it  did work for a few minutes, then went out again.   They moved me to another room and  guess what?  The air-conditioning wasn' t  working there either.  The beginning half of the shower has immovable doors, so you've got to approach the shower from the back, making it hard to adjust the water temperature before you get scalded.  The view I had was of the walls of other buildings.   The staff did try to help, but there's a lot they can't fix. They;ve got the slowest elevators on the planet.  Don't be fooled--this is not the old Meridien.

title: Great location, pleasant staff, bad beds
text:
Le Meridien is the old Viceroy hotel- next to but NOT the old great  Parker Meridien- which was a great hotel for families. That old hotel is now the  Thompson. FYI- the " famous"-  hidden burger place is accessible in the Thompson lobby next door. 

Le Meridien hotel is in a great location and the staff was quite pleasant There is currently a lot of construction noise out front, which they cannot do anything about but they do offer earplugs etc. Decent sushi place, free hot chocolate, roof top bar/ lounge. Beds were terrible- very low to the floor and of poor quality. Bathroom is nice and is roomy for NYC. 

If you want to be close to common tourist stuff- Central Park, 5th Ave, the Met, Broadway theatres, Rockefeller, plenty of restaurants, etc. - All are walkable.  I think the Hotel is priced appropriately. A bed upgrade would be appreciated. I would also say again that the Staff was very nice- universally and remarkably so- and I appreciated that.

title: Better confirm your reservation!
text: I booked a room over a month in advance and after a long drive, I was told my reservation was canceled when I went to check in. I was told they had issues with heating so they cancelled my reservation. I was never contacted about this change. Then had to spend a chunk of my getaway scrambling for a place to stay. Do NOT recommend!

title: A wonderful stay at a wonderful time of year! (with a christmas tree in the room!!)
text:
We came to New York and booked Le Meridan for Christmas, hoping it was going to be magical.

It was that and more! 

But a big shoutout goes to Chris who helped arrange a beautful & real Christmas tree in our suite on our arrival at very short notice. (sorry about that!!)

Thanks everyone at Le Meridian for your wonderful hospitality at such a special time of year.

title: FELT AS COMFY AS HOME!
text: Our 2- week stay after the sale of our NYC apartment was simply great!  Accommodations were very comfortable and the staff, especially Dana Steer at the Concierge Desk, responded immediately to any need -- and actually anticipated those that would make our stay feel "more like home"!   Success!  The time flew by and we felt like we were part of the Le Meridien New York family.   Thanks so very much for taking such good care of us...................Bobbi Burke

title: Not the luxury hotel it's advertised
text:
The fall/early winter in NYC is expensive for hotels and the rooms are small.  But this was over the top expensive on a Wednesday evening (close to $600 a night for a basic king room) and TINY.   

Upon check-in as a Titanium Bonvoy member when I asked if any upgrades were available (I'm not ever delusional about getting a big suite, but I'm usually given a corner room or something on a higher floor) I was told that if I had higher status maybe I would have gotten an upgrade.  A comment like that from anyone at the front desk is unnecessary and makes you feel unwelcome. 

Some reviews talk about the breakfast, you will spend extra money as the amount per person barely covers anything on the menu.  There is a grocery store right next door with food and water options.

TINY room, for a high price, and a snobby front desk person - NO THANKS!

title: Avoid at all costs!
text:
This is not a four star hotel. The rooms are minuscule (even by NY standards) and very dated. On top of that there is massive construction going on across the street. To their credit, the front desk team does warn you of this upon check in and tried to find us a room that is as insulated from the noise as possible.

We also took great umbrage with the attitude and unprofessional demeanor of the concierge, Dana Steer. In 15 years of staying at SPG/Marriott hotels, I’ve never encountered such a paltry disposition towards guests.

Do yourself a favor and check into one of the countless other Bonvoy hotels in the city.

title: Old and tired...
text:
Room and furnishings were old and tired. The service at the restaurant during both dinner and breakfast was slow and inattentive, the biggest surprise came when I saw my bill... 

As a Platinum Member with Marriott Bonvoy, I was offered a free breakfast in lieu of points. I accepted the breakfast only to be charged for it (about $42). I spoke to the front desk about the charge, and they said they would take care of it. They gave me a $10 credit.

I am sure there is not a property in their global portfolio where you can get a $10 breakfast, much less in New York! What a joke of a property and response...

title: Amazing concierge experience
text: Le Meridien’s concierge team, Dana, Chris, and Asimina did a wonderful job for our stay this past weekend. We needed a babysitter for a weekend night and they worked with their local babysitting company to get this arranged and set up for us. The sitter was amazing and my husband and I were able to enjoy a date night out in city with no worries! The concierge team followed up with me several times before we arrived and helped arrange everything. Thank you concierge team for all your help! The hotel also had the crib we requested ready and extra pillows for our room. Amazing service all the way!

title: Great Hotel
text: Excellent hotel. Close to Central Park. Relatively close to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, and Theaters. Excellent Front Desk and Concierge staff. Superb housekeeping. For a NYC hotel it is very quiet.  Concierge can make great recommendations and reservations. Front Desk is very quick and accurate.

title: Concierge Dana is 10/10!!
text: I can’t thank Dana from the concierge team and the housekeeping team enough for their immediate responsiveness when I accidentally left my suits in the closet and left for another engagement in Los Angeles. I realized my mistake last night and by early this morning Dana Steer and Shawn Waiters had located the suits and physically walked them down to FedEx and is having them sent overnight. Talk about service!  Wish I was there to thank them personally.  We’ll definitely be back.

title: Very disappointing stay over Thanksgiving
text:
First, the good news: The people were all great and tried to be helpful.
Now the bad news: 1) The room was clean, but there was a perimeter of deep dust around the carpet that showed the cleaning was not thorough. 2) we did not get housecleaning on our first day. We returned late to an unmade bed, full garbage cans, and no clean towels. The desk said there was no housekeeping at that time. After 45 minutes, and a trip to the desk, they brought up lots of towels. The person at the desk said that if she were not alone she would have brought them up immediately, and I believed her-she was very accommodating. 3) no breakfast on Thanksgiving morning. 4) On Saturday, there was a free buffet that was kind of like a lower-level Marriott property would have.  5) heater was awful! Initially, it would not heat, and we had engineering come up. They told us to crank it up to 78!! Actually, we were never fully comfortable, but 80 on the thermostat seemed to correspond to about 68 in the room. There was a thin blanket, no extras. 

I have stayed at Le Meridien around the country, and this was the worst property of the type I have experienced. And I prepaid through the Tripadvisor club, so I could not even leave. Even at $100/night it would not have been adequate. for $480/night it was a nightmare.

title: Run down and expensive
text:
Check-in was less than friendly.
Rooms are dreary and very small and the bathrooms are dated and moldy. There’s only a very small closet and one drawer to put away our things. We were only advised at check-in that there would be construction all day starting at 7am( and not at booking). On a positive note, the housekeeper was very nice and friendly and the room was very clean.

title: Superb accommodation and staff support
text: I was there for just one night, for business meetings in midtown. The room was just right, and the service top-notch. I asked for additional coffee pods, for example, and they came in a few minutes! Most important, special shout out to Dana and Chris, concierges par excellence, who found a lost item and quickly arranged to ship it to me. It's an expensive place, but in terms of location and comforts it's definitely worth considering! Thanks --

title: Good for a couples stay in midtown
text: we spent 2 nights at le meridien in late October. good location for a combination of midtown work + restaurants, theater etc. room was small but comfortable and clean. front desk and other staff attentive. we were concerned about noise but slept soundly both nights

title: Go anywhere else!
text: Smaller than small rooms.  Slower than slow elevators.  Any Marriott in NYC would be better.  Nice staff, great location.  No room in bathroom.  Makeup mirror made for someone 6 ft or taller.  Old room and not well maintained

title: Incredible Staffing
text:
This is the 2nd year I've utilized the Le Meridien, New York for the NYC marathon weekend! Ricardo remembered me from the year before- impeccable customer service while being down to earth. 
My room was ready but it needed a manager inspection. The manager found that I needed a new air filter and had it replaced. 
The concierge was wonderful with holding my bags when I forgot to call ahead for my car- which allowed me to enjoy a walk on a beautiful day to a cafe for the most amazing bagel. 
The staff is quick, courteous and the hotel is kept very clean.

title: Great Location
text: Great location, friendly staff, very clean. Everything I need! Be aware there's construction across the street from the hotel that starts early in the morning. Would definitely return the next time I'm in NYC.

title: Terrible
text:
I booked this hotel through the Marriott web site. This hotel does not acknowledge your Marriott status. I am a life platinum member.
I was at this hotel for 11 nights, I receive a room on the lowest floor, near the elevator, no view, construction noise was unbearable, and the bathroom sink was broken. 
I sent hotel management two complaints. They answered one week after my stay. 
I am done with Le Meridians.

title: Good location
text: Came up a day early with my husband for a work conference. Stayed in room 2702 for one evening. Overall the room was nice and comfortable. Hotel is in a great location near many local attractions and different subway lines. Easy walk to Central park and Time Square. The only complaint was it took a really long time to get hot water in the morning, it did eventually get hot. The staff was friendly and welcoming. I would recommend this hotel although pricey.

title: Mrs.
text:
I’ve stayed at Le Meridian several times this past year and I keep coming back, as I’ve had a wonderful experience!

The staff I have to say, is one of the reasons why- I had great help with Newton Smith to work the T.V. !

Dana Steer at the Concierge was our absolute HERO! He got us a reservation which was Impossible to get into!
He went WAY ABOVE and BEYOND for us and we really appreciated if!!!

I think the staff is the number 1 reason we keep coming back and the location is great too!

We will be back, that’s for sure!

Nell

title: Just awful
text: Was there for 3 nights and will not go back.  Room was tiny, furniture was uncomfortable and place was unbelievably noisy.  The hotel fails to tell you on the reservation page that across the street they are tearing down a building and literally using dynamite beginning at 7:30 a.m.  The intake vent in the bathroom was as loud as a jet engine and there was no way to turn it down.  Other than the doorman, the staff was indifferent to the guests. All of this for a pretty high nightly rate.  Terrible value.  I am a long standing Bon Voy member and you want my loyalty but I feel taken advantage of.

title: Great choice for us (and our pets) on the NYC marathon weekend!
text: Wonderful room with partial view of Central Park (just 2 blocks away) and fabulous architecture of the neighboring buildings, great staff, pet-friendly! ($100 per visit surcharge), super rooftop bar with small outdoor area. The hotel worked great for our visit to watch our daughter run in the marathon! (She loved the post-run shower in the lovely, spacious bathroom.) Our only complaint was the air circulation in the room (could not get the temperature down on a warm weekend) and the elevators could be slow.

title: Disappointing
text: Popped into NYC for a concert weekend and decided to try this hotel since it was in a good location for The Beacon Theatre. The staff were friendly and it’s a good location if you want to walk around Columbus Circle, Central Park or UWS. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a junior suite, which was a nice perk and we were happy to have the extra space. Unfortunately, nothing met our expectations. The room had a huge, beautiful floor-to-ceiling window wall, but the glass was so filthy on the outside it was unpleasant to look through. The air was noisy and the filter was dirty. The room itself was dingy and the furniture looked old, like 70s nautical. The water pressure was weak. The rooftop bar was enclosed and very stuffy - we went early when it wasn’t crowded and walked back out because it was way too warm. Would not stay here again, there are plenty of other options.

title: Wonderful stay near Central Park!
text: A great hotel tucked into the heart of midtown, close to many great restaurants and of course Central Park. The room was clean and cozy with nice decor touches. The front desk staff were competent and friendly! Would definitely recommend it!

title: Not what I expected
text: first night the AC woke me up at 4am with a rattling noise and didn't stop, so I lost sleep. Next day, tried to work in room but jackhammers for 12 hours, 7am to 7pm. Next day the room next to me had blue painter's tape all over it and they were doing construction so my room smelled of pain thinner for the rest of my stay. Very overpowering, so much so they put an ozone air machine in my room.

title: You gotta check out this hotel!!
text: We had a great time at this hotel! The staff was very hospitable and willing to help us and make sure that our stay was a good one. I would recommend this hotel to any one trying to stay in NYC. I know that I surely will!

title: Best Hotel in New York City - Location, Location, Location + SERVICE
text: The Meridien on 57th is my go to hotel for business and leisure trips.  My favorite staff members are the front desk (especially Sanjay)- they are always helpful and kind and make you feel at home!  The hotel is clean and boutique like ... it is like home away from home!

title: Best location, unique Art Deco decor and great rate makes this a 'must stay' NYC hotel
text:
I never normally stay around Central Park due to the higher cost but the rate here was better than around Times Square or Downtown
The way to see NYC is by walking and I was able to get everywhere with ease from this location. I had a corner room facing 57th Street on a high floor and unusually for NYC I got a great night's sleep - you are in the middle of all the action but not all the hustle. Finally, the Art Decor interior was original and delightful. My check in was slick and I was able to check in early. Perfect stay

title: Two Thumbs Up Hotel
text: The Location is great! Heart of New York City! Pubilc Transportion is easy. The hotel staffs is very friendly. Room is very Clean. large size TV.  The breakfast menu is good. but it can improve with more selection. Check-in and Check-out no issue.

title: Stay on 57th Street
text: Lovely hotel- excellent location. I have only the highest recommendation as the staff go out of their way to make one's stay most enjoyable. This is true of the room attendants as well as front desk employees. Do try the continental breakfast- a real treat!

title: Great location for everything
text:
Location… location… location.  I’ve stayed at this hotel earlier and had a great experience. Hence the reason I’ve returned and had another delightful stay. 
It was my birthday celebration with my daughter and the extended family. Walked everywhere and enjoyed our stay.

title: NYC Getaway
text: For NYC standards, we were so impressed with the size of the room, including spacious walk-in shower and separate toilet room! Location is excellent and service was impeccable! Price was good considering there is construction in the area making the room noisier than usual during daytime hours.  We would stay here again!!

title: Great location
text: Great location and easy check in. Staff very friendly and welcoming.  Room and bathroom could probably see a refresh. Room had a beautiful outdoor terrace looking over 57th Street. Would definitely stay again

title: Solid experience
text: Nice clean room. Light wasn’t working in first room but they made the room switch super easy.  Room was clean and functional and location was near everything which is all you want for a NY business trip

title: Best hotel for work trips!
text: The staff was very kind and helpful throughout my stay. I was greeted with a glass of rose and received an upgrade to a room with a balcony. So happy I stayed at Le Meridien Central Park! Highly recommend.

title: Fantastic option close to Central Park!
text: This was my first time staying at this property but wanted something close to Central Park and the theater district. Wow what a pleasant surprise! Beautiful accommodations all around. The view was spectacular and the room cleanliness and amenities were top notch.  Would absolutely stay again - and for longer next time!

title: An excellent place to stay!
text:
Le Meridien is an excellent place to stay for your visit to the city.  Away from the chaos of midtown and close to Central Park and Lincoln Center.  

The lobby doesn't have all the trappings of a chaotic hotel, which, in my view is not needed in Manhattan as there are so many places nearby to eat and drink.

title: Beautiful hotel close to the park
text: Beautiful hotel with beautiful new york style rooms. It also has a great spacious gym. I really enjoyed being two blocks away from central park and with access to the F line. The concierge desk was very helpful as well.

title: Very good stay
text: I have stayed in this hotel now a few times.  The rooms are very comfortable and the staff definitely went out of their way to give me the right room.  Will continue to return.  Conveniently located as well.

title: Good location, tiny spaces
text:
Le Méridien New York, Central Park is located on West 57th street between 6th and 7th avenue. The location is great: you're close to all the Midtown action and one block away from Central Park.

While the rooms are a lot better than the typical cookie cutter hotels, they are still tiny. This also applies to the lobby and some of the other public spaces. While I'm mentioning this explicitly, it's wasn't a dealbreaker for me, because space is not a commodity in most parts of New York City.

I must admit the building and the rooms looked  bigger on the pictures though. The lack of space doesn't make it feel like a full service hotel compared to other Le Méridien properties.

The room itself looked good. The bed had an nice wooden construction/casing that served as a headboard and that had closets built into it.

The bathroom was absolutely tiny, however the shower was very modern. The sink was placed outside of the bathroom in the bedroom itself and had the same style as the shower. 

Water pressure in the shower wasn't great though.

I would return to Le Méridien New York, Central Park if I need to be in this location or if the price was lower than some of the competing properties in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Must Stay
text: I had a great time in New York at the Le Meridian. The staff was great and the location was even better. The rooms were very nice and bigger than I expected them to be given that it’s Manhattan and space is as a premium. I can’t wait to be back.

title: Great location, and well designed!
text: The perfect location for a mother/daughter weekend in the city! Our room had views of the park, and was well thought out and designed. An easy walk to the park, Rockefeller Center, Lincoln Center and the 57th St subway. I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it!

title: Fantastic location and service
text: Right in the heart of midtown. Close to Central Park, shopping, and an incredible selection of restaurants. For such a bustling part of the neighborhood, the quality of the room and space were first class.

title: Fantastic Midtown Stay
text: Loved our stay at Le Meridian.  The location is perfect to walk to so many places with lots of restaurants and shops nearby.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room size was great and it was very clean and well appointed.  The beds and the pillows were so soft and comfortable.  I will be booking to stay here again on my next trip.

title: Great spot and staff
text: Clean and neat with amazing rooms and roof bar. Staff was helpful and let me check in early. rooms are neat and clean. I would stay here again! Check out the roof deck. Located just south of the park makes it easy to get around the city.

title: Fabulous location for reasonable price
text: If you only have one day to transfer and want to see New York City and feel the magical atmosphere of Manhattan, this hotel is for you. Just 5 minutes walk from Central Park with communication and close to boutiques on 5th Ave. What more could you want?

title: New York Anytime of Year
text: Been to NYC many times, and absolutely loved the size and feel of Le Meridien. Great people working throughout the property, making our stay very memorable. Highly recommend if you are looking for a smaller property feel in the heart of the big city.

title: Lovely room & accommodating staff
text:
My fiancée and I just spent two nights in NYC and needed to be uptown to see a show and had a wonderful stay at Le Meridian. We were checked in by Lydia who was so friendly and hooked us up with a great room and free breakfast. The room was beautiful, clean and very sheik. The lobby breakfast was just ok,  but we weren't in NYC to eat hotel food. 

The best thing about staying here is the amazing bar on the roof! Really great tiki drinks!

The bad:  currently there is some heavy duty construction happening across the street. On top of the typical NYC street noise there are bulldozers and BLASTING going on,  so if you don't sleep like the dead, maybe look elsewhere.

title: Top-notch NY stay
text: This is my 3rd or 4th time staying at this hotel and it is my favorite place to stay in NY. Each staff member always goes out of their way to make sure my stay is top-notch. Whether it's the front desk staff of Sonam or Vijay, or the concierges Chris, Dana and a new woman whose name I forgot, they all go above and beyond. My room was perfect. Good view although a little noise from a building being put up across the street. Not the fault of the hotel. The hotel has the best location. Great access to subways, buses and any part of the city quickly.

title: Consistent quality, fantastic for business travel
text: I frequently travel to NYC for business and one of my top choices is Le Meridien. Very consistent quality, absolutely friendly staff, great location and beautiful rooftop bar. It is a pretty unique combination that you appreciate the more you stay at the hotel. You feel as if you are part of the family

title: Great location, with stellar accomodations.
text: Very accommodating hotel! Great location with comfortable beds. Hotel restaurant has a great happy hour. The professional staff is on point. Checking in was seamless. Arrived early and was offered an early check in.

title: Beautiful property but rooftop bar was subpar
text: Le Meridien New York, Central Park was a beautiful and clean property. The staff of the hotel was great but the rooftop bar staff were very immature and lied to me. Recommend the hotel highly, but I would hop a block north if you want a cool rooftop view and good service.

title: A+ for business travel
text: The staff at Le Meridien Central Park are fantastic - they are attentive and always ready to help with anything you need.  The location of the hotel is excellent - a walk through Central Park is practically on the door step as are many great restaurants.  As a business traveler, I find this hotel to be my go to for my NYC trips - convenient to the businesses I work with and close to everything I want to do when not working - including a subway to jump downtown or wherever.  Highly recommend Le Meridien New York Central Park!

title: Unique style
text: Boutique hotel conveniently located near Central Park! Love the style of decor which I haven’t seen anywhere else. Staff was friendly, although service could be faster. I called for some cutlery and some toothpaste, and for both requests I needed to follow up with a second call 15 mins later to remind them.

title: I stay here often because of it's central location, access to Central Park and it's coziness
text: I often stay at Le Meridien and always enjoy the time there. The rooms are small but comfortable. The front desk goes out of their way to give me a room facing 57 Street, which I prefer. The staff is attentive and congenial.

title: Cool place in the middle of it all
text: Spent a weekend in the City with my wife and this low profile property exceeded our expectations. Great location. Views from higher floors are really something. Rooftop bar is very cool - go early and enjoy the music, the vibe, the drinks/small plates, and the lack of people. Rooms are super clean and well appointed. Lobby is small but this place is close to everything, safe, and delivers a high quality experience.

title: Problem solvers
text: I stayed at the Le Meridien for business. I arrived early in the am to find out my reservation had not recorded properly. While I had reserved two nights, the computer reflected only one and I wasn’t scheduled to arrive until the following night.  What could have been a major problem was quickly resolved be a very accommodating and friendly front desk staff member.  While I don’t recall his name, he was fantastic. Thanks to him I had a room for two nights!  The stay overall was very good.  Bed was comfortable. Shower was a little dated with missing grout.  Room was spacious enough. I’d return.

title: Good locating just worn out facility
text: Very worn and dated facility. Staff was nice and allowed for an early checkin. When I called with a question and asked to speak to a manger I was informed they were all in a meeting for an hour. When someone calls me back he showed NO empathy for my situation.

title: Great stay for business trip
text: Great location and very friendly staff. I was only in town for the night, however, I was greeted by CJ (if I remember correctly) at the front desk who quickly got me checked in and let me know of all the amenities with the times associated. I loved the bed with the leather head board and ample side table space. It was great to relax and be able to sit in bed and do work. I loved the design of the room. I had to change my check out time and a quick call down to the front desk they were able to accommodate. The door men helped me get a taxi to the airport as well. Great stay! I will be staying there again!

title: Great hotel in Central Park
text: Stayed here for one night for a business meeting and it is a fantastic hotel. Incredible location and a tremendous value given the quality of the hotel and service level. Very impressed with the room, level of finishing and location. Would recommend.

title: Five Days at Le Meridian
text: Enjoyed my stay here. Intimate style that's a step above the typical chain hotel experience.  Incredibly responsive staff and cleaning crew. A location that is hard to beat with their proximity to Central Park and so many great restaurants, and a subway on each side of the block they're on. Used the fitness room every day and a few nights had drinks in their downstairs bar, which had a fun but cozy atmosphere.

title: Good experience for combined biz/tourist visit to NYC.
text: Smallish, intimate Marriott (Le Meridien) property on bustling W 57th Street.  Very clean room and common areas.  Surprisingly quiet, considering the heart of midtown position (though mine was inside/rear room, not on 57th St side, which I assume is louder).  Wonderful location, whether for business or tourism (2 blocks to Central Park).  Sad, dark view of HVAC system and neighboring wall was one of the few low points.  LOVE that there is a coffeemaker (standard) and mini-fridge (very nice surprise).  Extremely courteous and efficient staff.  In particular, Vijay at the front desk provided superior service and politely and professionally took care of a minor billing issue (I had been bumped from the not-ready new Le Meridien 5th Ave and re-booked here).  Marriott needs more employees like Vijay.  Great stay for this lifetime Bonvoy Platinum member.  Look forward to visiting this hotel again.

title: Loved my stay here
text: Loved my stay here. Great staff. Great location. I would stay here again. Lovely environment. I love the fact that it is close to all the restaurants and amenities. I could not have asked for a better stay.

title: NYC wedding weekend
text: Great location in heart of Manhattan! Rooms a small and amenities are limited. Restaurant downstairs has good drinks and fusion Japanese. The shower floors are slippery, use caution! The hot water worked sometimes and I let the staff know upon my departure.

title: Average hotel and over priced
text:
I had read reviews and chose this hotel for the location and mostly good reviews, however I would not recommend or stay here again. Here are more details:
1. Filthy air filter- FILTHY! 
2. No hot water
3. 2 towels- I had to ask for more.
4. No housekeeping for our entire stay and we selected we would like house keeping daily.
5. Plug ins by beds did not work. 
6. Low platform beds- not mentioned when booking.
7. Horribly loud construction- not the hotels fault- however should be on website. 
8. One bottle of water for 2 people- minor but now I am being picky. 
As a life time Marriot Elite member, I would not recommend or stay here again even though the location is great.

title: Fun Stay & Above and beyond help
text: First, I had a great experience staying at Le Meridien just off central park, the fashion and theater districts (fun hotel, cool rooftop lounge, great sights near by etc). But I was most impressed by the team and the staff who helped me track down original and sensitive financial files which I left behind in my room.  The staff took the time to collect and hold the files and the concierge proactively contacted me and overnighted the materials to me.  As a frequent traveler, I appreciate the team's attention to detail and customer centered care when following up!

title: Excellent location.
text: Its a good hotel with excellent location. Our room was small but it was clean and quiet. The pillows were great and the bed was perfect for me that have a shoulder issue. The price was OK but compared with near by hotels it was good.

title: My new favorite NYC hotel!
text: First, I booked the wrong type of room (I was bringing a friend on biz trip), and they fixed it for me before I arrived.  Next, my friend ended up having a medical emergency so we had to arrive a day late. No problem, our reservation was adjusted and fast recovery wishes were offered. I asked for early check in with no expectation of receiving as i had already received numerous favors but they accommodated. Every part of stay was easy and can’t wait to go back . My new fav hotel!

title: Wonderful hotel, Excellent value
text: 17th floor.  Room was relatively small.  Very clean.  Very comfortable king-sized bed and very comfortable bedding.  Even the pillows were great! Most importantly, the staff was terrific.  Every interaction was a wonderful experience.

title: Good clean, easy to navigate Hotel
text: Great stay and attentive staff. Its a great option if you want to stay somewhere on any easy to get to street without the insane midtown rush. Enjoyed the food at the neighboring restaurant as well and the complimentary water.

title: Best Hotel Experience in Mid Town
text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Le Meridien Central Park. WE were able to take our small  dog who is well behaved and spent time in Central Park as well as walking to our events at  Carnegie Hall. This is a great hotel and so conveniently located in mid town! Enjoy!

title: If you love jack hammers, this hotel is for you
text: There is a massive construction project across the street.  The main issue is the jack hammer noise from 7am to 6pm without pause.  It literally shakes the building and is so loud you cannot do phone calls from your room - it echoes throughout the building.

title: Great stay and special thanks to Rafael at the front door!
text: Just got home from an amazing stay at Le Meridien for a long wedding weekend. Perfectly located and super nice staff. Special shout-out to RAFAEL for getting me a taxi to JFK on a busy rainy morning and being so friendly, efficient, and gracious. He was awesome!!!

title: Moved, didn't know
text: I used to stay at Le Meridien and did not know it had moved albeit just next door.  Hotel was fine.  Only issue is I arrived early and asked to be contacted when room was ready, but no one from front desk ever reached out.  Also, coffee machine in room far from obvious....it was a fail for me completely.

title: Mediocre at best
text: This hotel is so bare bones it’s laughable. No robes or slippers. No shower caps, cotton swabs or other normal amenities in the bathrooms. They charged me $6.50 for a cup of black coffee downstairs in the morning. Housekeeping didn’t show up one day and when we asked we were told the housekeeping staff all left at 4:30 pm and we’d have to wait until the next day. Hotels like this make me want to abandon the Bonvoy program, as it’s not worth it anymore with all their nickel and diming. Oh, and awful jackhammering across the street begins promptly at 7am every morning - not the hotel’s fault but nonetheless beware!

title: Très mauvais rapport qualité prix
text:
Le principal avantage de cet hôtel est sa localisation, proche de Central Park et de la 5 eme avenue. Pour le reste l’hôtel à beaucoup vieilli, les chambres sont un peu “vintage” et la ventilation peut y être très bruyante. La réception au Rez de chaussée n’est pas digne d’un Meridien. C’est très petit et vieillot. J’ai trouvé les parties communes pas très propres. La peinture (noire) laisse voir des coups partout. Le personnel est gentil mais sans plus. Encore une fois pas digne d’un Meridien. 
Tout cela serait acceptable mais voilà les prix sont extravagants et ne se justifient que par la localisation. C’est trop juste.

title: Poorly Managed and Maintained Hotel
text: Maintenance issues with our first room as the shower wouldn’t drain. We were moved to a new room and this time, the phone was dead and the lock off door wouldn’t lock. Engineering was dispatched but couldn’t address the issues. No one ever came back to fix the phone or door the remainder of our stay. While the front desk and cleaning staff did their best, it became evident that there was a lack management at the property. Even when we requested to speak with management, they were never on site and never made an attempt to get in contact with us throughout our stay. Upon leaving, we again requested to be contacted. Still to this point, no follow up. Very disappointing experience for the cost of the hotel.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very friendly. The rooms are especially nice, with nice furnishings and a good selection of hardcover books to peruse. The view from the 24th floor is spectacular.

title: Boutique Hotel with Great staff
text:
Came from out of town to host family event near by the hotel. We had to bring over numerous decorations to the restaurant to blocks away and the doorman put everything in a cart and delivered everything to the restaurant .
I want to mention the outstanding concierge,Asimina Mitilineos. She assisted my wife and was a great help.

title: Disappointing, Dark, Dingy, Drab, Dirty...
text:
I stayed here in 2019 for a week and loved it although there were some service issues. So decided to book again - well in advance to get a great room as  a Marriot Bonvoy Gold Elite Member. 
I always have a room on a high floor and stated in my reservation months ago. I was given a dark dingy drab room on the 5th floor with filthy muddy windows - and construction outside my window - sleep? what's that?
I was told this was the only room of the room type I booked available - wouldn't one look at the reservation months in advance and realize this is not a high floor and flag?
Aside from all this I have had to make multiple requests in person and over the phone in order to receive the simplest staples like coat hangers for the closet. FOUR times requested and was completely ignored on the Marriot Bonvoy APP. Why bother having this as a tool if it's not looked at by staff?

The room itself is adequate but nothing special. Very rough around the edges, extremely dark on the sunniest day, not well cleaned on arrival, worn and needs attention for these prices. There were towels I wouldn't use as rags in my room.

@MarriotBonvoy this property is now an embarrassment to your portfolio. Check in with room not ready but more importantly no loyalty welcome at all. 

In fairness, I think the staff are spread thin and overworked. Not a good look. Please do better. I won't be back.

title: 1 night personal 3 nights business
text:
My only reason this was not 5 stars is not the hotels correction yet the location and the fact that there was jackhammering the entire stay from 7am - 6pm and one night all night long and was here for a meeting at the hotel. The staff was amazing and a special shout out to  Raphael who always seemed to be around when needed. need three hands he was there. need to reach someone, he was there. need a ride, he was there. staff at concierge was great. front desk was great. Shana and Joni to book rooms were amazing. Catrina and the staff from Life were equally amazing. lunch that was booked for our meetings was delightful.  
Will come back!

title: My most wonderful memory
text: This was the best stay in New York I ever had! Absolutely everyone of the staff was so helpful. Brian checked me in early..gave me an upgrade..showed me how to use the internet ( made me laugh a lot!) He made me feel comfortable right away because I was traveling alone. Dana,the concierge helped me tremendously with a credit card snafu I encountered.He got on the phone and fixed everything for me ( I was in a panic!)Sonam showed me how to bargain with an art gallery nearby and I got an $800 piece of art (which I fell in love with) for $500!!! The two doormen I saw all the time were very helpful and very funny! I stayed two nights and it was the most wonderful experience! My room was awesome.. I chatted with one of the chamber maids (so sweet) Needless to say..when I left, I high-fived all of them and I hugged everyone of them! I will definitely be staying there again..just felt so comfortable with everyone! I just can’t say enough!

title: Le Meridien customer review
text:
I was very impressed with Brian at the front desk.  He really made us feel welcome and offered some great suggestions.  
We were also impressed with Mena at Concierge.  She like Brian really made us feel welcome.  Unfortunately, all other Le Meridien staff we had to interact with did not meet our Marriott expectations especially in the 1st floor restaurant.

title: Good hotel and helpful staff
text: Helpful staff and good service.  Good location and well appointed rooms.  Can’t get much closer to Carnegie Hall. Avoid 509 & 510 as they are just above the hotel’s ventilation/exhaust systems and very noisy.  No makeup mirror in room 510 was inconvenient.  I will return again.

title: Old rooms
text: Stayed a decade ago and seems like never renovated. Still nice views over 57th Street and partial park view due to recent demolitions. Bed is low and hard. Carpet has no padding. Door frames are banged up and amenities are few for the high rate.

title: Television and desk lamp not functional
text: TV and desk lamp did not work, soap from a previous visitor was left in the bathroom shower. The room was 1608. Would’ve been nice for these things to have been addressed - but otherwise a very beautiful property.

title: Great stay, good location, superb hospitality
text: Kudos to the hospitality team in Le Meridien who helped me tremendously when my previous hotel was double-booked and did not have a room for me. No regrets coming to Le Meridien. Even though I was a walk-in customer, the front desk team (specifically N.D) was superb and gave me a room immediately. I later asked for a room change as I was staying long term and they were able to support me as well. Great thanks also to Vijay who was most helpful to me. Thank you and I’ll definitely choose Le Meridien New York Central Park again when I come back later this year.

title: Doesn't keep up with the name of value of " Le Meridian" name
text:
We stayed here from 10th to 13th Sept 22 in a suite.
The safe wouldn't work and was placed in a bedside drawer. The drawer came down with the safe as it wasn't drilled to the wall. of course they fixed it and also offered 2 bottles of Wine and breakfast coupons for 3 days as a gesture to show their concern for inconvenience caused.
Then the bigger problem was, the bathroom door would not shut. Their were 2 doors. One to the WC area and another one , which was main door of bathroom. They already knew that the wood of thedoor of WC area was swollen and the door wasn't operational.the bigger problem was main door f bathroom wouldn't shut ! So u do everything with door fully open.
It was a sliding door and wouldn't remain in closed position eventhough  their service personnel  tried it. Ultimately we pushed a door stopper below the sliding door from stopping it to slide in open position always!

This is not what u expect when you are paying about 700 $ a night !!
The breakfast was worse than basic. no omlette. No boiled eggs. No croissants/ pastries ..nothing.
Overall not a good experience.

title: Avoid this hotel at all costs…..
text: When you have a delayed flight that gets you to the hotel at 2:30am and they can’t check you in for a long freaking while due to their systems? I am Marriott Titanium and this DOES NOT happen. Do not stay here- plenty of other great options. I repeat- do not stay here.

title: tres decevant
text:
cet hotel vieilli tres mal et n'est pas digne du prix et du groupe , tres cher , et pas a la hauteur 
petit déjeuner cher et  minable  ménage pas fait dans la chambre malgré la demande faite , le personnel nous a offert le petit dej pour se faire pardonner , merci , mais le mal est fait , désolé mais la vérité doit etre dite

title: Somewhat below our expectations
text: The location of the hotel, and the hotel staff were both excellent. The room itself was underwhelming. The bed was very low to the ground and was worn. We didn't sleep very well, and for what we paid for a night, we didn't feel that the value was there.

title: Excellent Staff on all levels
text: Good service is the key to a successful operation. The Staff at Le Meridian were wonderful--helpful, knowledgeable, courteous, and efficient. I was especially grateful for engineer Newton Smith, who fixed my broken HVAC without delay, replaced the well-used filter, and was delightful to visit with all in the same 20 minutes. He was Intelligent, polite, competent, and professional. That says a lot about the hotel's staffing. Housekeeping was equally friendly and hardworking as was the front desk. Brava Le Meridien.

title: titanium means  NOTHING here
text: The hotel lobby looks a little sketchy but its not that bad. Not great but for the price its ok. The issue is that i am lifetime Titanium, 100+ nights a year, and the front desk person informed me that i don't qualify for an upgrade? I even asked, really with 100 nights i am the lowest here, she confirmed yes!!! I call BS on that. Will not stay here again nor recommend this place. BEWARE. Its not great but not a hostel so theres that.

title: Bad impression
text: I stay at this hotel because I thought it was going to be a good stay. I just booked previous nights at the Thompson Hotel right next door and change for my last night at NYC. I received a extra small room, not upgrade even I have Gold status at Marriott. We where 3 (wife, baby and me) and just received 1 bottle of water and 1 towel. Really bad service. The bed was terrible for a 1,000 usd dollar hotel.

title: Home Away from Home
text: We booked our reservation online and found it to be an easy way to reserve a room. We got outstanding service from Vijay one of the guest service agents. He really cares about his customers. The door men, Ricardo, Rafael and Danny, always make us feel at home. Once we arrived to our room, we were greeted with a special note from the general manager, Rosario Bianchi and a box of specialty chocolates. This made us feel welcomed and special. Also, the concierge team, Christopher, Dana and Nina are all wonderful and very helpful. We could not do our business without their assistance and Christopher is a notary which is an added benefit.  I can't say enough about how much we love Le Meridien NYC!

title: Disappointed!
text: Thought this brand was in the luxury category but that wasn't our experience at the NYC location. Their listed "comfy" king room was super tiny for two people, no ice available (annoying), fan in bathroom ran nonstop (super annoying), short staffed, no lobby to speak of so nowhere to hang out to escape the very small room, roof deck was closed, not sure what amenities there were to be charging a resort fee for. No cleaning one day due to staff shortage. I stayed at what I thought was this hotel a few years ago (terrific experience) but it has obviously changed hands and not at all luxurious in any respect. Very disappointed.

title: Wonderful and thoughtful service!
text: I stayed at six different Marriott properties this week for a work trip. Each time I was congratulated on my upgraded status, however, no one went above and beyond like Lydia Yipajem and her team. She kindly assisted me during my check in and made an effort to get me a great room. She put in my room a bottle of wine, a box of chocolates, and a thoughtful note congratulating me on my new status. She and the team really went above and beyond to make me feel welcomed amidst a busy travel week! Loved my stay here and will be returning next time I am in NYC.

title: Not great
text: I've stayed at Le Meridien in Vienna and other European Cities.  The NYC location was inferior to all of them.  The 'complimentary' buffet breakfast was minimal.  The option for sit-down breakfast was very scant - only white toast?!?!?!?  I will go back to Le Meridien when NOT in the USA.

title: Excellent
text: We had a wonderful stay. The staff was very accommodating and everything was very clean. Anytime we needed something, we got it very quickly. The breakfast was laid out really nicely and the staff explained everything in detail.

title: Do not book here.
text: I booked at the hotel because I am a Marriott member. The room is small, although we were given a room with a balcony it feels dark and unwelcoming. The TV did not work, and the front desk had no idea why, as they are not trained in the basic working of the TV. Instead they wanted to send an "engineer" up. Really, an engineer to explain whether the settings should be HDMI 1 or 2? During a pandemic? Then we found a book of Mormon in the drawer the Bible usually is found. All I can say is I will never book at a Marriott again. TRAIN YOUR STAFF, that is the least you can do. A basic bell boy at any hotel know these things when they bring up your bags.

title: Great room, easy check in and out.
text: Had a quick and convenient trip for work, really enjoyed the convenience and ease getting in and out, perfect location close to Central Park, great view at rooftop. Calling u we was easy and decently close to LGA.

title: Wonderful people
text: Awesome location, comfortable beds, clean room and bath, friendly Staff greet you always with big smile, the concierge was fantastic knowledgeable and very helpful, I have no complaints what so ever, I stayed 3 nights on a business trip and everyone was amazing all along,  I wouldn't stay anywhere else when I travel to NYC, Le Meridien Manhattan rocks

title: Would never go back to this hotel...
text:
I tried to avoid writing this review.  The hotel manager had sent a note asking how was my stay and I repsonded 5 days ago.  had i heard back, I would not have written this review, however as I was very candid with them and got no response, i feel i should be forthcoming of my issues...The room smelled, not unbearable but not pleasant.  the bathroom was awful.  sink appeared to have been broken off from the wall at some point and they tried to just caulk it back in place but the caulk wasnt holding well so the sink was sloping off the wall.  If you put something on the sink, it rolled off to the floor.  water pooled in the sink because the slant caused water not to drain in the the sink drain.  there is no shelf in the bathroom so your options are to put your toiletries on the toilet, which may be the most disgusting thing ever...or leave them in the bedroom and go back and forth for what you need.  
Room was old and very dated.  There were no outlets near the bed, had to plug in phone at the small desk that barely had room on it for my laptop to get work done.  Ironing board legs didnt open and as i stated about not having outlets near the bed, I had to put the board on the toilet and iron my shirt leaning over in the bathroom...that is until the iron leaked water everywhere on my shirt i was preparing to wear out that evening. 
i wont go on but you get the hint from here...

title: A great experience!
text: A wonderful experience from the start! I arrived early and they stored my luggage while I went sightseeing, the room was exactly as pictured on website, staff was helpful and polite. The hotel is in a perfect location close to Central Park and subway lines and the concierge very knowledgeable. Would definitely return to this hotel!

title: Enjoyed our stay!
text: My husband and I stayed at the Le Meridien for one night, on a Thursday.  Overall, we really enjoyed the property.  Early check-in was available for us when requested, the employees were friendly and helpful, and the entire hotel is clean and cared for.  For the room itself- it is small, but comparable to other NYC hotels, so that wasn't an issue.  The furnishings could use some updating, which accounts for my 4 out of 5 stars.  Everything was clean, but a little outdated.  However, I loved the updated bathroom and porthole window!  With a little bit of freshening up of the rooms, the hotel would be absolutely perfect.  There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and it is very close to Central Park.  It is a very short walk from Times Square, but that was good for us.  We didn't want to be right in the heart of that.  We also enjoyed Live, the rooftop bar.  We were there for about an hour or so that night for a drink.  It's really peaceful up there and has great views!  It had a fun, upbeat vibe, and we had plenty of space to move and sit outside.  I would definitely stay again!

title: Superb!
text:
Le Meridien New York Central Park team members' hospitality during our stay was superb!
Our trip wasn't a regular vacation. My spouse had open heart surgery at Mount Sinai Hospital.
After a few google searches, we ran into this excellent hotel's website and decided to book a suite. It ended up being the best decision we made. 
From the moment we arrived, we knew it was the right place to be. A smiling Rafael greeted us at the Valet. Mutabi bell staff (I hope I'm spelling his name correctly), with such grace, helped us to bring our luggage up to the room. Both (Rafael & Mutabi) happened to be the same team who helped us during our departure. 
At the front desk, Melissa was cordial and pleasant and made us feel she cared.
She has the perfect attitude to be part of the front office team. The same about Vijay and Brian; they went above and beyond to make our stay very comfortable.
I saw at least four or five different housekeepers and housemen who cleaned our room. I remember one name, Jeff. They all did a fantastic job. They were very attentive and with an exceptional eye for detail. 
I cannot forget about Will from Maintenance. The day my spouse was discharged from the hospital, the AC unit in the room stopped working, and the room temperature was 75°. Will came to the room immediately and worked on it; not only was he able to fix the unit, but he was constantly checking and ensuring that the AC was still working. Last but not least, your Director of Front Office, Yolanda Garcia. Once she learned that someone in our room was ill, she called to ensure we had everything needed to be comfortable. That human factor is so important today. 
I could keep writing about our experience, but I don't want to write a book (it already looks like one). 
I know how difficult it has been for hospitality during these terrible times. The General Manager should be very proud of the culture she/he has created with the team members. I can assure you that the next time we are in NYC, we will stay at this property and let our friends know that the Le Meriden NY Central Park hotel is the best place to stay while visiting NYC.

title: Terrible tiny room, cannot even move around. Not worth the money at all
text: This is no longer the same Le Meridien on central park, it's a different hotel and rooms are terribly small. Three-star hotel for 5-star price. Really not worth the money. Lobby is tiny as well. Not up to le meridien standard.

title: Great hotel and great staff.
text:
The convenience to Carnegie Hall and Central Park was exceptional. Enjoyed the room. The Staff was great and especially Melissa D who was especially helpful. 
Don’t miss the rooftop patio and bar. We had a lot of fun up there with the stellar views and cocktails. We’ll be back soon!

title: Stylish Property with Sub-par amenities
text: Le Meridien has style that any Frat boy would love -- its clunky and kinda old world, but sumptuous, full of leather and wood and brass. However, it is idiosyncratic. For example, the close-up mirror is locked in place at about 6 feet and it doesn't tilt. If you are under or over 6 feet you can't use it. The open shower is nicely tiled and great for the tropics, but cold in the Northeast winters. And the management wouldn't move my room when I told them the sink had no stopper and was clogged with leaves and hair (no kidding). I HAD to stay put and jury-rig a way to shave. That is crap service, especially for a Bonvoy Platinum Guest. So ultimately, I would have to say go elsewhere. I know I will.

title: Best hotel in NYC.
text: The staff is friendly, accommodating & kind.  Vijay is the best hospitality person in NYC - he truly cares about the safety and enjoyment of your trip. He goes out of his way to help you and make sure you are comfortable.  The hotel is clean and well maintained.  For business travelers, it can be a home away from home.

title: Good & Bad
text:
Service was excellent and the location is outstanding. Very quiet.  Cappuccino maker was great.  Friendly and helpful staff.
Negatives: The bed was very soft and provided no back support.  I awoke with a backache.
Also, I was surprised and disappointed that this quality hotel would furnish cheap toilet paper.

title: Disappointed
text: Check in was cold. No outlets open. Room smelled a bit off. Get to the room and a small red spider climbs on me. I write to them via the Marriott app and no response. I decide to the front desk and show them and not even an apology. Just disappointing, felt like no one cared

title: Great Service
text: As part of my birthday celebration the family flew in from Mexico, California and NY.  We had a fantastic time thanks to the help of Mr. Chosgial who helped us with the surprise visit of my daughter.  Check in was also a breeze, and they sent everything to my room as we had a concert starting next door in less than 15 minutes.

title: Nothing Special
text:
First, I'll preface that the staff were friendly and attentive.  We booked one of the suites for the weekend and the staff were polite and attentive.  So why a 3?

First, the rooms.  Really not the best shape.  Handles breaking off the sink and the decor in need of some attention, it left much to be desired.  It is in a bit of disrepair.

Sleep quality was really bad.  Beds are stiff as a board and very low to the ground.  Not a big fan of this given that I'm still recovering from some injuries I had sustained a few months back.  

The restaurant attached was nothing spectacular.  One breakfast item on the menu and very limited.  We didn't get a chance to go to the rooftop as it was closed Sunday and Monday.  

Overall location was pretty good.  Quiet in the area and a close walk to Central Park.

title: Nice Stay
text: Business trip to NYC but enjoyed my stay. Close to Central Park. Easy subway access. Rooms are smaller but the bed is really comfortable. Mini fridge. Water pressure was good. Would for sure stay again.

title: totally subpar to a LeMeridien brand (Marriott TITANIUM member)
text: Unpleasant experience; stains on carpet, window half broken, staff uninterested. Free elite member "breakfast" is an insult re quality and service. It is absolutely not what one can and should expect from the LeMeridien brand. Absolutely no value for money. This is a review from a Marriott super elite member with 100+ nights in hotels per year.

title: Love the Le Meridien
text: I travel frequently for work and have stayed at many of the Marriott group properties across the city. I also travel frequently to Europe for work and other places in the US for pleasure/ leisure. I’ve come to expect NYC hotels are tiny, not super clean and the staff isn’t super friendly. This is NOT the case at the Le Meridien. The hotel is clean and the rooms, while NYC-sized small are well appointed. I recently stayed at the Le Meridien for a brief one-night strip. I checked out, and was on my way to the airport for a 4 hour delay followed by the inevitable cancelled flight. As the flight delays progressed, I started looking for a room because I was skeptical the flight would still make it out. It was graduation week and there was almost nothing available, including the Le Meridien being sold out. I decided to take a chance and call the hotel - and to my utter delight, after speaking with a few kind employees, they were able to find me a room - for a great rate- and even upgraded me to a suite! I was fortunate enough to interact with these individuals when my flight was cancelled and I finally made my way back to the city and hotel. Lydia, Melissa, Eunique and Asimina were kind, warm, welcoming and just awesome human beings. They took care of me when I was in a difficult spot and were so genuinely sweet. I’ve worked in customer service for 20 years - these are the kind of employees that make or break a business - and they make a difference to the customers and guests in such a positive way. After how they treated me, I will never stay anywhere else when I come to NYC. I hope they receive recognition for providing outstanding customer service and a great guest experience.

title: NYC Gem
text: I just returned from an extended 7-night stay at Le Meridien and already I'm missing it. The vibe in NY has really picked up and this hotel has come out of the pandemic in spectacular fashion. Of course location is great. You're near every subway and get up, down and across town quickly. Being walking distance from Central Park is also a bonus. I used the gym a few times and it was immaculate, quiet and safe. Staff at this hotel is what makes it exceptional. From the concierge services provided by Dana, Chris and Asimine, as well as the front desk of Sonam and VJ, I can't say enough about the warmth, professionalism and courtesy of this staff. When you stay at a hotel for a long time, you want to be greeted by staff and never given "the run-around." This staff, many of whom have been with the property a long time I think, are almost like family and that is how they treat their customers.

title: Substandard
text: We had stayed in this hotel several times for years pre Covid . The standard of quality has substantially slipped. The room was not immaculate nor did it appear sanitized. The mattress was of extremely poor quality (like straw) . The pillows had zero support.  When we put in a call to housekeeping about the mattress we were told they would look into it, perhaps change our room and call us back. They never did even after we left a message for the manager. The bathroom was not stocked. Kleenex was almost empty- only one hand towel and 1 facecloth. Housekeeping did bring us towels after we called . We love the location and the boutique size of this hotel . It was very disappointing that the standard was not as in the past. The staff was overall very friendly especially front desk and concierge.

title: Money - Value not OK
text:
We had a regular, small, quite old room for more than 1000 dollar a night. No view. Near the elevator, noisy. Verry small desk to work at.
Fresh bottles of water and good coffee at the room. Nice warm shower. Very friendly staff. Big tv. Nice roof bar.

title: Drab, tired but good location and customer service
text: I had high hopes for this hotel given the location, but was really disappointed with how old/ tired it was. The room was small, outdated and drab. I seriously considered moving but it seemed like too much work after we got there late. The good news was that it was well located and the staff seemed nice. But I would not stay here again.

title: Comfortable & convenient
text:
We went to NYC to see an opera at the Met at Lincoln Center  and the Metropolitan Museum of Art - both  just a few walkable blocks from this hotel, so location was perfect.  It is also just steps away from the R train at 57th & 7th so we visited the 9/11 Museum (Cortland stop).  The hotel checked us in early (11 am!) and upgraded our room, which was very nice.  Concierge suggested Rue 57 nearby for lunch - great recommendation, a real French bistro.  He also reserved a dinner for Mother's Day at a great Italian restaurant on 46th St.  Hotel's restaurant for breakfast on 2 mornings was better than expected - large portions of fruit and yogurt at $6 each was high, but not for NYC.  Their restaurant service was attentive, but not friendly.  Unlike the desk staff and bell staff who seemed bubbly and actually glad we were there.

We stayed on the 11th floor, facing rear, so no view but I believe this is the quieter of possible locations. Room was big enough for the two of us and we both remarked that the bed was surprisingly comfortable.  HVAC was quiet. Room was spotless.  It had a huge (65"?) TV where we watched the 80-1 upset at the Kentucky Derby.

We would definitely return.

title: Great location and hospitality
text: You cannot beat this location for proximity to the theater, shopping and the museums.  The staff is very professional, especially the server at the breakfast grab bar that offered several delicious healthy choices.  The room was immaculate and comfortable.

title: Nice property. I will be back
text:
normally stay at the Marriott Marquise but decided to stay here despite the mixed reviews. I actually stayed here twice in the same week as I had an overnight stay at the Courtyard in Poughkeepsie. In all honesty, I have to agree with some of the reviews that the hotel is a bit dark as many have reported. For example, the bathrooms in the lower level are the almost a total blackout..not cool. But the libby is bright and inviting. The rooms are a bit worn and the walls are painted a dark blue. My room had a few pieces of modern art on them but the other walls had large shelves with books..that is art in my opinion. Both of my rooms had brass fixtures and marble floors and tile. The towels were very white and fluffy and the bathroom amenities were very nice and generous. I did not have any issue with noise in the hotel..but it was loud outside. It is New York after all. I will say that my room despite being worn was immaculate and I am super picky. (This is something that the Marquise should be paying attention to.) I have to say, please take advantage of the free water and espresso service because for some reason the coffee in the hotel restaurant is pretty yucky.
My shout outs to this property is their staff. From the valet/ Bellman to the front desk associates including the concierge, it was nothing less than stellar. Clearly they make service their priority and they certainly were there for me when I accidentally left my phone in an UBER, needed to store my luggage, and FedEx a few boxes. The rest of you with negative reviews need to remember what this country is recovering from and be grateful these folks showed up for work.

title: Great location Mismanaged & Old Hotel
text: I'm a lifetime Titanium elite member with Marriott.  I was so excited to try out this property in NYC based on it's fabulous location and how awesome the rooms looked in the images on line.  I was terribly disappointed with my experience.  The hotel is poorly managed, it's old and showing many signs of wear and tear.  It's LOUD.  I felt like the people in the room next to me were in my room.  There were issues with getting enough hot water, the air didn't work, the list goes on and on.  I wanted to love this hotel and have it be my 'go to'.  Instead I will never stay here again.

title: An old & tired hotel that is far below the standard of even an average Marriott and is desperately in need of a rehabili
text: An old entire hotel that is far below the standard of even an average Marriott and is desperately in need of a rehabilitation. The rooms were dark with no art whatsoever on the walls. The bathrooms do not have a walk-in shower stall but a tub with no anti-slip material on the bottom of the tub. There are no bath robes either. The rooms are dark tired and old. I only stayed there because the company that I was visiting put me up there. I would never have stayed there on my own even if I were paying for myself. Avoid at all costs. It’s terrible.

title: Great stay!
text: We have nothing bad to say about our stay here. It lived up to all our expectations. We love staying in this area of NYC because the location is perfectttt for those who love running/walking in the park. It is also a short walk to a ton of restaurants, shopping, Times Square, etc. The room was cozy, clean, and comfortable. We would stay here again.

title: Great location and very kind staff
text: My stay was short, but the staff was super kind and always available. Room spacious and clean. I will definitely come back and recommend the hotel. The location is great and comfortable. You can easily reach the main spots avoiding to use a car

title: Convenient and Kind
text:
We took a red eye flight and were worried about having a place to put stuff/nap so early in the morning. They had our room ready and let us check in 8 hours early (730am) at no extra charge!

The rooftop bar had good drinks, nice staff.

And most of all, so conveniently located! We were able to do most our activities were within a 1 mile walking distance: Central Park, museums, 5th Ave shopping, broadway musicals, etc.

Loved it!

title: Third stay
text: This was the third time I was there with my family member who uses a wheelchair. The staff was perfect and we faced no issue. The views of the park were beautiful. The hotel is steps away from Nobu, which we loved.

title: Unloved hotel needs TLC
text:
I expected so much more … the plus side is we were up graded to a room on 26th floor with a park view .. but everything else was a “miss”

Reception small and chaotic didn’t feel like you had arrived in a 4 star hotel.

Bar shut on Sunday and roof top bar shut on Sunday 

Roof top bar nothing special feels unloved

Room had a great view and was massive but lacked furnishing felt as if it was ready to be refurbed and stripped of any TLC.

Location excellent but there are other hotels in a similiar price range which look far better.

If you want to just have a bed for a night and spend most of your time elsewhere then it’s ok but for the price you want more than what le meridian has to offer.

title: Trendy, Modern Hotel in Excellent Location
text:
Arrived at 10AM on Friday after an early flight in from Boston. I was pleasantly shocked that the hotel had a room ready for me! The rooms are tiny (common in NY), but very clean and modern. They are designed so well to fit everything into such a small space. Bathroom was gorgeous with brass hardware and intricate tile work. 
Hotel itself is so nice. There is a nice wine store across the street, a gourmet market two doors up the sidewalk, and a drug store on the corner. It's in such a great area of the city to easily get almost anywhere by subway or cab. It feels very discrete and trendy--refreshing change from that sterile vibe of many NYC mega-hotels. Rooftop bar with city views was a great treat in the evening. I'm not sure if the bar is actually associated with the hotel, but the service was fantastic. Bartender proactively comped one of our drinks when there was a billing error on their end. My partner (from NY) and I agreed Le Meridien was easily the best spot we've stayed in NYC.

title: Decent location, small dark and a little smelly
text: The room was small, dark and smelled a bit like last night’s fish fry. Everything was well-worn and it was tiny compared to other rooms at this price point. The location was ok, but a little too far west for those who are in the city for 57th Street shopping. Staff was friendly enough, but I honestly think it should be downgraded a star because the rooms are in need of a serious overhaul and update. On the plus side, the water pressure was decent and the bed was comfortable enough, although quite low to the ground. There was next to no closet space if you want to hang things for your trip. I would recommend going a little more off the beaten path for this price point to get a nicer room.

title: Great location and service, just avoid the cozy rooms
text:
We were here for a combination of 6 nights as we needed to be in midtown for work. For one night we had a European King, that was to say was cozy. We were only there for a night and it was fine.  

For the other 5 nights I spoke to the front desk before checking in and said the ‘cozy’ room was not going to work for my wife and I as we’re on the road for 17 days, three different climates and lots of luggage. They confirmed a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite (I have titanium status with Marriott). When we tried to checkin at 4pm room wasn’t ready yet. No worries, we had to be at Nordstroms to have a few suits tailored. We come back at 6pm room is still not ready, the front desk associate got the front desk manager since this was an issue as my wife and I had a dinner reservation at 7:15 and needed to get ready. The front desk manager immediately apologized and upgraded us to a Central Park suite.

The Central Park suite was in the low 20th floor and had a great view of the park. The room for 5 nights was perfect, it felt like an actual condo. We had a couch to watch TV at when we were home. The fridge was a great size and let us keep water, seltzers, and other beverages chilled. The living room gave me a place to change early in the mornings for my runs and to get ready for work without waking my wife. 

Service was very good, a few nights we had extra water sent up and toiletries. There was one day where we never received housekeeping and it took over an hour to have towels sent up. But I chalk this up to a fluke as overall the staff was friendly and attentive. 
It was supposed to rain one day and we called down for umbrellas, we needed two as my wife had to go to her office and I had to go to my respective office.
