The gentleman only said he had one, he said if he couldn’t find another one he would give us his personal one for use during the day since he was working the full day tomorrow, just please return it when we were back. Now, that is service. Thankfully he was able to find another Le Meridien one so that wasn’t an issue.

The gym on the C level was a good size and I rarely saw anyone else there, that may of been because I’m typically there around 6AM. 

Bell hops were excellent and had no issue with our seven bags.

Overall the location can’t be beat if you need to be in midtown. Only issue was the room was a bit dark, lights didn’t seem strong enough, but that’s minor in the grand scheme of things. Never tried the restaurant for breakfast or any other meal. Just as a heads up the rooftop is only open Friday and Saturdays currently.

title: Changed but still excellent for the price
text: I've always liked Le Meridien and have been staying there for years.  They have done a renovation and the rooms are smaller than they used to be, but still comfortable and very good size bathrooms. Nice Asian fusion restaurant in the lobby - we had a memorable dinner there. But, most of all, the service is a standout.  Incredibly friendly and helpful staff.  When I got home and unpacked I realized I had left two important items behind.  I called the concierge desk and Dana, who answered the phone, not only said he would go look for them, he called me back within the hour. They found them, and they are on their way back to me. Thank you Dana!

title: Good Location, Bad Hotel
text:
Booked Hotel on TA.  Reviews told one story - this is mine.  Location close Central Park - good.
Room - not good.  It was small and v. expensive.  King bed ok, TV /Remote ok.  Rest of room like run down 60's vintage.  Woodwork chipped and very old wood style.  Lighting same and poor.  Barhroom
very old outdated, the old Gold" look.  Fixtures chipped and worn.

My guess is Marriott bought this hotel and spent no money, living on former owner reputation.  No doorman, no concierge, sm minimum lobby, no restaurants (unless you like Japanese food).  We tried but left this restaurant.

Overall, a bad experience at a relatively bad price.  Poor Value.  The Red Roof Inn would be better.

title: Excellent customer service!
text: I just booked a room with Felitta and she made it so easy and effortless!  I was having problems booking online and she took care of us within 5 minutes with a room ready to go!  She was polite, efficient, and so welcoming!  As a Bonvoy Gold/platinum  member-I really appreciate amazing service like this!!   Thank you and looking forward to staying there for my bday tonight!!

title: Concierge
text: Dana Steer helped to arrange a gift for my brother and his wife as they were celebrating Their wedding anniversary. Dana made selecting a gift and the delivery process smooth and enjoyable. Thank you, Dana for your communication, ease and professionalism! You made my brother and sister-in-law’s stay incredible!

title: Perfectly nice hotel in an excellent location but....
text: I booked a Central Park view suite which was very stylish in design. extremely spacious, and perfectly suited for myself and my 15 year old son. But...FYI, the Central Park view suites are located on floors 20 and up. Please do not accept a suite on a floor any lower than 25 if you want an actual park view. We were on the 21st floor and while I could technically see the tops of trees in Central Park my view was mainly of the water towers on/and the roofs of the buildings across the street (photo from our window shown below). There should be a disclaimer in the description of the park view suites that states suites located on the lower floors have an obstructed park view. Maybe there is and I overlooked it? I would happily stay here again, just not on a floor lower than the 25th if one is expecting and paying for a  “Central Park view”. Also I would like to give a shout out to Dana who is a concierge at the property. He went above and beyond to ensure the last night of our stay was a pleasant one. Many, many  thanks Dana!!

title: Excellent option for NYC
text:
I've stayed in a lot of different hotels in New York City and this is the best one yet. The location is excellent (and it's totally worth it to get a room with a view of Central Park). The room is not very big, but there's enough space to feel comfortable and not claustrophobic. Highly appreciate that the bathroom is roomy :) 
Also, kudos to the staff; everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful every single day of our stay.

title: Not a 4-Star Hotel
text: I picked this hotel based on prior experience at other Le Meridien hotels in the world and because it is close to Central Park South. Do not be fooled, this is not a 4-star property. The building is old and the rooms are in need of makeovers. The carpet looks like it is 15-20 years old, the rooms are small, and general upkeep could be improved. I believe that a 3-star rating would be more fitting for this property.

title: Central Park View
text:
Love this hotel, specifically the room decor and furnishings. Had a suite on higher floor with an unexpected view of Central Park.

Walk to theaters were easy with comfortable shoes. I would stay here again!

title: Quality
text: The staff was amazing Eunique was a major help I recommend this hotel to anyone coming to the city. She upgraded us to an amazing room with a beautiful view and helped us find a great restaurant. This was a great choice

title: Don’t stay here
text: Booked a pricey suite. Nice view of Central Park. Staff friendly. But…Room not well maintained. Old, tired furniture. Dim lighting. Bedside lamp broken. No outlets at bedside to charge electronics. Heater not working well due to dirty filter. Sheets are mediocre. It’s sad to see since the location is excellent. Not up to Marriott standard. We have been more comfortable at Hampton Inn.

title: Rooms not renovated despite the claims.. NOT WORTH THE PRICE
text:
We stayed in Le meridien during our honeymoon in New York on December 2021. We have stayed here 3 years ago when it was still the Viceroy and we enjoyed our stay, which is why we decided to return.

Unfortunately, I cannot say the same about our recent stay here. We were informed that we were getting renovated rooms, but the room still looks the same. The room was old & dark, it felt super run down. There was dust all over the carpet floor and on our furniture. On top of this, our bed was DIRTY, with big black stains on the pillow & bed sheets.

Not worth the price ( we spent roughly 500 dollar per night ) and should not be a 4 stars hotel..

title: Décevant!!
text:
Séjour décevant 
Les chambres sont petites et d un autre temps 
La dame de l accueil du 25 et du 26 décembre après midi était vraiment désagréable et n à aucun sens du service 
Elle ne semble pas connaître son métier et le sens du service??
Pas de bonjour, ni bonsoir , ne surtout pas lui demander de l aide pour quoique ce soit !!
Alors que le monsieur à côté d elle était tres agréable .
Que dire du petit déjeuner!!!
Y a t il un directeur dans cet hôtel ??? 
Le personnel du roof top le matin , n a pas de masque et est à moitié endormi sur les banquettes 
Et ça a été comme ceci tous les matins !!!…
Ahurissant!! 
Y a t il un pilote à bord ??

title: Amazing
text: I really liked my stay here. Dana who was on the concierge did a wonderful job of helping me with queries, he was very patient and helpful. I thought I had lost something and he and the team searched extensively for it. Views of CP are great too!

title: Amazing hotel
text: I was super impressed by the hotel, my room and the staff. Obviously renovated in an Art Deco theme. Spacious by NYC standards. I will definitely stay here again. Perfectly located in central New York.

title: The Meridian Offers Excellent Value to the Discerning Traveler
text: The hotel offers great value, small but efficient rooms and well appointed bathroom. The staff is terrific,  a special shout-out to Sonam at the front desk who was amazingly speedy and efficient helping a long line of peoples checking in. This is a nice addition to the Marriott family.

title: Boutique - Style NY Hotel
text: The hotel is located 2 blocks from Central Park and walking distance to 5th avenue and Radio City Music Hall. The location is excellent for food and shopping. The hotel is boutique style with nice rooms. We got a junior suite and it was very spacious, with a bedroom separate from the kitchen and pullout sofa (prefect for a small family).  The rooftop had a great view of Central Park and an excellent, complimentary breakfast every morning. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge.

title: Avoid! Not worth the money!
text: Stayed at this hotel previously before it split and it is not the same. The lobby is dark and gloomy and so tiny. The person at the front desk was not consistently wearing a mask (this was the only encounter in New York we had where a hotel employee was not wearing a mask). When we got to our room, we were appalled. It had a smell that I can’t quite describe but it was not appetizing. It did not feel clean at all. We did not have enough space to have both suitcases in our room and walk around the bed (they were not oversized). In the bathroom, we discovered that we had no towels except for two washcloths.  There were hairs that were not mine on the sink. Just overall did not get the impression that it was sanitized between guests. We left after one night. This is not a $500/night hotel. A Marriott Courtyard would be better!

title: Le Meridien New York
text: Did a mobile check in & when I arrived at the hotel the clerk had trouble finding me a room. He wasn’t helpful or friendly. For my birthday & 1st time back in NY after COVID I chose a special hotel. This didn’t live up to expectations. It’s like a Marriott Courtyard. Very small lobby & rm. It’s ridiculous for the price. I’ve stayed @ the previous Meridien many times. I’ll never stay here again. Very disappointing.

title: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER
text:
Gloomy hotel !
Corridor and Rooms smells French fries (so will you and your clothes after staying there).
CLEANLINESS IS A DISASTER: The first morning I found a dirty mask under my bed, I urgently asked for it to be removed. When I arrived late afternoon in my room, still here… During Pandemic you can’t joke with cleanliness! For sure no desinfection or proper cleaning was done which is unacceptable! Was supposed to receive a call from a manager I have never received anything. So I complained again to make it remove, unbelievable… during my stay nothing was offered to compensate or improve my experience. Blowing ventilation so strong you can’t sleep. Breakfast is a buffet with plates in cardboard and cuttleries in plastic very cheap.

title: In the center of everything.
text: From the moment we arrived we were greeted by the staff. Amazing service all around, they have a rooftop bar with great views and drinks. Rooms were spacious and modern. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping, Radio city, Central Park, and Rockefeller center. Their rooftop breakfast was also very good with plenty of options for all. We will definitely recommend staying here and will be back ourselves soon.

title: A great stay in NYC!
text: As always, the location and facilities at Le Meridien are top notch. But what really pushes this hotel over the top are the warm and welcoming staff. They always make us feel very special and cannot do enough to accommodate our every need. That’s why I’ll be back with my family before 2022!

title: Great staff/Great stay
text:
A Great staff makes for a great stay.  Very welcoming and attentive staff.  Rooms are very nice.  I travel to NYC every 2-3 weeks and always choose Le Méridien.  I will be back in two weeks. 
My go-to place.

title: Gem in NYC
text:
In a time where hotels don't know your name...this one gets it right!
In a time where customer service is not operated by the company that owns the hotel - Marriott is different!
In a time where you want humanity...this is it!

title: Thanksgiving trip
text: I was worried by reading the hotel’s reviews before our stay but we had a really lovely time at the hotel .We found all the staff incredibly helpful especially the concierge and Raphael the door man .The location is brilliant ,the rooms are clean and big enough for New York. The only frustrating thing is the lift situation, with one out of two being broken during our stay which led to long waiting times .We found breakfast in the roof top bar to be better than expected with lots of choice but I was lucky to avoid busy times . I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location but hotel is old and tired
text:
Had a pleasant enough stay thanks to the excellent location, but the property itself is tired and could use a renovation. Our bedroom window was missing a handle and was letting in so much cold air through the hole, so we were freezing our first night. To be fair as soon as we called for service in the morning they came in a taped up the hole right away. But even so, the windows were so poorly insulated that they were letting so much cold into our room. We also had free breakfast vouchers for our entire stay but only used them the first morning. It was too chaotic and crowded that we decided it just wasn't worth it for the rest of the stay.
All in all it was a decent enough place to sleep but I will be looking for another hotel for our next stay.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: We loved the location - within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and plenty other great sights to see. Staff was friendly and helpful. Took care of our every request.

title: Terrible service for Gold Elite
text: I had the most terrible checkin experience in over 15 years of travel. The front desk associate was clueless and offered to give me a downgraded room that I had not booked. I waited for 20 mins for a key and a straight answer. There’s huge training and SOP gaps (no ID check, no greeting, the other front desk staff that was not checking me in was fighting with another guest) at this property not to mention the pathetic service of the front desk staff (the concierge was impeccable though). Definitely not a recommended property.

title: NOT THE PARKER!!!
text:
I booked this room for thanksgiving eve. I was under the assumption this was the Parker meridian, I didn't pay attention to the address because the Parker used to have an entrance on 56th and 57th. I walked in and was completely disappointed. Tiny lobby, rooms tiny, hallways all dated and filthy. The spanish woman at the counter at 3pm on 11/24 was coughing all over the place and NOT wearing a mask!!
I will NEVER EVER recommend or stay here again!!
The rest of the staff seemed very nice and helpful.

title: Terrible installations and service
text: The rooms are old, bad shape of installations and terrible answer to solve trouble. The a/c was broken and they did nothing to solve it, no one came back to make or stay worth it for the price we paid.

title: Great Hotel & Carlos “Bellman” Absolutely the Best
text: Loved the hotel & rooftop breakfast & drinks.  Stunning view of the park.  Rooms are a good size for NYC & smartly appointed.  Also, Carlos the “bellman” is absolutely the best!  Need to get to the airport on time, he will find a guaranteed rate deal better than a Lyft.

title: Location, location, location!
text: Le Meridien is near Central Park,  subways, shopping, theater, Carrnagie Hall, restaurants, Nordstrom. The service at the hotel is fantastic. They have a gym, conceierge, rooftop and a buffet breakfast. The rooms are comfortable and charming. We plan to make this our New York City home.

title: There is a reason the website for this hotel doesn't list the room size.
text: THEY ARE TINY....add to that the fact that the rooftop bar is more like a club, and the bouncer is in the lobby making u wait in line to get up to your room..is ridiculous.  You have to call down to have coffee for the coffee maker.  If u take a shower at a normal time, there will be no hot water.  And the front desk is so understaffed that u have to call down 4-5 times before anyone picks up....however, it was clean and the few staff that exist are very friendly.

title: Anniversary to Remember
text: I chose this hotel for its Central Park room view. This was a surprise for my wedding anniversary. I decided I wanted to go a little further to make the night special and I couldn’t have made of any of that possible without the wonderful help I received from Dana, Chris,  and Asmina!! These folks went above and  beyond to coordinate and accommodate all the crazy requests and ideas I dreamed up! I couldn’t have asked for more. If you need anything, these folks will take good care of you! LM is lucky to have all 3 of them on staff!! Also, the room was lovely! 10 out of 10 to LM and their awesome Concierge staff!

title: Great Trip to NYC
text: We met another couple in NYC to catch a couple  Broadway Shows. Our stay at Le Meridien was great. Great Location, Great Room, Great Staff! Even though it was NYC Marathon weekend, Dana the Concierge was able to get us some great dinner reservations!

title: Great location.
text:
We stayed at Le Meridien mainly because of its proximity
to Carnegie Hall. We were seeing a show there that weekend.  The Staff was super helpful from check in, maintenance when something fell down the sink and there wasn't a trap on the sink.  The concierge gave us great advice about getting around the city during the NYC marathon.  Our room was very nice although the very large window was really drafty. It was better at night when when closed the drapes.  The towels needed an upgrade.  They were very think and unraveling. Sorry I like a nice bath towel.  And there was not a top sheet on the bed.  There was only the duvet and the bottom sheet.  I really missed the top sheet. Otherwise , our short time was fine at this hotel. Again the location was what worked best for this trip.

title: Poor maintenance for rooms and I’m professional services
text: Why the location is fantastic, the room that put me when the temperature went below 40 was the room without a heater working. It took four days to move me to a room with a heater but the smell from the storage was full. How many of the workers a nice hard-working people but the face of the hotel, concierge named Chris and Night Shift front Clerk Made a offensive comment. Skip this hotel

title: Jaw dropping experience - service, style, location and everything in between!!!
text:
We were welcomed by the most attentive staff…I believe his name was Dana!  He gave us great recommendations for dinner, experiences,
and as a result, many of the highlights of our trip were thanks to him.  We are coming back, we are recommending this hotel and service to all our friends, family and colleagues!! Thanks for a world class experience!!

Jen & Jess 🇨🇦

title: Not good
text:
Still waiting for my customer service call back. Lots of stuff. A guy was crushed between cars outside while unloading. You have to wait in long lines for the elevator because of people using the roof bar. Doormen without uniforms just look like strange guys lurking out front. 

NYC has a lot of hotels. Look elsewhere.

title: Great location
text:
Location is great, price per night great, room is small.
The restaurant is not in service and concierge should be more gentle.
There are many things to do near the hotel, just to block from Central Park one of the most espectacular vies I’m New York City.

title: One of the best locations and reasonably priced in Mid-Town
text:
Best thing about this hotel is the location!!!!! 3 blocks from Central Park, convenient subway stations on east and west blocks of the hotel. We walked everywhere in Midtown within 30 mins…Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th ave shopping, Broadway show, National History museum etc.. 

Front desk staff very friendly, complimentary continental breakfast of bagels, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice and cereal each morning on their rooftop deck which is a great view looking uptown. I was there with my 10 yo and we could only go up there in the morning. No minors allowed up there after that. Free WiFi was a nice plus. 

Rooms are NYC small, but for just the two of us, it was fine. Bathrooms are roomy…huge shower! Large TV in bedroom. The beds very comfortable and lighting good around the room. The desk and other furniture a bit rundown and the mini fridge was subpar as it didn’t keep much cold. Biggest complaint is the noise in the hallways. You hear every time a door is open and shut. We were on 22nd floor. The hall is small so only a few rooms in a round setup, but I felt as if I heard every door slam on the floor all day! Street noise not bad at all. From what I could tell, except for rooftop bar, there is no restaurant to eat at in hotel. That was fine with us bc we were out and about, but just FYI. No room service options etc.. 

I researched several hotels for our stay and I would say for the price and convenience, this was a good pick. Definitely suited our needs and I didn’t expect it to be super fancy, but it was nice enough. Other notes for NYC currently: Definitely showed my vaccine card for all restaurants. I had an app that Colorado has, but they accept photos as well. Just easier to have it on phone than carry around card IMO…although I brought it as backup. For my 10 yo, I had to show a negative covid test for Broadway show. We did the self-test that you can buy at many drugstores. Super easy and accepted..had to be done within 6 hours of the show start. We had no problem getting reservations for places to eat and tourist things which was kind of nice. NYC not back to 100%, but we didn’t feel limited at all.

title: Great staff, room, and location!
text: We stayed at Le Meridien for our baby-moon and couldn't have been happier! The location is fantastic, close to central park and multiple subway lines. The rooms were modern/updated yet classy. We decided to stay an extra day and Yolanda and Vijay were extremely helpful/accommodating. We felt sad to leave because everyone took such great care of us. Highly recommend!

title: Underwhelmed
text: Sadly, our stay did not live up to expectations. Despite claims of "renovated rooms", we found ours to be outdated.  There did seem to be some work done on the room, but it seemed only half way done and the overall feeling was cheap.  The front desk staff was pleasant, but the doormen were disheveled and weren't helpful.  Overall our experience was underwhelming and I feel like there were several other hotels that would have offered a better stay for less money.

title: Fantastic hotel: Could not be better
text: I am midway through my stay at Le Meridien and this definitely is the perfect hotel. I grew up in NY so I'm picky about location, cleanliness, amenities and overall hotel staff. This hotel goes above and beyond in every way. Location can't be beat - end of story. Cleanliness is excellent. I look for stuff like this. Sheets, shower, bathroom, carpet were immaculate. Finally hotel staff. From Sonam who booked my original reservation to Felitta, Chris, Dana and not to be forgotten - door/bellman Carlos, they went out of their way to accommodate me and were always professional and never felt overwhelmed with the slightest request. Last point - The breakfast, is as good as a Four Seasons breakfast only a better view. Sitting outside early in the morning, in the sun on the rooftop deck looking out on Central Park is a perfect Zen way to begin the day. I can't wait to come back but of course, I will finish my stay this week!

title: Loud noise coming from Bathroom
text:
Very loud noise in room coming from bathroom vent constant sound did not stop was very difficult to sleep
A front desk attendant I believe Eric S was not helpful at all 
Concierge persons were very nice and helpful

title: Le Meridian NYC: Great Location and Rooftop Bar
text: Le Meridian NYC: great location and rooftop bar has amazing views of Central Park. Bartender was great. Judith came to my room to help with expresso machine. Beds are comfy and rooms have a cool nostalgic vibe. The staff are eager to serve you and  are customer focused. I will come back.

title: Best experience!!
text:
We stayed 8 nights with my mom and and sister. Staff was really helpful all the times I needed. AC was not working properly for the first couple of days and they helped me and also compensate me with an invitation to the rooftop bar. 
Chris at the concierge desk was super helpfull and nice!
Room was big enough for the 3 of us. 
Location is great! 
Breakfast at the rooftop was super complete and good!!
For sure will in again while in NY! :)

title: Don’t do it.
text: This is in no way Le Meridien NYC of yore. This is a completely different building on a different street with the Le Meridien/Marriott name to justify $. It’s a filthy, old construction zone. Two elevators service 29 Floors. There is no shampoo, coffee or irons in the rooms; you have to “call down” for anything and everything. Towels are all ripped.  This is brand suicide for Le Meridien and Marriott; no idea why’d they associate their name with this equivalent of a Jersey Turnpike motel. If this is anyone’s first stay at either of these brands, it’ll also likely be there last.

title: Great location, great staff
text:
Great location, half block from two subway stations and walking distance to Broadway theaters.  Courteous, helpful staff.  Awesome rooftop breakfast and bar.

My only complaint is we had to call on each of our four days for coffee pods, cups , and glasses.  This should have been part of daily service.  
I will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Service in a Central Location
text: Le Meridien is a shadow of what it used to be. There are some major renovations going on. The part that is open is lovely. The rooms seem to all be like many NYC rooms, small around 250 square feet. They are efficient with the space like on a boat. The bathroom is beautiful marble tile and big enough for two. The closet is very small so pack light. There is no place for suitcases. Housekeeping does a wonderful job of keeping everything clean. They are very attentive with requests. You cannot beat the location, walkable to theater, shopping, and Central Park.

title: Not worth it.
text: What a dump. Outdated rooms, elevators took forever and the floors had tired old carpets. Easy to get fooled into thinking you’re booking the Parker Meridien right next door but this is definitely not that. Hallway lobby wreaked of marijuana most mornings as well.

title: Disappointing stay
text: Wherever possible, I stay at Marriotts, finding them to be excellent quality and value. Unfortunately, Le Meridien New York - Central Park fell far short of the standard. My room was small, the desk was a mini desk that I was not able to work at, the desk chair was not functional, the bed was uncomfortably soft (and awfully low) and the pillows were as well. While the staff were quite nice and the rooftop lounge a great location for breakfast, I would steer away from this location in the future.

title: Home away from Home
text: We really enjoy the staff, Concierge Christopher C., All of the door men, Maria and team at the front desk and Fleix the GM They spoiled us!.We love the location, roof top bar and surrounding restaurants. We will return back.

title: We come to NYC for business and love the service we receive from the team at Le Meridien Hotel. Christopher Carrow
text: We come to NYC for business and love the service we receive from the team at Le Meridien Hotel. Especially  Christopher Carrow the concierge really is amazing and patient with us. He is so helpful with our administration needs, he is a real gem!  Also, Fleix the GM deserves a mention. He was very accommodating We will be coming back to this hotel again.

title: The best service and great accommodations!
text: I can’t say enough about the staff at Le Meridian Central Park. Everyone went above and beyond to ensure our trip was fantastic. My husband and I traveled with our toddler and were worried it would be difficult to navigate, but the staff made everything so simple. Chris Carrow, part of the Concierge team, was single handedly the best concierge we’ve ever dealt with. He helped us prepare before arrival and during our stay made everything so simple and easy. He made the entire trip better than we could have expected. Will absolutely return!

title: No recomendable.
text: No toman en cuenta tu estatus al momento del chequeo y no te ofrecen upgrades de ningún tipo.  mi habitación tenía las Sábanas manchadas, mi estancia fue desde el viernes hasta el lunes y todos los días llame solicitando el cambio y no lo hicieron. La hab estaba deteriorada, mi ventana estaba abierta y no se podía cerrar porque el herraje estaba dañado, sin contar que las gavetas no cierran y unas no tenían ni sus cajones. no puede ser posible que tengas que dormir con Sábanas manchadas y aunque reclames ellos no lo puedan cambiar. En resumen  fue una PÉRDIDA total de puntos haberme hospedado aquí.

title: Enjoyable Stay!
text: Great location and really helpful, friendly staff. Close to everything we wanted to do (shows, shopping and Central Park). Quiet room and cool rooftop bar. We just stayed a night but had a great time!

title: Wonderful value and amazing staff!
text: Staff was fabulous; friendly, accommodating and helpful. We came back to our room one morning and our room was still being cleaned. She happily left and said she would return to finish once we left. Said,”It’s your room.” When we checked-in at 2am, the A/C in our room wasn’t working.  Someone immediately came up, couldn’t make the necessary repair and we were given a new room. Chris the concierge was  wonderful. We took two walking tours and went to US Open which we wouldn’t have done without his assistance.  Maria was also great. Those are the only two names we remember.  Everyone we interacted with was so friendly and helpful.  I’ve never experienced that before! One suggestion, more hooks and towel racks in bathroom to make most use of small space.  Thank you!

title: Great Spot in NYC
text: The rooms are very nice. Decent size and nicely appointed. The location is very convenient. It has easy access to the subway and is in walking distance to many things. The service from staff was excellent.

title: Disappointing
text: The once elegant hotel is now a 2 star one.  Previous guest had left stuff behind, 2 lamps not working, no glassware or ice bucket or coffee machine.  The front desk only resolved the ice and glassware complaints.  For that kind of money I expect a lot more.

title: This hotel could be so much more
text: Upgrade the coffee machines in the room and have coffee available. Get Foam pillows.  The bed was comfortable but the pillows sucked.   There were NO drinking glasses in the room!!!?  What?  No one knew you had a restaurant and then the morning we were leaving we went in and wow it is lovely.  It was the old Viceroy restaurant and it was nice.  Open that Bar in the restaurant.   The rooftop bar was nice but a little weird feeling when we went up there.  The rooftop should be open for coffee and a continental breakfast....that would be lovely in the morning.   May not stay there again.  Get it together.

title: Disappointed and surprised
text:
The hotel needs maintenance. We had to switch room the first night for complete lack of A/C. In next room, we needed the A/C fixed 3 times in the course of 2 1/2 days. Very few amenities. Not even a bottle of water in the room, which should be provided regardless of pandemic, specially during hot summer days. No glasses for toothbrush. Good location. Good staff.
We expected more of a "Premium" hotel. We don't feel we got the value for the points spent. We were told by the manager that she would credit points to us for the inconvenience but have seen no such credit.

title: Central Location and  service as expected
text: This is a centrally located mid-town hotel, good for both leisure and business travels.   Near Central Park, close to several subway lines, shopping and business district.  Room size was fine for NYC, a bit dated but still nice and comfortable.  5 star rating is for what was expected and staff experience.   This is not a luxury hotel but a good place to sleep and get out in the city.  All covid protocols were handled without issue and staff very accommodating.

title: Good location but not much else
text: Le Meridien is located right by Central Park, but aside from a nice rooftop and a few rooms on the high floors, it's unlikely you'll get much of a view of it.  The hotel rooms are small but nicely appointed.  They inexplicably did not have water glasses or coffee mugs in the room "because of COVID" (?) but brought some upon request.  While the room furnishings are nice, the building is old, the doors don't easily close, and the hallways are outdated.  There is a surprisingly spacious and well-equipped gym.  This was a pretty acceptable choice for a business meeting when I spent little time at the property as it was close to many places.

title: Mixed
text: Personnel were very helpful and courteous. The bathroom was absurd, with toilet paper roll in your side and water from shower spraying on the floor (your design did not include a shower door). The room was supposed to face the Central Park, but instead faced an ugly building and roof. The room was extremely small. And there as no breakfast or breakfast box.

title: Home away from Home
text: We come to NYC for business and want a hotel that can accommodate our business needs.  We  love the staff, management and concierge. Everyone is top notch. Also the rooftop bar is hip and cool with great views.  The bar tender makes the best Manhattans around.  Our room is charming and clean and we like having a desk and refrigerator .  This is why we are beginning to call this hotel our "Home away from Home".

title: The room smell so bad couldn't sleep (Hotel Fully Booked)
text:
When I came to the room the room smell so bad. Then during the night I started coughing. I tried to understand why until I found the Filter of the A/C which was not changed for many month.
When I left the hotel I asked to talk to the manager who never came. They didn't gave any discount and they didnt even say sorry. Last but not least the rooms are very old and should have been renovated 10 years ago definitely doesn't like the one on the picture. Run away from this Hotel

title: GREAT hotel
text: I was visiting NYC for a day, business meeting and wanted hotel close to meeting location. The location of this hotel is perfect! The roof top bar is so energetic and amazing. The staff, especially Vijay and Christopher had a great attitude and very helpful. I will definitely be returning.

title: Great hotel
text: great location, close Central Peak. Suite works well for families, helpful staff.  We brought a blowup bed to add to the existing sofa bed, hotel provided additional sheets. Rooms have character and are functional,

title: Gorgeous hotel
text: Absolutely love this property and the attention to design detail. From the custom bed frame to the unique light fixtures, the hotel is artistic yet functional. Picture perfect! The rooftop is absurdly expensive, though.

title: Chris, The Concierge,  rocks!!!
text: The staff at this hotel made us feel like we lived here!   Chris, the concierge , set us up w exactly what we we looking for with dinners and attractions.  Special delivery for my daughter’s birthday was the icing on the cake! (Literally!)  Bday card signed by entire staff.  Great hospitality! Great location as well.

title: Surprisingly bad
text: For a “four star” hotel with room rates in the mid-400s, this was surprisingly bad.  Despite being recently renovated, my room was falling apart.  The door stop was broken, the toilet paper holder was on the floor of the bathroom, and the tv was old with none of modern service options. The biggest issue by far was that the hotel would not provide a bedsheet, only a comforter and a fitted sheet.  After sleeping under a sand paper comforter the first night, I spoke to the front desk and asked explicitly for an actual sheet to be added to the bed.  When I got back to the room that evening, my comforter had been replaced, but there was still no sheet on the bed!  Also, the refrigerator was empty and, I was told, is only stocked by request.  This is neither the approach nor the response I would expect from a hotel claiming to be four stars.  Despite the convenience to my office and the park, I will never stay here again.

title: Nice stay
text: Excellent location, small rooms (NY style), excellent air conditioning. Can not beat location. Empty mini fridge ( 24 hr super market two doors down could keep things in mini fridge) no coffee maker. Roof op bar with beautiful view of central park. Metro stop in the corner.

title: Best hotel in NYC!
text:
The staff went out of their way to make my daughter’s birthday celebration exceptional! Thank you Chris and Sonam! 
In addition, the hotel and room were clean and the location near Central Park was perfect!!
This will always be our “to go to” hotel in NYC!!

title: Excelent
text: Very good location and very good service. In the surroundings there are many stores that solve daily issues, food, drinks, pharmacies. New York is differente this days but with this cute hotel you can manage.Recommendable.

title: Small but good location
text: Small and clean. Great location. Disappointing room service and restaurant are closed but they communicated this clearly before the stay. Room is small, even for NYC standards—250 square feet. No recognition or upgrade or welcome ￼amenity choice for a Platinum member.

title: Small but nice
text: We just returned home from a 3 night stay at Le Meridian. I loved the location of this hotel. We have stayed in Time Square many times before, but after staying at this location, I will never go back to Time Square again. This room had everything we needed, except a little extra space and no place to get any food or drinks. I called the front desk every day and asked for water and ice, which they politely and quickly delivered each time. I loved being so close to Central Park. The Subway, Central Park, a walgreens, and plenty of restaurants were right there. However, don't go looking for food too late because most places close very early. There is also a rooftop bar on top of this hotel which looked fabulous, but we could not go in because we had teenagers with us! I would recommend this hotel for the price . But, if you want a little more space, check around!

title: 2 week stay
text: We stayed here a week, went to the Hamptons & returned for another 6 days. We were in 1608 & then 1908. The rooms were OK but NO CLOSET space nor drawer space.  What were they thinking when they designed these rooms? A bit of a view of Central Park & 57 St from 1908, 1608 faced 57 Street however was too low to even see a tree. Convenient location & a reasonable work out area for a hotel in NY.

title: Good choice!
text:
Le Meridien used to be the Viceroy, which really focused on “cool designs” for their rooms. So it definitely won’t let you down. The rooms are a bit small (if you’re traveling with someone I would suggest getting the bigger rooms), but they are very nicely designed.
The location cannot be better, and the fitness center is really good.

title: Not Great... you can find better elsewhere
text: So the hotel property/building is under construction. The pictures that are posted are done in excellent lighting because when we got our room is very old/dingey/old lighting. Very small room. The bathroom, I guess had good furnishings. Location was great. Most of front desk staff was pretty good about helping out. There was one girl, great nails, horrible customer service lol. I normally wouldn't even write about that stuff in the reviews but even when we asked for recommendations for food "nope"  just not the best. Better hotels around for the price. I do think it's interesting though while we waited to check in someone was asking for a late checkout till 2pm and they were like "sure no problem!" and so we also decided to ask for a late check out and they're like "we can do 12:30." oh okay lol

title: STUNNING hotel
text:
My first thought when I checked in to the Le Meridien: it's even prettier than the photos. The design and decor here is downright stunning, and even for double or triple the price, I don't think I've ever stayed at a more beautiful hotel. It definitely has a boutique vibe, with an entry and lobby so narrow I missed it the first time walking to check in. And yes, the rooms are small, but they're so efficient and honestly, they felt large for New York standards (I know I've stayed at three other hotels in the area with rooms half the size). 

Another thing I loved? They're dog friendly up to 100 lbs. And location-wise, this place can't be beat. Just a few blocks from Central Park, my dog and I enjoyed walking there every morning and night. And it was just far enough away from sights like Times Square that everything felt accessible but without all the grime and crowds. 

Hotel staff did leave a bit to be desired. The shower in my room had a drainage issue that was only further complicated by staff miscommunications. And there was vomit in the hallway on my floor that had obviously been there a while based on the smell. Unfortunately, even I notified the front desk and it was cleaned, the smell remained for the rest of our stay.

But even with the few negatives we experienced, I can't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else in New York City. The design, location, and dog-friendly policy were the perfect combination for me.

title: Worst service
text: This hotel is a joke. They will try to over charge you so make sure you check your credit card accounts. Here is the story - I just moved out of my apartment in Harlem and decided to stay here. I left an old bag to be thrown away then they decided to charge me for another night because they considered the room occupied. This doesn’t make sense because I checked out with the front desk clerk.  Consider another hotel with better service if you can. This situation was so egregious that I had to leave a review.

title: Perfect staycation!
text: Myself and my husband decided to do an overnight at Le Méridien for Valentine's weekend. The staff were super friendly and accommodating to all our needs, including providing us with a room that had a tub and sending some bathrobes up to us via room service! The hotel itself was also beautiful and impeccably clean which was very comforting during Covid times. It's also in a great location as there are plenty of landmarks nearby as well as lots of shops/places to eat too. Overall we had a really great experience and would recommend Le Méridien to everyone!

title: Excellent
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in February, during Covid times. The location of the hotel is amazing, very central, everything is close and walking distance. The service is very good ( although there is no room service and daily housekeeping due to Covid)but it was fine. The staff is helpful and very polite. The accommodation ( we had the suite) is very spacious, the bathroom is clean and big, the bed is very comfortable. We were at the 23rd floor so we had a very nice view of Central Park and the city. 
I totally recommend this hotel and I will definitely stay again here when I visit NY.

title: Location is awesome
text: Drove in from Long Island and was very please with how many parking options there were nearby. Husband and I wanted to have a mini getaway and visit Central Park. We stayed in room 1805 and got to watch a beautiful sun rise over Central Park. You have a Duane Reade on the corner in case you forgot something at home or just want to grab some water and snacks for the room which is super convenient. With Covid there is a lot of stuff that is closed but there are still plenty of options! This hotel is in the perfect location and is right by the subway. The hotel is beautiful! The staff is exceptional and super friendly. We really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely be returning for another weekend getaway.

title: Mr R Yau
text: Clean hotel, staff is professional, location is perfect. Would highly recommend for friends + family visiting NYC. Stayed at Le Meridien in Phuket as well. Both were positive experiences thank you!!..

title: Best stay ever
text: I don’t know why this hotel rating is low!! But I he an amazing stay!! The park view suite room is a dream!!! Get that!! That all people really kind u don’t feel in Ny!!! Titanium upgrade cleared on dec 31 night they really make it happen!! Will def come back!!!

title: Vacation
text: Perfect location. The only downside in 2 days nobody came to pick up garbage and clean up the room. Very good size of bathroom. Room is small. Staff is very friendly. Dog friendly hotel. 2 blocks from central park

title: Solid
text:
Refurbished during the spring COVID shutdown, the Le Meridien is an excellent upper tier business class hotel in a great location.  

I stayed in a terrace room and was grateful for the 8th floor terrace overlooking 57th street, providing good air and light for a midtown hotel.  The room decor is heavy on dark wood and blue carpet, so not everyone’s thing, but fine for me.  Bathroom was attractive and clean, and benefits from the usual Le Meridien amenities from Malin & Gotz.

Front desk guys were all great- smily and solicitous.   

Because of its relatively small size and friendly staff it feels less desolate than other hotels in this era of no hotel restaurants and bars.   

Great upper tier yet affordable Marriott option in midtown.  I aim to return.

title: Amazing property in perfect  Central Park location
text: Awesome experience, newly renovated and re-opened (formerly Viceroy), location could not be better, rooms and suites are great, especially those with killer central park view.  Gym is fantastic.  Staff could not be bigger pros, starting with front office manager Bryan, also Louie, Melissa and a second Brian with an i.  Really recommend.

title: The perfect hotel with the best staff!
text:
I had a most pleasant stay at Le Méridien New York hotel!

I would highly recommend this hotel to all. It is conveniently located in prime location right near central park, times square, subways and many shops and offices. 

The hotel is clean and friendly with a tasteful design. The rooms are inviting and very pretty, the beds and pillows are so comfortable too! 

I personally had a wonderful experience at this hotel and must say that the staff were INCREDIBLE! They treated me with respect and were all so kind and helpful and ensured that my stay at the hotel was the best possible! 

A big shout out to Sonam at the front desk!!! He really went above and beyond! He took care of everything for me! I have no words to thank him for all his efforts and help and for getting me the exact room I needed on a last minute call and for an amazing price!

I have already told many friends and family members about my amazing experience at this hotel and they will hopefully make it to Le Meridien too in the near future. 

Thank you to Sonam for being so understanding of my religious needs and for his kindness, generosity and thoughtfulness throughout my stay!

I am so thankful I found Le Meridien and I am grateful Sonam was there to assist me in a most caring and sensitive manner.

title: Nice small hotel on West 57th Street
text: This is a great place if you can get a good price on a room. It's almost next door to Carnegie Hall, if that great concert venue ever opens again. You're near MOMA, Central Park, Nobu, a fabulous little Italian coffee place on Sixth Ave between 57 and 56. The rooms are small. Mine had a mini-workspace that was adequate but not great; a small chair that was ok, but not great. The bed's mattress was softer than I usually prefer, but it was a nice change for me. There's a nice big TV on the wall facing the bed. I found the room to be quiet, but I was there during the pandemic. In the era of Covid, lots of restaurants close early. The place is clean, observes all the Covid protocols, nice bathrooms. Service at the desk is great. If you can get a good deal on a room here, take it.

title: Perfecetly located nice boutique hotel
text: You can't beat this location and this is about as good as you can get with a small boutique hotel that is not a full service big hotel.  Service is very good.  Parking is around the corner.  Loved being able to walk to Rockefeller Center, Columbus Circle, etc.

title: Location location location!
text:
Times Square, subways, Carnegie, Russian Tea Room, Central Park... all easily accessible. I stayed here three nights for a getaway weekend. 

Clean rooms, easy checkin. Finding food for posh nosh or penny pinching was not difficult to do. Access to Downtown or Brooklyn/Queens was via subways located on the same block. COVID-19 restrictions blocked many amenities, though the other attractions and outdoor eating nearby made up for it. Pay close attention to in-room WiFi options, you might inadvertently choose a paid option when a free one is avaialable.

title: Our first hotel stay post pandemic was a great experience
text:
On Friday night we had our first hotel stay since January, before the pandemic started.  We stayed at the Le Meridien hotel on 57th street in Manhattan.  We had a good experience.

Many Marriott hotels in New York have been closed during the pandemic.  There are several logical reasons including the absence of tourists and business travelers.  Fortunately the Le Meridien is open.

They have plenty of protocols in place.  The confirming e-mail lets you know there are steps to follow if you came from a state with elevated Covoid-19 case numbers and are staying 24+ hours.  The elevator is restricted to two passengers (or one family) at a time.  Inside the elevator are two circles at diagonal corners where passengers stand.  The rooftop area is closed.  No coffee or minibar available in the room.  Curiously there were no washcloths in the bathroom.

Combined with the masks, plexiglass barriers and masks, we felt very safe.

The staff is excellent.  They are friendly and accommodating.  They are genuinely glad guests are there.

The rooms have been remodeled during the pandemic.  They are on the smaller side, but it's an older building in the heart of Midtown Manhattan.  The bathrooms have been remodeled and quite elegant.

Are there negatives?  A few, but they are minor.  The room next to us has a connecting door.  The person in the next room must have been talking loudly on his phone, because it sounded like he was standing at the foot of our bed!  I'm guessing this was because of the communicating door.

It was a good stay.  We would come back.

title: Great Location, but not where you want to stay.
text:
My wife and I decided to stay here because we lived around the corner and it is so centrally located. When we made the reservation we told them that we were coming for our anniversary and our daughters wedding.
Check-in was supposed to be 4pm. An hour and forty minutes later we were shown to our room, after sitting in a another room. There was no explanation. Although the Director of Front Office was nice, he didn't explain anything and contributed to a lousy start to the weekend.
When I saw the room, I was sorry we upgraded to a Junior Suite. The room was dark and totally overpriced. Light were not working in the bathroom or living room.  There wetas no mattress r pillow encasements!  Although there was a coffee maker, there were no supplies. The room was terribly dated. We are in the hotel business and have stayed at so many fine properties in NYC, but Le Meridien is not one of them.

title: Recommended
text: It's a nice hotel that had just reopened and it's one of the few open hotels in the area. Services are still limited. But the rooms are nice and a decent size for Manhattan. Very good shower, free WIFI and no resort fees. Seemed like they were pretty understaffed but everyone was really nice and helpful. And was great to be so close to Central Park.

title: Vraiment décevant
text:
Il y avait très longtemps que nous n'étions pas allé à NYC et quelle déception de voir que cet hôtel est devenu extrêmement cher pour une qualité extrêmement médiocre !

La chambre ne proposait pas de machine à café, des fils pendaient dans le placard et les étagères étaient cassées.

Bref pour ce prix, franchement très très moyen

title: Hotel 3 stars . Service 10 stars
text: The front desk manager  Mr. Louis, gave the best service a hotelier can provide!  That's why the 10-star hotel score.  The hotel itself needs renovation and does not justify the high price. Thank you Mr Louie

title: House hunting
text:
Stayed here as spent couple days apartment hunting as though live nearby wanted to avoid commuting in and out.

Like most nyc hotels rooms are small as just bigger that bed though squeeze much in including large bathroom, mini fridge and armoire.   Glass in shower makes hard to easily turn on water.

Style is very much it’s own so either love or hate retro modern look.   Though states Central Park in name do not expect see it from any room as most will be viewing another close by building.

Place could use some tlc as carpeting was very worn down to the underfloor. The metal surfaces also could use a good polish.  With covid slowdown would be good time to do it.  When next door Parker opens maybe use that as chance to remodel.

Service was good as when asked for ice came quickly. Let us check out later without argument.

title: Amazing
text: Honeymoon stay in a beautiful room with a terrace.  Chris at the front desk was amazing .  Even though they had limited staff, they took care of our needs.  5 mins from Central Park and near 24 hour grocery store.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
We stayed a total of 2 nights.  Beautiful NYC view.Interior decoration is very nice. Execellent service.Rooms are very clean. Price is fine. Heating is OK.
But The United States now faces COVID-19,people took to the streets to demonstrate,people protested racial discrimination,I felt insecure,So I do not recommend going now

title: Definately coming back!
text: We stayed a total of 4 nights after a terrible hotel experience elsewhere, it was nice to be instantly be welcomed by hotel staff. They were friendly and accomodating. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and cleanly kept. The rooms were larger (for NYC) than we expected, very modern chic decor. Although all staff was wonderful, we have to praise Sonam who provided exceptional service. If you have any issues or questions about your stay, he's a great resource for  any guests. The location is so close to Central Park and really everything else, most definately coming back!

title: Beautiful Interior!
text:
Very nice hotel indeed! Beautiful NYC view.

Hotel personnel was very kind and helpful. Interior decoration is very nice. 

Very nice spot! Execellent service.Rooms are very clean. Price is fine. Heating is OK.

title: Service made it great, excellent team, thankful for the Concierge's extra effort
text: While the rooms are nice, cozy and in line with most of the NY hotels in this category (I've tried a lot of them), the high point of this property is the people.  The front desk welcome, the doorman, the housekeeper, and overall tone of the people in the property was uniquely positive and made the stay feel like home.  I haven't seen that with many NY hotels I've used in the past few years.  The concierge was especially helpful when I needed to leave early and was unable to return to NYC.  He helped pack up my things and ship my luggage to my home, since I wasn't able to return to the city.  Chris Carrow was very willing to help in an unusual way, it would have been easy to say "NO".  He went the extra mile to help me out.  This is my first trip adviser review, but it's also the first time that I've had service that deserves a public positive note.

title: Perfect Birthday
text:
We recently celebrated my fiancé’s birthday at le Meridien Central Park. The property is in a great location but it was the service that made our stay so great. 
Melissa gave us a great Central Park view and facilitated a birthday amenity on check in.
Vijay was very friendly and helpful regarding our check out time. 
Sonom was the shining star when we extended our stay an extra night. He truly went above and beyond the call of duty in making us feel welcome and making the birthday extra special.

These three are all assets  to the hospitality industry and deserve to be highly acknowledged as leaders in the field.

title: Amazing Customer Service from Sonam
text: I love the hotel, but what makes it a true wonderful experience is when your first interaction at the front desk sets the tone for the entire experience.  Sonam remembered me from last stay months ago and made sure that I had the best available room and that all of my needs for the stay were taken care of including taking care of booking me an additional night the next day at the best available rate.   Every employee that I came into contact with was terrific but Sonam was amazing and he is the reason that I will choose Le Meridien again when I come back in a few weeks.

title: Little gem by the Park
text: This was my second stay within a couple of months, and I will choose Le Meridien again soon! Comfy, cozy rooms and staff who treat us like old friends, plus a million-dollar view? What’s not to love? Can’t wait to come back!

title: Excellent service
text: Very well run hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Especially VJ at the front desk and Raphael at the door. Thank you guys for going above and beyond during my stay. For business travelers that need to stay in the city, the location is great and you’ll be walking distance to the park. Pro tip: start your day with the breakfast buffet at the restaurant downstairs.

title: Graphic Designer
text: Stay was pleasant, everything was nicr, all good. Raphael was very helpful and professional. HE offered help anytime needed. Stuff is great and friendly and the lobby looks amazaing. They have a good gym too.

title: Great Stay in NYC
text: My wife and I stayed at the La Meridien in January this year (2020). With so many choices in NYC it was a pleasant surprise to not only find a hotel in a great location, but one where the staff and general service was second to none. Room and lobby cleanliness, appearance and decor was great. We would definitely return without hesitation. R&N

title: Great location and service
text:
Staff goes out of their way to help and location is great. I left something behind and staff quickly helped me resolve the issue. 

Stylish rooms but on the small side.  

Gym isn’t big but it has most of the basic equipment

title: Very nice stay
text: I booked my stay through Marriot. I requested an early arrival which was accommodated by the hotel. The front desk allowed a late check out as well which really helped me accomplish my tasks in New York City. The hotel is very centrally located and close to a lot of famous landmarks. My room was clean and quiet. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Rooms are dark and dated; Not very clean for a luxury hotel
text:
Check in ok; got into narrow crowded elevator; found floor which was very dark.

Room was very dated and looked in need of refurbishment.   No money has been spent at hotel in several years.   Wood paneling faded and scratched.   

Roof top bar was dirty and furniture was old.   

Would not stay here again.

title: Customized experience with personal touches
text: Our stay at Le Meridien was absolutely fantastic. Upon check in, we were upgraded to a terrace room with a lovely view of 57th street. Then, we were given a great welcome basket of fresh fruit and premium still water bottles. (side note, they have free spring water bottles at the front desk, so take advantage of that-especially since water bottles come at a premium usually in hotels). To top off our great stay, they brought up two free beers. Don't forget about the traveler appreciation happy hour from 5-7 where they will have free glasses of wine and beer.  I've seen a few comments about the furnishings, and while they are a little dated, they are classic mid-century pieces that are solid, clean pieces.  They may have a little wear from over the years, but nothing was in disrepair.  The bathroom was fully modern and upgraded, and the bed was new, comfortable, and fresh.  Finally, Chris was very kind and checked in to ensure that we enjoyed our stay and was responsible for all the personal touches I've mentioned.  My wife and I will definitely stay here again!

title: Great choice
text:
I had a wonderful stay at this property.
Honestly, the hotel rooms could use a furniture upgrade but the service and staff at this hotel were exemplary. 
Everyone from manager , check in , maintenance and the bell staff were excellent and helpful. 
The bed was also comfortable and clean. 
The staff at breakfast was also friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great service and location
text:
The location could not be more perfect. The room is very modern with beautiful finishes. 
Most of all, Vijay, the host at the front desk went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable - something one is lucky to get in NY. I was so thankful to him and hope his Organization recognises his passion for his work.

title: Location ! Location ! Location !
text: Loved this Hotel and the Location ...could walk to all our favorite sites in NYC... !!  Front desk staff was awesome and helped celebrated my daughter’s Birthday, one that she will always remember.... Front desk staff all wonderful ... Flitta is the best...loved the view of Central Park....❤️❤️

title: Great hotel in the heart of NYC!
text:
We stayed for 5 days this February and everything was pretty good, great location near CP and subways, clean rooms and comfy beds.

The staff is really amazing, we are brazilians and Raphael one of the doormans help us with everything we needed!

title: Nice hotel with excellent staff
text:
This hotel is so nice, so clean, with a perfect location close to the 5th avenue and in front of Central Park. 
The staff is so  friendly and so professional.
Special thanks to Sonam and Vije for their kind attention.
I will return to this hotel

title: Quirky Valentine's Day Request - Mission Accomplished! - A testament to teamwork!
text:
This morning I reached out to the Concierge Dana S - my request was to send a special Valentine to my brother and his wife from their three pets who were being boarded while their parents visited NYC. An odd request but one that was welcomed and carried out flawlessly from Concierge Dana S and his Concierge Christopher C. 
Gentlemen - thank you for being so nice to work with on behalf on myself & three well-wishing pets who love their Mom & Dad. Your efforts have earned you a guest for life!
Thanks again.

title: Pay for location and not much else
text:
Sorry to say, I would not stay here again. The location is very, very good. We stayed just after Christmas for a couple of nights. Easily walkable to midtown attractions and shopping and the park.

title: Best service in the city
text:
I’ve been visiting NY city for the last 20 years, i have to say that this hotel offers the best service in the city, the staff are nice and welcoming , they make you feel at home especially Vijay who loves his job and always willing to help and offer you a better service.
I strongly recommend this hotel, ask for Vijay and i’m sure you will get the best service in the city.

title: Great location
text: On 57th street near Columbus Circle and a few blocks from Central ParK. Staff very friendly and efficient. Has a great Rooftop bar with view of Central Park. Currently onsite restaurant is only serving breakfast. Rooms are somewhat dated with nautica/cruise feel, but tentatively scheduled for renovation in 2020. But all in all very comfortable and wonderful location.

title: Best staff in th city
text: I stay in this hotel about 4 times a year and every single time, I feel extremely comfortable.  The hotel room is fine but what sets this hotel apart from the other hotels in the city is the excellent staff.  Everyone is genuinely friendly, not automatic robot friendliness.  They are so helpful and very attentive, especially VIJAY.  He's the best.  Someone needs to make this guy the manager if he is not already.  If you go there, ask for him, he will definitely take the best care of you.

title: Peaceful and Quiet
text: Perfect stay. Room was very clean and comfortable. It is iron how in such a busy city we were able to rest so peacefully in a very quiet room. The location of the hotel was just perfect with many options for dining at a walking distance. Staff was very helpful and they provided friendly customer service.

title: Guest services were fabulous and the room was comfy too. Great location.
text:
I had the pleasure of being a guest here and being taken care of my a guest services rep named Sonam who really made this hotel spectacular. The rest of the guest services crew was great, too, but Sonam was exceptional.

The room was smaller but modern and well designed. Mid century modern with some twists is how I would call it.

Location was great - a few blocks from Central Park and the subway and not TOO close to the chaos of Times Square!

I would stay here again based on the service.

title: Lovely room, lovely location, lovely staff
text: When a weekend in New York went horribly wrong, thanks to a pre-paid reservation at what turned out to be a fleabag hotel, a friend and I fled in desperation to the nearby Le Meridien. Thank GOODNESS we did! Louie at the front desk couldn't have been nicer, waving his magic wand and placing us in a comfortable, quiet, spotless room (sleek midcentury-Mad Men-meets-vintage-New-York decor, marble bathroom and all) that rescued the rest of the weekend and sent us off on a high note. His fellow staff members were equally charming. Looking forward to a return visit next time I'm in New York!

text: Our trip was excellent! As per the Le Meridien it was breathtaking, beautiful view, excellent service, friendly staff that were willing to help. It was our 28th wedding anniversary and just by choosing the Le Meridien  services, help location where everything is centrally located made us felt like it was our 1st anniversary horse-draw carriage OMG.

text:
Typical Le Meridien Hotel. Good Service. Smaller Rooms, Very Helpful Front desk and Concierge. Always ready to help. 
Sonam Vijay Dana Chris were exceptionally good. Sonam takes the cake. The hotel is walking distance from Central Park  Times Square , Columbis circle, Underground Station , Broadway, Trump Tower etc

First off, thought I had booked Le Parker Méridien but it appears that in 2019 that it was bought by Hyatt and the le meridian moved next door into a hole in the wall building. title: Holiday in New York
text: We loved Le Meridien New York Central Park! Everyone was so helpful and accommodating. They went above and beyond especially Sharam and Luigi helping us find the right room and wonderful restaurants! We definitely will be back!

text: Came into the city for the weekend to see the sites and 911 memorial. Hotel is very nice, clean room and bathroom. Very comfortable and a great location. Staff very friendly and accommodating. The rooftop lounge is great. Can’t wait to come back again. Thank you.

Loved our stay at Le Meridien central park. Of course, the location is perfect with a short walk to central park and a 15 minute walk to Times Square.
The hotel room was very well decorated with an elegant feel. I wish I could have stayed there longer.

Room is clean and everything is well maintained. Front desk team is friendly and helpful. No complaints at all.

title: Be forgiving - rebranding is in progress !
text:
SLet me preface everything with the fact that up until summer 2019, this property was branded as The Viceroy, so there is still an ongoing transition to bring this up to the standard of Le Méridien. As it stands in January 2020, the property is definitely not at Le Méridien’s standards. However, I will absolutely return to this property when I am in New York.

What makes this property incredible: The People
Every interaction that I had, from check-in, to getting acquainted, lobby staff interactions, bar / restaurant staff - the people are incredible. I felt like a valuable family member the entire time I was there, and that is the top memory that I carry from my first stay at this property.

The esthetics
Knowing that the complete renovation is imminent, my opinions are very lenient on this point. The hard product is very worn, dark, and not at all what you expect from a Le Méridien property. This will change, so give it a chance. Right now, the rooms feel awkward, dark, but still everything is very comfortable and I will stay here again even before renovations. Remember, this is New York City, spaces can be cramped so don’t expect a bathroom the size of one that you might find in Atlanta or Miami for example. 

The lobby has already been renovated so it is very warm and comfortable when you arrive, especially on those chilly and brisk New York winter days. Two elevators serve the 29 floors so waiting for a lift is very quick.

If you’re staying here before the renovation - yes the rooms feel dark, the surfaces feel worn and old, but this will change soon.

Food & Beverage
This was the biggest weakness for the Le Méridien brand. Please note - I did not experience room service (maybe I should have, perhaps next time).

The restaurant off the lobby on the ground floor is called Kingside. As of January 2019 this restaurant is only available for breakfast. So I have not had a chance to try this space. Even being in the middle of Midtown New York, we need a full service restaurant at this property.

On the 29th floor, there is a very charming bar called Rooftop, and part of it is indoors and outdoors (during my stay the outdoor section was covered, and had heat lamps). 

This is where I had my worst, most non-Le Méridien experience.

Again I say, the people at Rooftop are incredible, very accommodating and warm. I learned my first night that the food & beverage management company had just recently changed, and here is the new menu. Two nights later, nothing on that menu is available. Instead, a very limited selection of food is offered (eg., olives, cheese & crackers, French fries, salmon toast), all which are very expensive. I ordered the cheese & crackers and the French fries which were completely unacceptable. The fries were soggy and limp, the cheese was served walk-in cold and just not good. 

I did have a very positive conversation with Juan, who rectified my invoice, and was very open to my feedback. I hope that the next time, there is an improvement.

Overall : B-
Room: B
Food & Bev: D+

title: Great hotel near Central Park!
text: We spent a few post-New Year's days in NYC and stayed at Le Meridien. During our visit, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely beyond what I usually get at a NYC hotel. For example, the concierge happily printed my theater tickets when I realized I couldn't use a mobile option. The location was great - easy walking distance to Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square. Rooms were clean and comfortable, with just the right Art Deco touches. After we left, my daughter realized she left a small bag with medicine in her hotel room. When I called, the staff said they would contact security for me. I didn't hold out much hope - it had been two days. But they called back to tell me that they located the bag and would send it to me. I have left items before in rooms and never gotten this level of service and attention to detail (and, yes, we will be doing a better job checking our rooms going foward!).

title: Rundown and need attention
text:
Booked this hotel due to location and Le Meridien brand reputation.   We were disappointed.  

The pros are few: friendly staff and great location.  

The cons were the hotel itself and the breakfast.   

The hotel is outdated, dark, rundown, and needs renovation badly. See the photos.    It is like someone’s den from the 70’s with old furniture and outdated lighting that is not bright at all and makes the room feel cave-like. There is ugly brown carpet and stained wood furniture (I attached just one photo of the stained/marked furniture, but took more than that). The desk is literally bolted to the floor.   The light fixtures are awful and provide little light.   The hallways are dark and dreary and look like a cheap hotel.  I have stayed in hotels in lower categories and had much nicer rooms and decor.  It is worth mentioning that the photos on the Marriott website, where I booked, made the rooms look light and bright.   They are not.

We booked a 1 bedroom suite with Central Park view.  Not sure what room Marriott took the central park view picture from, but we were on the 22nd floor and had the view in the photo attached.  There are 27 floors and I don’t see how going up five floors higher or to the left or right gets the unobstructed view shown in Marriott’s photo on their website.  (it was very foggy the day I took the photo, so not the best shot, but you can see that the view is buildings with Central Park visible beyond.) 

We are Marriott members so had a special rate that included breakfast.   I would not recommend spending extra for the breakfast.   The cost of it is $35 per person and $15 for a child.  It is a buffet, so chafing dishes of scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, and sausage.  Also cold cereals, bagels, bread to toast, fruit, and yogurt with granola.    Juice and coffee included.   Does it sound almost exactly like a free breakfast at a Residence Inn?   It is almost the same in selection and quality, but $35 per person.    Our rate to have breakfast included was $40 or $50 more versus a room rate without breakfast (can’t recall exactly), so we weren’t actually paying the $35 per person, but the breakfast was not worth the extra money.   Really disappointing considering we could have gone to a restaurant and had much better breakfast for less than what we paid.  

In sum, we would not stay here again and would t recommend to friends.   Marriott really needs to spend some money here!

title: Excellent experience at this charming hotel
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our experience staying at Le Meridien Central Park.  As the name implies it is right next to the park, and walking distance from Times Square, Theatre district, shopping and so forth.  We took no cabs but walked everywhere during our stay.  The hotel is small but very charming and cozy, and  every staff member we interacted with was welcoming and helpful.  For instance, the concierge, Dana Steer, provided excellent information about the theater offerings so we were able to book seats to a great production with little advance notice.  He was very skillful at managing a number of calls and requests while we were working with him, all the while ensuring our needs were addressed.  We'll be returning to this hotel!

text: You can't beat the location at this hotel or the roof top bar and lounge which is fabulous. The rooms are dated and the furnishings are worn and stained. The hallways are very drab and worn.
