This hotel is now owned by Marriott and they shgould consider a renovation given the great location. We used to go to the Parker Meriden next store which is awesome and is now called The Parker and owned by Hyatt.

title: Christmas time at Le Meridien, New York
text:
We stayed at Le Meridien at Xmas time as part of a package deal including flights to and from the Netherlands. The hotel is very conveniently situated in midtown Manhattan and close to several subway stations and Central Park.
Our room was not very large but adequate to our (2 persons) needs. The interior design is charming  with wrought-iron mirrors, messing rain-shower, nice tiling. Charming little Illy coffee machine with complimentary coffee capsules. 
As our neighbour was very noisy and clearly very drunk, shouting aggressively, we did not get a lot of sleep the first night, but the staff reacted to this promptly and adequately by sending someone up to deal with the matter. The next day we were allocated to another room, the staff being solution focussed, Our luggage was relocated while we were roaming NYC.
Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean; we had a nice view from the 19th floor.
As we did not eat in the hotel, I cannot comment on that, There is a nice bar on the top floor with a great view. As anywhere else in NYC, the bar was very expensive ( a beer for $9, glass of wine $12, small platter of nachos chips with small bowl of (good) guacamole $22). Prices in NYC are through the roof and this may make us rethink a future visit, but we would recommend Le Meridien to anybody who is planning to visit Manhattan.

title: Slightly disappointed
text: I chose LeMeridian from past experience traveling. I expected more attention to detail.  Room although extremely convenient to Central Park I was met by a large hairball in the shower. If they say it was recently updated...well keep updating. The room was dark,and terribly dated.  The room cleaning staff needs more supervision or training. Shower and wash basin drains plugs missing or broken and towel hanger was too far from the shower. Small details matter but only 2 stars. The toilet paper end was folded everyday. Price and convenience were about right for the area.

title: An unforgettable experience
text: This was the first time I stayed at Le Meridien. Everything about this place is "top shelf" from when I was first greeted at check-in until I checked out. The staff is extremely welcoming. Everyone who works here is extremely gracious no matter what their job is. My room was fabulous and had a view of Central Park. I was here to celebrate my birthday. Staying here was my birthday gift to me. I think this has to be one of the best gifts I have ever given myself and I'm looking forward to my next stay. The king size bed was ultra comfortable and the bathroom was perfect. I was "Queen for a Weekend". Room service was excellent. No complaints but many thanks to a superb staff.

title: Not worth the price!
text: Work requires me to be in NYC (near Columbus Circle) every year during the second week of December.  And while that part of town is charming around the holidays, the surge pricing of hotels rooms is anything but... In the past years I've stayed at The London NYC, but since its being renovated, I was looking for something similar, in the same price range: homey, not corporate, charming and high-end.  From the website, Le Meridian seemed comparable, so I booked a room there for this year's trip and was totally disappointed.  Knowing we'd be arriving after midnight, I made sure there was a note in our reservation to hold our room and called twice beforehand to ensure it would be.  Of course, when we arrived at 1:30AM, our room had been given away and the only room available was the last one in the hotel - room 203 - which is unfit for guests.  It has two double beds (not queens) with ill-fitting sheets, no furniture, no alarm clock, no remote and hadn't been cleaned.  Ugh.  Just to add insult to injury, the people at the desk tried to convince me that this room was actually an upgrade (!!!) and charged $799 for the night ($200 more than the king room we had booked).  They knew they were putting lipstick on a pig.  We were moved to a king on a higher floor the next day.  And while that room was fine, it was tiny and the compressor for the heater kept having to be reset, so it was freezing.  The staff is friendly.  The lobby is lovely.  The Roof was closed for private parties every night we were there (second week of December, so understandable).  It's very convenient to where I have to be for work meetings.  The Art Deco vibe is charming in the common areas and maybe in the larger guest rooms, but the rooms we stayed in were old and dinky.   Next time I will stay at the Parker or the Park Central, which have more updated rooms and are a much better value.

title: Thanksgiving 2019 - always staying here
text:
spent countless hours trying to figure out my hotel stay in NYC.  WOW, I'm so happy that my search is over and I found my home away from home. The staff is very courteous, professional and best of all, attentive. They know how to run the place seamlessly, even through the most hectic days of Thanksgiving weekend.
I have to give a special shout out to Sonam Chosgial because he went above and beyond to provide 5 star customer service to me and my husband, which was deeply appreciated. 
 If you're staying during Thanksgiving, this location has a very nice spot next to the Macy's parade route. 
Also, please do not leave without having a drink at The Roof with sweeping views of Central Park. The bartender makes great martinis and he's easy on the eyes. 
Stop looking around and book this hotel!  perfect location too!

title: Small rooms but comfortable bed
text:
Stayed for 5 nights, rooms weren’t ready when we arrived in the afternoon but we were told we’d get an upgrade for being Marriott Bonvoy members, we went for a drink in the Kingside bar until they were ready.  When we were given the rooms they were quite small and no view of Central Park, not sure what the rooms were like before the upgrade?!

They were clean but certainly ready for an update, not much storage space as one cupboard had the fridge and coffee machine in.  The towels and bedding were changed daily and the beds/pillows were really comfortable.  

We didn’t get to see the rooftop bar as there was a private party on the evening we decided to go so tried the Kingside bar which was also closed for a private party, the reception staff weren’t aware of this initially so there were no signs up telling the guests, lack of communication between staff??

The door staff were really friendly and helpful and arranged a taxi for the airport for our journey home.

title: Just what I wanted
text:
My husband and I felt welcome before we ever stepped foot inside.  Everyone was friendly, helpful  and courteous. 

Room was not large, but perfect for my husband and me. Very comfortable and updated.  

One drawback... no microwave and we didn’t see an ice machine. There is a grocery store next to hotel so that was great!

Location was absolutely perfect for our plans...  Carnegie Hall almost next door and St. Patrick’s Cathedral and Rockefeller Center an easy walk.  Central Park just a few blocks.  Great restaurants only feet away. 

This was our first trip to NYC and, if returning, we would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Christmas in New York 2019
text: We stayed for 4 nights in the le meridien and we had an amazing time. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The hotel is very quiet in our room and street is quiet. we were not charged a hotel tax when leaving and the bars are cashless so you will need a card to check in and to pay the room bill. The subway station is at the end of the block on both sides which we used to get about town and used the train/subway to get from the airport. title: I wanted the negative reviews to be wrong
text: I am a pretty loyal Marriott girl so I wanted the reviews to be wrong. But some of the issues other people mentioned I experienced as well. I’m not sure what exactly the issue was. When I checked in, the guy said it said on my account that it was my birthday ( it wasn’t) and they would send me a present. I explained that it wasn’t my birthday but he said they would do it anyway, that they would send a bottle of Prosecco to the room and asked which day I would want it. I gave a day. It was never received, which is fine, but I don’t think hotel staff should make claims and not follow through. I also had SEVERAL issues with bell services. I checked in very early morning and had to store our luggage until our room was ready but the man at the desk tried to page them on a walkie talkie to come get the bags and they never came or responded. He had to send another staff member to get someone. We also never received any sort of notification that our room was ready that day. We came back late at night after being out all day. As I was at the front desk again collecting keys he tried to page bell services to retrieve our bags and they never responded. So I left the claim ticket and they said they would deliver them to the room. This was after midnight. It took over 30 minutes to deliver the luggage. I am not a complainer but I had to call the desk to ask about them because we needed them before we could go to sleep. The location of the hotel is great, atmosphere good, no complaints with housekeeping, but I can’t say if I would stay here again.

title: Excellent location and friendly staff.
text: Got a good rate from a website and loved the location. Burgers at the lobby are also very good. Everything is nearby - including Central Park. Broadway shows are even walkable. The bathrooms are cute and bed quality is good (even if soft).

title: Really impressed! Great location & really nice staff!
text:
My husband & I stayed here last week. The staff were so nice. It was our honeymoon and we were gifted a bottle of free champagne and $100 credit to use on the rooftop bar! This was so generous and we were hugely flattered. 
The room was so big and stylish! 
The bathroom was beautiful. 
The hotel was in a perfect location. So close to Central Park and just around the corner from Times Square and the theatres. It was in a safe area. 
There was only two points that let the hotel down;
1) the housekeeping wasn't the best. The robes in the bathroom were filthy when we arrived and weren't changed all week! - even after calling to get them changed. So we obviously didn't use them. 
2) the breakfast is expensive! And it's not worth it. Our coffee was served with curdled milk (it was obvious off). I couldn't take a photo because the team to be honest were mortified and took it off the table straight away. But for nearly $90 for two people it wasn't good. We only had breakfast here once. 

But overall the hotel was lovely and we would certainly stay again. Definitely a romantic hotel, stylish and really friendly staff!

title: Excellent hotel location and stylish rooms!
text: I spent my friend's bachelorette weekend here. Was treated by professional and friendly staff special mention - Paula Tito. Location is perfect next to the shopping district, Central Park and close to all the fun activities NYC has to offer. The rooms were stylish and boutique. I will definitely recommend this wonderful gem of a hotel!

title: When neighborhood matters
text: I make it a habit to check the Marriott website for new acquisitions in the Big Apple. They always have some and if you pay attention to the newcomers they are deeply discounted to introduce them to Marriott customers. Bottom line here is the Meridien had room nights for us under $300 in NYC’s best neighborhood. The hotel is steps away from Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Fifth Avenue luxury and all the best the city has to offer. Saying that, the hotel only had to be fair for it to be a great value. But, it’s a nice old place with some interesting features like custom woodwork around the bedroom built in headboards and elegant, tiled large bathrooms. There are some maintenance and updating issues but the staff we encountered were all uniformly pleasant. I don’t imagine the bargain prices for their rooms will last very long so if location matters to you, this is a deal to jump on.

title: Splendid and elegant
text:
My wife and I traveled to New York City for the Bryant Park Winter Village market 22-24 Nov 2019.  We opted not to stay with family at their 8th Ave and 14th St property, but instead made reservations at Le Meridien 57th St Central Park South.
  I've been a Marriott brand property loyalist for the past 5 years.  As a consultant I spend approximately 72% of my time on travel in hotels, and I've come to expect quality service and impeccable accommodations from Marriott.
  The Le Meridien New York, Central Park property was amazing.  From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by professional staff eager to welcome us to the property.  Check-in was swift and efficient.  I've ambassador elite status, and was excited to have received a suite upgrade.  I had no idea what was in store for us.  As we entered the 27th floor suite, the massive glass windows filled the suite with brilliant sweeping Central Park Autumn foliage views.  Setting our bags down, we walked through the rooms to make note of the accommodations.  The suite was impressive.  The enlarged bedroom also offered panoramic views of Central Park.  The bedroom had a wall-mounted television, firm and comfortable mattress, as well as vintage designed features and fixtures. As we walked through the pocket doors into the bathroom foyer, dual sinks recessed into granite countertops finished with charming brass fixtures were to our left, walled off separate walk-in closet and toilet were to our front, and a massive open glass walled shower to our right.  The enormous bathroom space was filled with natural light from a raised porthole window.  The space allocated to the bathroom area by no means compromised any of the suite's vast living space.
  Back in the main living space were vintage designed sofa and chairs, stools, tables, and lighting fixtures.  The space also featured a workspace, elevated buffet table, and a tailored minibar with complimentary and for purchase-items.  The kitchenette featured an enlarged bar sink, Illy coffee maker, and glass door mini-fridge.  The mini-fridge was stocked with non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages for purchase.
  Every detail of the suite was carefully designed to give an eclectic feel but with modern amenities.  Taking it all in, we realized we weren't in a hotel, but rather an apartment tailored to provide a fashioned vintage experience.
  I would be remiss if I didn't comment about "The Roof".  It's the Le Meridien's New York City rooftop lounge.  It too was impressive with sweeping views of Central Park and the surrounding skyline.  It featured outdoor (covered) and indoor lounge areas, comfortable seating, ambience, and was serviced by professional staff and populated with polite patrons.
  In my opinion and experience staying at Marriott properties, I'd say the Le Meridien 57th St Central Park is my favorite.  It is not a cookie cutter property to house guests, but instead offered us an unparalleled quality of life and comfortable experience.  I would encourage anyone looking to feel at home in New York City to stay at the Le Meridien 57th St Central Park.  My wife and I will return.

title: Right place in the right place
text: A great “boutique” hotel with all of the detailing of a small bespoke hotel with all of the support and structure of a big chain. The location is perfect - the rooms are great. It was a refreshing change from other midtown tourist traps

title: Terrific stay in NYC!
text: I had read mixed reviews of the hotel, but we could not have enjoyed our stay more!  Some of the rooms are small, but the Central park 1bedroom suites are spacious, and true to the pictures.  All of the hotel staff were so welcoming to us, particularly the hotel manager Natacha deFrank and the Rooftop bar manager. We had a wonderful stay.  Thank you!!

title: Poor hotel
text:
Small rooms, unfriendly staff, expensive, poor breakfast. 

When you order gin and tonic for $20 per glass you expect some service and hospitality. 
The small buffet for breakfast is often incomplete. Coffee orders take about 20 minutes to get delivered.

The only good thing is that it is close to Central Park

title: 10 days in New York in early November 2019
text: If you are staying for more than a week as a couple, upgrade to the suite, which will get you a bar area, living room area and separate bedroom and large bathroom with large closet. We originally were in a single room, and one of us would have to sit on the bed for the other one to find their stuff and get organized and dressed.  There are some rooms with Central Park views, but they will not guarantee them when you book.  When you arrive from 5 to 6 pm, they give you a glass of decent wine, which is a nice touch.

title: Dae night
text: the hotel was great.  the one-bed room suite was the best with the best view of central park.  the staff was perfect at check in and check out.   the roof top bar was very cool. I will be back again.  this was a great location to be.

title: Very pleasant experience
text:
After reading the reviews, I was skeptical but saw a decent last min deal on Living Social. Very pleasantly surprised!  It's a Marriott property, which I didn't realize. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Small room but that's typical in NYC. Great location. Nice lobby AND rooftop bar but of course, expensive...it IS NYC.  Great location!

Definitely recommend and would stay there again if price is right.

title: Great room and location; excellent value.
text: We stayed just one night with a group of friends. The hotel is very nice for the price, and front desk staff were very accommodating. The new flagship Nordstrom is just up the street! Would definitely stay again.

title: Great Location
text:
Very nice hotel. The room was clean, the staff were very friendly and professional. However, the temperature of the room was difficult to maintain. 
The bar was very nice and cozy. Hotel is in a great location. We would stay there again—if the temperature could be better regulated.

title: Great hotel and experience
text:
The room was clean, spacious, and had an amazing view of Central Park.  The lobby was warm and welcoming, with a friendly and helpful staff.  Special thanks to Felitta who took great care of us! 

I highly recommend this hotel for any business or pleasure trips to the city.  Great location near Central Park.

title: Muy buen hotel
text: Buen hotel. Recepcionista que hablan en español. Habitaciones lo suficientemente espaciosas buen servicio una ubicación privilegiada con todos los transportes cerca. Hasta el subte para hacer  combinación con el aeropuerto

title: Very Old and Tired Hotel
text: Not much I can offer as a positive with this one. The staff were nice, most competent and friendly , but there were the ones who weren’t. The rooms are very old and tired, desperately needing an upgrade. The roof top bar is ok, but not enough to compensate for this very old and tired hotel. My recommendation is stay somewhere else.

title: Working out the kinks
text:
My family loved this hotel when we stayed last year while it was still under the Viceroy banner, so when I signed up to run the New York Marathon this year, we booked a suite early to ensure we all had room (especially when I got up at 4am to stretch!). When we arrived and found a new hotel brand name on the door I joked to my wife, “I assume they transferred the reservation...”. I shouldn’t have joked. When Melissa at the front desk furrowed her brow at her screen, I knew what was coming: “It appears your reservation was canceled out of the system.” After first declining to be squeezed into a double-double, I pressed for two rooms to make up for the error. Thankfully, Melissa and the hotel were able to accommodate me, and they honored the original price. Melissa was calm and helpful, and the manager stepped in to ensure everything was copacetic. The hotel staff went out of their way to make sure the many marathoners on property felt encouraged and welcomed, which was nice. The only downside we found during our two night stay was the buffet breakfast at Kingside, the onsite restaurant. It was anemic: a couple of trays of pastries and bagels, a picked-over bowl of fruit (with those little fruit gnats buzzing around it) and a near empty at 8am chafing dish with standard eggs, potatoes, sausage, and bacon. Nothing fancy or special - and entirely adequate for a reasonable price. $30 per person is not a reasonable price for scrambled eggs and potatoes, even in NYC. Until they up the breakfast game, pick one of the several restaurants in easy walking distance. 
Overall a good experience, and the staff (especially Melissa at the desk) was great.

title: Great location, needs modernization
text: After shoveling from one room to another, , got a nice room. Front desk attendants attentive and Helpful. Restaurant very substandard. Breakfast service essentially non existence. Lobby remodeled but rest of hotel old and tired— needs modernization

title: great hotel at prime location
text: walking distance to central park and 5th ave shopping. front desk staff were all very friendly, professional and very helpful. (concierge not so much). they give you unlimited bottles of water and a fridge. shower stall is arranged a bit strange-can easily get flooded as it's not completely covered. but the staff was extra good.

title: Great location, great staff
text: The hotel is so so central.  The staff so so helpful and polite.  Cleanliness in the room was very evident. The room was also very quiet—a big plus in a big city.  The staff provided a glass of wine to all the weary shoppers upon return in the evening.  Nice surprise!

title: Great hotel, staff and experience!
text: I chose the Le Meridien when it was the Viceroy as the hotel I would stay at and get ready on my wedding day. I picked it for a couple of reasons but mostly because of the decor and fantastic views of Central Park. When the property was bought out by the Marriott and became the Le Meridien, they transitioned everything over seamlessly and honored our reservations, as well as the hotel block and group rate. When I had toured the property as the Viceroy, I was shown the rooftop bar and deck which has amazing views of Central Park. I really wanted photos on our wedding day from here capturing the city. I later found out that the rooftop is separately owned/operated and I received a little bit of a hard time gaining access for photos. The staff at the Le Meridien still made sure my request was taken care of and organized roof access for me to have photos taken up there (Thank you Tyler!). The front desk employees were incredibly nice, friendly, helpful and accommodating. Overall, everyone at the hotel really did everything to make sure I was taken care of on our special day. We also ate at the Kingside restaurant in the lobby. We were pleasantly surprised at how delicious the food was. I stayed in the penthouse suite which was insanely gorgeous. Probably the nicest hotel room I have ever been in. I did have family and friends in king and double rooms, which were also nice for a standard room. Yes the rooms are on the smaller side, but welcome to New York. Everything in New York is on the smaller side. You're not going to find sprawling rooms anywhere in the city unless you pay for the penthouse. I definitely recommend this property!!

title: Needs Improvement
text: Stayed in this hotel several times in the summer and fall 2019 seasons.  Amazing location on 57th Street in the heart of 'Billionaire's Row', received standard Marriott benefits, and the front desk staff are very helpful.  However, that is where the plus points of this hotel end... the rooms require modernisation - my room was covered in pen marks and scratches - my telephone didn't work, toiletries were not replenished and it takes forever to get an elevator during peak hours.  I appreciate that this hotel has recently been taken over by Marriott, but it will require significant investment to reach a suitable Marriott / Meridien standard.  Given there are so many fabulous hotel choices in New York I would not choose to stay at this hotel again.

title: Great location and staff!!
text: stayed here with my family for a long weekend. We walked everywhere!! Hotel is in a great central location, close to Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Columbus Square and Time Square. The rooms were spacious and the view was great.

title: Great location and staff
text: Stayed here for a long weekend. Staff was extremely helpful, especially Sonam at the front desk. Rooms are spacious for NYC and the property was well maintained. The decor is up to date and the shower was wonderful.

title: Great rooftop bar
text: Good central position a stones throw from Carnegie Hall. I liked the french style decor and helpful staff but the jewel in the crown is the rooftop bar (30th floor) with great views over central park.

title: Passable 3-star hotel at 5-star prices.
text:
Once upon a time there was a grand hotel called the Parker Meridien which fronted on two streets, 57th and 56th, and when we reserved here we thought that this was the successor to the Parker Meriden.   Come to find out, a few years ago the hotel was divided in the middle of the two blocks, with the 57th street part of it becoming Le Meridien, a Marriott hotel, and the 56th St part of it becoming the Parker Hotel, a Hyatt property.   Must be that all the good rooms ended in the Parker Hotel, because from our own experience (and the other reviews posted on Tripadvorr) I would venture that there are no good rooms on the Le Meridien side of the former Parker Meridien.   Now we paid using Marriott points, but when I checked the price on the web for Saturday,Oct 12, it was a little over $600, and if I had paid that for this little enclosure with poor water pressure, I might have ended up jail.   Next time we'll try the Parker, so check back for my posts in a few months for a comparison.  

The plus-es:  Terrific location, half a block from Carnegie Hall,  and a very nice staff.
A big negative:  No business center or computers available to guests.

title: Amazing celebration weekend!
text: We recently stayed here for a celebration weekend and our amazing experience began days before we arrived.  I reached out to the property to pre-arrange a few things as we were spending the long weekend celebrating both my son’s 1st anniversary and my 50th birthday. Front desk mgr, Kyle Kitchen immediately took responsibility to ensure we had the best possible experience and he did not disappoint!  From the moment we arrived, I knew we’d made the right choice. We were greeted warmly and professionally and acknowledged for both my Bonvoy status and our special events. My hubby and I enjoyed outstanding cocktails and snacks at the bar while waiting for my son and daughter in law to arrive. Our Central Park suites were incredible, nicely appointed with great attention to detail. I love that they’ve kept the historic feel without letting things get run down. Every single person we interacted with during our stay was friendly and professional. We will definitely visit this property again. If you’ve seen some of the questionable reviews from recent months, please know these were probably just from the growing pains of the recent ownership change. I feel they’ve worked through that transition and the current mgmt has gotten things going the right direction.

title: A real gem
text:
During a three-day stay, I fell in love with this hotel. It's beautiful, comfortable, conveniently located — and the service is impeccable. I would most definitely stay here again.

We booked through Hotwire and got an incredible rate ($147 per night) for a "European-style cozy king." The room did not feel cramped (unlike the rooms at the nearby Paramount), we easily found a place for everything, and the bed was indeed a king. The room had attractive design elements (unlike the bland rooms at the Parker, next-door), and the bathroom had a lot of classic style. 

We were delighted to find upscale Malin + Goetz toiletries in the bathroom, and we took advantage of the hotel's policy of providing guests with free Aquafina bottled water on demand. We found the hotel's staff friendly and very helpful, especially the doormen. When I returned to the hotel one morning with coffee in one hand and groceries in the other, a doorman not only held the door but also followed me to the elevator and punched the button for my floor.

I'm utterly baffled by the negative reviews for this hotel. It's one of the best I've encountered in Manhattan.

title: Verkehrstechnisch gute Lage, Rest war unbefriedigend
text:
Wir hatten eine Suite mit Blick auf Central Park und Ausziehsofa. Die Aussicht war gut und die Grösse der Suite auch ok. Einzig die Staumöglichkeiten für eine 4 köpfige Familie sind  viel zu klein.
Das ausziehbare Sofabett für zwei Personen war schlicht unzumutbar. Schon für eine erwachsene Person eigentlich nicht zumutbar, aber für zwei Teenager unmöglich.
Nachfrage nach einem Zimmerupgrade mit grösserer zweiter Schlafmöglichkeit wurde quittiert mit der Antwort „sie haben bereits das grösste Zimmer...“.
Sauberkeit des Zimmers und Freundlichkeit an der Rezeption liessen ebenfalls zu wünschen übrig.
Preis-Leistungsverhältnis passt überhaupt nicht.

title: Awesome hotel - business traveler
text:
First time coming back since it changed into a Le Meridien. I used to come all the time when it was Viceroy. While I do miss the slippers they used to provide, in all honesty - it's an environmental waste for people to wear slippers for a few days and then the hotel throws them away. 

Sibi from Housekeeping really impressed me. My room had no snacks like the bar had 3 drinks in it and there were no snacks in the tray. He brought me some and then came back the next night to ensure I didn't need any water or additional snacks. What service - this guy deserves some acknowledgement. I haven't had anyone follow up like that at any hotel ever. 

I made the mistake of going to the Parker next door on my last trip... which is awful. The room felt so outdated and not in a cool, hip way. Location is a few doors down from a 24/7 grocery store and Duane Reed on the corner. I also really love the food at the connected restaurant - the S&P fries are dangerously good!

title: Great experience!
text: The hotel is conveniently located a few steps from Central Park and minutes from a subway station. The staff is great! Shout out to the hotel manager Shahram, all of our needs were taken care of immediately and we even got delicious macaroons in our room to enjoy. The staff had awesome recommendations for food and shopping. The service was top notch, lobby is recently renovated and the room was comfy! We had a minor issue with the bathroom fan and it was resolved within minutes. I will definitely be back!

title: Hotel incrivel
text:
Me hospedei neste hotel por 8 dias depois de consegui-lo em uma promoção de um site de reserva. 
Como eu tinha lido avaliações negativas, estava com a expectativa baixa porém o hotel me surpreendeu em todos os aspectos. Cheguei 7 horas antes do check in, e prontamente me alocaram em um quarto. O quarto era bonito e confortável, e o banheiro bem moderno. O lavatório fica fora o que é bastante pratico! E ele tinha apenas chuveiro, o que achei ótimo porque odeio quando tem aquelas banheiras velhas que ninguém usa. A cama era confortável, tinha cortinas blackout... a TV passa muitos canais, muitos mesmo!
O quarto não é enorme, mas de um bom tamanho pra o padrão de NY e achei confortável para duas pessoas.

title: Location stupenda, ma ...
text: La posizione è davvero ottima, ma per il resto? Ma! Concordo con le recensioni negative. Inoltre trattati male al roof bar(piccolissimo), dove dopo averci fatto sedere allo stesso tavolo di   una coppia maleducata e infastidita dalla nostra presenza, il personale non trovava più la nostra carta di credito consegnata all'arrivo!

title: Underwhelming
text:
I was excited to book this supposedly new hotel at a great rate. Only to find that the hotel is old but under new management and is in dire need of updates. The rooms are really old and not well maintained. But the thing that ruined my stay completely was the constant knocking even when I had a privacy sign on the door. They had assumed I was checking out even though I explained to them I had booked a reservation for one more day and the Front Desk had stated I would be staying in the same room.
The housekeeping supervisor or Manager came back and demanded I go to the Front Desk to clarify since his board doesn't state so. I had explained to him that I had not slept in 36 hours and I was going for a meeting in 3 hours so I have no time to go and wait in line to clarify. I asked him to either call the Front Desk or head on down to ask them. He walked away and I went to bed. He was back again banging at my door, even with the privacy sign. I would not recommend this hotel. At least until they do better.

title: Amazing experience!
text: Our anniversary stay and Julia was so nice and considerate that we were upgraded to a very nice room. She was very patient and with amazing and caring attitude. Thank you so much for everything! We really loved it!

title: 3 Night Stay
text:
My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in September 2019, there was a small issue upon arrival. We booked a junior suite but later after booking upgraded to a park suite, during the recent ownership change this had been overlooked, thus a small issue upon arrival. Sonam on the desk was fantastic, we went through my booking and whilst the room we booked was not available for the first night a very amicable resolution was found. When we had to move rooms the next day, this was all done on our behalf whilst we were out enjoying ourselves. Muntari was outstanding moving the cases, re hanging our jackets and ensuring that everything we had was correctly moved.

I really hope the management pas on these comments to these guys, these guys have made the Meridien our first choice hotel in NYC.

Thanks for the hospitality, the amenities and adding to our holiday

title: Needs Work
text: I wish and wanted to write this hotel a better review but I just can’t. While the service and staff are top notch, the hotel needs help. The lobby and rooftop are beautiful and everyone at the front desk was lovely. The issue is the rooms need serious updating and housekeeping needs to be properly trained on cleaning rooms. The room was on a top floor and had great views however, the room was dusty. We had a mini bar that was not stocked, light bulbs missing, a shower that didn’t drain well, fixtures that needed updating and the list goes on. While the bed was very comfortable and sheets lovely it was just poorly cared for. In time and with updates the hotel will be fantastic but for now, the price truly doesn’t match the room. We are Marriott Gold and Amex Platinum members so I know we did get an ‘upgrade’ and had some nice amenities added but it just didn’t take away from the room quality.

title: Just No
text:
Hotel may be better in a year but I can’t recommend it to anyone despite the nice and pleasant staff. Rooms are tired and banged up - think heavy banged up wood from the 1970:  Gym is closed “for renovation” but it’s gutted so don’t go anytime soon if that’s important. The kicker. Invited friends over to its celebrated rooftop bar for drinks in hopes of salvaging stay. But no. It was closed for a “private function.”

Many better options in this neighborhood. I hope they fix all the physical plant problems as the staff was nice.

title: Vacanza
text: Abbiamo soggiornato  1 settimana dal 28 agosto al 4 settembre a Le Meridien in tre persone , tutto bello vista spettacolare comodissimo a tutto , subway , central park , time square , lo consiglio messo in una posizione comoda, l unico incoveniente è  che adesso dovrei contattare la direzione dell 'hotel Le Meridien via mail per un fatto spiacevole e da chiarire , chiedo alla direzione che mi contatti urgentemente .

title: Great hotel, great location, super clean
text: I stayed at this hotel for the first time. It was beautifully decorated, amazing location and super clean and comfortable. They had everything I needed for my stay and a beautiful roof top bar. Great place.

title: Great location - very disappointing hotel
text: Pros:  The bed was comfortable, sheets were clean and the bathroom shower was roomy with good spray.  Cons:  Our room was the smallest hotel room that I have ever stayed in.  The window had no sheers just heavy, depressing huge dark brown drapery.  So, we could either have no exterior light or reveal ourselves to the guests of another hotel whose rooms we could see into. Furniture was minimal and worn.  The A/C system was within a foot of the bed - noisy and humid.  The hotel restaurant, Kingside, had tasteless food and inattentive service.  Only 2 bath towels and one robe were in the room.  Our first request for additional towels went unheeded; we then got the towels upon 2nd request.  No complimentary toiletries (shower cap, Q-tips, make-up pads) were in the room and there was only 1 small bar of soap provided.  The closet was tiny with peeling wallpaper.  No dresser or drawers because there was no room.  This is not a 4-star hotel.

title: Not up to par for a Le Meridien
text: I have stayed at many Le Meridien hotels and this one was disappointing.  Rooms were small and dark and were dated despite being remodeled.  Several bulbs were out in my room and I had to call down to have soap delivered.  The downstairs restaurant was decent.  The lack of a club lounge was also a disappointment.

title: Great service good location too
text: Stayed here for a biz trip. The hotel is in a good location if you need up and downtown lines. Room was ok, pretty standard. Drain in bathroom seemed clogged, which was a little gross. Doorman Raphael helped me out a ton, he is the man. Great service!

title: Best quick vacation ever
text: Love this hotel! It’s beautiful, clean and close to everything. The staff was wonderful, specially Mirian Ortega who hooked us up with the Jr Suite with a great view. Will definitely go back and refer to friends and family!

title: Nice Place to Stay
text: Staff was very pleasant and the room was comfortable. However, my door lock did not work and the mini fridge was not fully stocked. Even with those two issues I still enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Disappointing
text:
Location is great. Staff was helpful. Disappointed with the room.

1. Rooms are small. Bed is 15” high. Too low for people who have had back, hip, or knee surgeries unless they’re under 5’. Asked for accessible room and none were available for our stay. We were told they also had low beds. 
2. Makeup mirror in bathroom could not be tilted. You have to be 6’ to see your reflection. No counter space in bathroom or room. 
3. Espresso machine with lukewarm water versus coffee pot
4. Lights dim/yellow hue
4. Lounge bar on ground floor and roof top bar standing room only. Half the seats were reserved for parties. Not a place to relax and enjoy a drink.
5. No business center. Had to give a thumb drive to Concierge to print e-check for mobile deposit. 

Thought about changing our reservation after the first night but decided to stick it out for two more nights.

At least the place was clean minus the robe hanging in the bathroom with a stain on it.

title: Not up to the task
text: We have had great luck in the past with all Marriott Brands. This hotel has a great location for what we need. The hotel itself seems dingy and has a high humidity in the rooms and common areas. The staff at the front counter are friendly, except for one of the front desk managers (John) who was less than friendly or helpful with a booking problem. The rooms are okay, but we had no robes so we ordered two. They did not show up until the next day when we told the clerk at the front desk. For $400.00 per night you would expect to have more than 2 towels for two guest. The bed does not have a box spring, just a mattress on the Art Deco platform.  They provide a Illy coffee espresso machine but only two pods.  The lobby area is dirty looking (not a good first impression) the rooms are average and IMHO are priced up there with many “fine” hotels.

title: Weekend Broadway show trip
text: We stayed at the Le Meridien for a weekend of Broadway shows. Location was the best feature, with convenient access to multiple subway stations and also Central Park.  Doorman Raphael was very attentive, and made our stay even more comfortable.

title: NOt in keeping with the brand
text: The rooms were not maintained well. AC was not working. Technician had to be called at 2:30 AM to fix it. The phone handset was not working and had to use the speaker function. Housekeeping took over 30 mins to deliver a dental kit. Manager was responsive after checkout and offered a partial credit of points for essentially a really lousy stay. They ought to have refunded the entire stay or offered another night

title: Nice hotel and location, room was nice but small lobby.
text: Nice hotel for the location to central park. I have been in much nicer Le Meridien hotels and this one was more basic to me. Rooms were nice and clean. Lobby small and almost no lobby actually. The restaurant is not actually part of the hotel but nice and good breakfast.

title: Good Location, Cozy Rooms but Connecting Doors are a Drag
text:
Stayed at the Le Meridien on a recent summer weekend. I appreciated the location close to Central Park and the F 57th Street train stop. The Shops at Columbus Circle are also nearby. I received a rare Titanium upgrade to a high floor with a park view. Room was tiny but functional and well appointed. 

Checked out the rooftop bar. Was palatable early in the evening but descended into DJ din for the mostly Millennial clientele as the night wore on. Nice park views. 

Even though I scored an outstanding AAA rate of $205/night, I can’t give the property five stars. The connecting doors between rooms presented challenges for sleeping late or turning in early. Small children’s voices and their parents’ cackles could be heard from the suite next door. Almost called the front desk when a guest in the same suite decided to kick the connecting door for no reason. 

The sink and shower stall did not drain properly. The interior corridors were dark and depressing. The HVAC system cycled on and off so frequently that I had to completely turn it off. 

May stay here again but will more likely check out some other Marriott family properties in the area.

title: Fab Location, Trendy Room, Loved Our Stay
text: We actually stayed here when it was still the Viceroy so the rooms may have  changed since, but when we were there the rooms were really cool and really comfortable. The best thing though was the location, literally like 5 mins (less than) from Bergdorfs and Central Park. We occasionally got a yellow cab / the subway but mostly walked everywhere because it really wasn't far at all. Recommend for location alone, but as I say the room was also beaut, so win-win.

title: Not quite 4 star
text: What great room—nice layout, that was comfortable despite the efficient size. However, my room had a thick heavy smell of smoke. I was quickly transferred to another room, but it too had an odor. The next day I upgraded to a suite; maybe things would be better in a more expensive room. Disappointingly, it was not. Again, the accoutrements were distinctive and the room comfortably furnished. But there were little flying bugs in the washroom (which sometimes flew into the main room). When taking a shower, I found myself in increasingly high standing water: the drain in the shower did not work. How did the cleaning staff miss that (didn’t they clean the shower)? Some of the things could have easily been caught by hotel staff (smoke smell, clogged shower drain). I’m surprised that a hotel of this caliber came up short on so many things. The service was polite and responsive, but I waited over an hour to shower after a long day, and then had to hope there were too many of those insects in the room. Needless to say, I didn’t have a restful night’s sleep.

title: Won’t be fooled again.
text:
I booked the hotel thinking I was returning to Le Meridien Parker but discovered that the Parker is now a Hyatt and Le Meridien moved next door into what was a boutique property.  

All I can say is yuck.  ...well I guess I can say more. 

The rooms are insanely small and dark.  I think they are trying to go for a nautical theme perhaps because the rooms are like a tiny stateroom.  The bathroom was awful.  The sink was falling off the wall - not kidding.  Could not set my toothbrush on it because it would slide off onto the floor.  There is no lobby to speak of.  And I could hear everything going on in the drab hallway.   

I’ve learned my lesson.   ...and this reinforces my view that Marriott has no idea what to do with this brand.  This property is worse than a Four Points.

title: Excelencia
text:
Excelente ubicación, la habitación cómoda y limpia. 
Un excelente trato de todos sus trabajadores , siempre amables, con una sonrisa, y dispuestos en ayudarte en todas tus necesidades. 
Muy especialmente la amable manager cuyo nombre es Paula Tito. 
Y el guardia de seguridad, muy amable y atento hasta el ultimo momento que estuve hospedada. Su nombre, Rafael Tavares. Volveria a hospedarme feliz alli. 
Maria Graciela Gonzalez. Caracas- Venezuela-

title: Not Up To Meridien standards
text: I was unaware this was a takeover of another hotel. Yet they made no changes. rooms were dark/small, furniture was worn/weathered and utter lack of convenient power outlets to charge devices in this day and age.

title: Above and Beyond
text:
This is my second time staying here for business, but the first time since the renovations. The hotel was as expected, small but chic and efficient rooms.

The staff was warm and helpful, and I especially want to recognize Ricardo, who went above and beyond in his effort to find me a taxi close to 5 pm, even carrying my bag and directing me to the appropriate cross street to hail one. It is kindness and details like this which build customer loyalty. Thank you!

title: Good location, anonymous hotel
text:
If you look for a well located hotel go there.
Rooms are poor but clean.
Service quite poor, from office ok, concierge ko.
Restaurant ko, unprofessional 
Luck of quality .
Perfect to sleep but do not requir3 anything else.

title: Great Service!
text: Everyone was incredibly welcoming and hospitable.  The front desk agent who checked me in went out of her way to connect and build a personal connection with me.  The bellman were incredibly helpful with directions and suggestions for the area.  We ordered room service late night and the gentleman who brought up our chocolate cake was so sweet and kind!

title: Embarrassment for Marriott
text:
Absolutely terrible, as a lifetime plat / titanium I am still waiting for the refunds of the internet charges after several emails and voicemails and promises of credits still notta. The Hotel and Marriott customer service are less than subpar. Hotel bed is 4 inches off the ground and super uncomfortable, rooms are super tiny. Super dated and tiny. Prior to arriving called to inquire about the breakfast/lounge access was misinformed via phone and in person. Would have stayed in a different hotel if accurate info was provided. 
I do not recommend this hotel and Marriott should be ashamed to have taken over and not provided appropriate training. Spirit to serve has been removed all together and the executive office / customer service was not helpful in resolving issue either. I guess it’s time to leave the Marriott family.

title: Over rated
text:
The staff were amazing!

My room looked and was from the 70’s. The brass fixtures had no shine, and fell off when I went t to sh shower, it was clean, quiet and other than the roof top view not worth the $$.

title: Raphael is best doorman in Manhattan
text: Only had a couple dollars cash on me when leaving for the airport but Raphael insisted on helping me, claiming he doesn’t care about the money, he just enjoys helping good people. Nice hotel too, wish I had a better view, but good deal.

title: Decent hotel inconsistent service
text:
I’m kind of shocked how this hotel service wise doesn’t have it together. There were constant issues. Everything from check in to room service / housekeeping to the overall quality with the staff. Not sure if they were overwhelmed but it does need attention. 

Room overall is decent and the location otherwise is amazing. Food at their restaurant was fine too. 

I’d have given this a 4 star had it not been due to the service.

title: Perfect Location, walking distance from Central Park and Times Square
text: This hotel is not very big, but is very welcoming and clean. Upon our arrival we were told that we could valet park our car for a fee of $75 per night with no re entry privileges, that means that every time you use your car you pay additional $75. Nobody told us that we could self park at the same (close) garage for a lower amount. Aside from that, our stay was very comfortable, and I would highly recommend it also for families and small groups. Rooms come with a mini fridge, 1 free bottle of water daily and complimentary espresso machine with pods. Exercise room and rooftop bar are easily accessible.

title: Great Stay!
text:
The hotel is located in a great area.  Close to Fifth Ave, Central Park, and Times Square.  It is far enough away to be relaxing and away from the craziness.  

The rooms were nice as was the hotel itself.

The staff was great.  The doorman Raphael stood out in particular.  He was very friendly and helpful.  

I would definitely recommend this hotel as a place to stay in NYC.

title: Not the same
text: I used to love the Parker Méridien.  This property now branded as Le Meridien wasn’t up to par.  Very small rooms ( even by nyc standards) that we’re tired and needed an update. Best thing here is the rooftop bar.

title: Old hotel with questionable service
text:
This hotel is very old and has many issues, but if you get a room on the top floors you'll have a great view in an amazing location.

The issues:
Flickering lights (sometimes bright, most of the time dim)
Old, slow elevators (waiting 5-8 min for one to arrive)
Terrible ventilation (just... trust me, no fan in the bathroom!)

The service:
The front desk had an issue (not their fault) where they lost a reservation for some of our group members so some of us had rooms and others did not.
The bad part was that they refused to give a room to the group members that didn't have rooms despite us showing the confirmation email.
Eventually, after telling us they had 0 rooms available, they provided our group with rooms.
Further, I asked for a complimentary upgrade as a Gold Member and I was spoken to as if I was dumb for asking. They did end up placing me on a higher floor after the fact, which was odd because I didn't follow up or push it at all. Maybe a change of heart?

This is def not one of the better Meridiens, that's for sure. It reminded me of a motel 6 with a great location. Some coworkers stayed in the W (similar brand, also Bonvoy) and had 0 complaints.

title: Great service
text: The doorman Raphael was a legend. Super helpful. Room was NYC size but definitely comfortable and well equipped. All staff very friendly and courteous. That’s all I want to say- why does trip advisor make us use 200 characters minimum?

title: Hard to beat. Great Hotel, great location, great staff, great service.
text: I stayed at Le Meridien for three weeks, and I miss it. The staff was friendly, and the location was incredible. Only a few steps from Central park, and pretty much everything else. Even a nice 24 hour grocery store only 20 ft away that has everything you could imagine. The hotel also has one the most popular rooftop bars in NYC, with incredible views of Central Park. They had a DJ for the people inside most nights, but still had an option to relax and drink in the open air rooftop portion as well. The hotel restaurant is also a real hot spot, with great food and service. The hostess even remembered that I had a little three year old back home and wished me a happy fathers day when I came down for dinner. A couple of nights, the restaurant held some blockbuster movie premiers. One was for "The Dead Don't Die' movie and I got to run into Selena Gomez and a couple others. The rooms are very unique and upscale regal feel. My room had wood floor, brass fittings, walk-in marble tile shower, and the coolest bathroom mirror I've seen in a hotel (a second mirror is on a bracket and swings around to view all angles). Since converting from Viceroy, they also have a new sales staff that's top notch. I met Mirian, the new Director of Sales, and I could tell she really cares for the hotel and puts in a lot of effort into making the events, and guests, feel as welcome as possible. I would see in the lobby some mornings greeting all the guests coming and going.  The housekeepers were also some of the best I've experienced. The GM is quite a character too. With the new staff, the Le Meridien flag, and the Marriott brand backing them, this hotel is a no brainer. Again, I miss it and hope to go back sometime.

title: Best 30th birthday girlfriends getaway!
text: I have only great things to say about this hotel! The location is so close to everything and the Central Park and city views are perfection. The staff is very attentive and always available. The hotel has all the amenities I could ask for. Check out Kingside restaurant downstairs and of course The Roof rooftop bar, little pricey but all the drinks in NYC are - and it is worth this view!

title: Perfect for the night
text: Had a one night stay and the team provided seamless unobtrusive service. The arrival experience was 1-2-3 and the hotel's GM Shahram gave a courtesy call to ensure everything was to satisfaction. The amazing view of Central Park from the rooftop bar is the perfect backdrop. I'll be back.

title: Mr Narayanan
text: I am an avid business traveller and stay about 50 days a year in hotel rooms. The stay in Le Merridian was the worst experience with the hotel misplacing  8 pieces of my expensive shirts/ trousers/ t shirt which I had given for laundry. The response of the hotel staff was very disgusting to say the least as they lacked both accountability and responsiveness. The staff changed the narrative multiple times and what was promised to be delivered in 24 hours is yet to be found after 72 hours. As someone who is on a road show and travelling to multiple cities in the next 10 days, the behaviour by the hotel has put me in quite a distress. Sincere advice, avoid staying in this hotel if you are looking for a decent experience

title: Keep an open mind
text:
OK, so we like some others booked this hotel thinking that the former Parker Meridien had returned to the Meridien fold. Nope - that hotel, now known as the Parker New York, is now in the Hyatt family and confusingly is right next door to the "new" Le Meridien New York, formerly the Viceroy. (I should have known the price was too good to be true for that hotel.)

Now for the good part - we received a small upgrade to a room with a terrace, a low floor so no park view, but any NYC view is kind of fun. The room was "cozy" as booked, clean with new carpet, full of slightly worn but interesting art Deco wood furnishings and tiled bathroom, both of which add character and I hope are to be refreshed but not replaced. (Dear hotel - consider some leather mats to cover the scuffed end table and desk.). Air conditioning looked new, and worked great. Reception (VJ especially)was friendly, helpful, and extended our check out an hour to have breakfast. (Kingside was fine for breakfast, and also check out the roof bar for its views, although it might be crowded.)

Some nits - found an empty a water bottle on the terrace. Used the app to try to get more towels and got no response after 2 hours, but a call was answered and towels delivered promptly. 

So, not the hotel we expected, but warm, courteous, clean if a bit worn, and right now at a price point tough to match in this neighborhood.
